A group of liberals, angered by the lack of economic freedom and the slow pace of parliamentary reforms, formed a new faction in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politics.Libertarians are the revolutionary vanguard of liberal ideology, and they will go to any lengths to bring about the realization of the ideas of economic and political freedom both in $COUNTRY$ and abroad.
We cannot add a military target if someone added a military target §YStatus Quo§W
To intervene, a designated military target must have at least §Y$REQLEVEL$§W opinion of us

Since theNerchinsk Agreement (1689), the Russian Empire recognized the Aigun River and the mountains as natural borders between Russia and China.In the middle of the 19th century, the Russians crossed these borders in order to seize vast lands between the mountains and the Amur.Later, the Western Alliance fought the Second Opium War against China, burned down the summer palaces of the Chinese Emperor, and entered Beijing.A sly Major General namedNikolay Ignatiev was convinced that only Russian support for China would force the Allies to leave Beijing.The price for this support was the conclusion of the Beijing Convention confirming the annexation of the territory between the Ussuri River and the Pacific to Russia.Thus, Russia acquired 350,000 square miles of territory without firing a single shot.

In July 1860 the city of Vladivostok, or "Ruler of the East", was founded near the Korean border.It became the main Russian commercial port and shipyard.Ultimately, he became the reason for the construction of an intercontinental railway to connect with this scientific, cultural and large industrial center.The king dreamed that the city would become the center connecting the west with the east.Perhaps the railway to Vladivostok will eventually replace the Suez Canal as an exchange point for goods and raw materials between East and West?

The Russians demanded that we agree to the cession of our legal territory.It's outrageous, but we have no choice but to accept their demands.If we do this, then they must guarantee our independence from the rest of the European powers.Besides, we are too weak to fight if the Russians decide this issue by force.
We have no choice, we sign an agreement.
Let the Russians go to hell!
Ungrateful Chinese would rather watch their cities burn than agree to our legal demands! We may have to teach wits to our stupid Asian neighbors.
Where the Russian flag has already been raised, there it should never be lowered!
Power rank greater than or equal to
We have to negotiate with the §YWar leader§W, because we are the object of military claims and our leader has put forward §YStatus Quo§W.

On May 13, 1871, the Italian side unilaterally adopted the “Law on Guarantees? which aimed to resolve the “Roman question?The Pope received privileges similar to those of the king of Italy - a maintenance of three million lire, the right to receive and send ambassadors, the freedom to hold conclaves, and the freedom of postal and telegraph communications with other states.And although Pope Pius IX refused to accept the law, Rome became the capital of the young Italian kingdom, and the Pope could not do anything about it.

After the fall of the Ottoman Empire, the claims of the Turkish rulers to Roman imperial titles became only memories.Constantinople, "desired", became Greek again, after several centuries of occupation by Turkish barbarians.And this means that we, the proud descendants of the great Romans, can proclaim the restoration of the great state of our ancestors - the Byzantine Empire!

"His Majesty's Government is contemplating the establishment of a national home for the Jewish people in Palestine and will make every effort to promote this goal ..." we can express a favorable attitude towards the restoration of the Jewish state there.

Over the past millennia, progress has not stepped forward so far, which means that we can still be proud of the great project of our Babylonian ancestors.Given the rise of Iraq to the status of one of the leading world powers, voices have sounded in support of this construction, as the basis of the ideology of theNew Iraq.And with new technologies, who knows what we can do ??

"And love (the people on the streets) makes us change our attitude towards ourselves." and the honesty of our presence in the Upper Chamber.The Upper House is more and more often viewed as another bureaucratic institution that slows down any changes and reforms in the bud.The people are demanding a revision of the legislation concerning the Upper House in order to obtain more honest and equal representation.
Madness laughs, we break down under the weight of stress.
Why can't we give ourselves another chance?
Management costs are used to ensure the smooth operation of our state apparatus and the maintenance of officials, which increases the efficiency of tax collection.

“Hurrah! Hurrah! 
For Southern rights, hurray! 
Hurrah for the Bonnie Blue Flag that bears a single star! "
 
 The Bonnie Blue Flag was the first unofficial flag of the Confederate States of America.It was a blue cloth with a white five-pointed star.It was also the name of a popular hiking song that poet Harry McCarthy wrote in honor of this flag.Raise the Coveted Blue Flag and watch as recruits join the ranks of the CSA army.
A white five-pointed star on a blue background leads our troops into battle with the vile Yankees.

How factories are built depends on the political system.For example, in a market economy, only your capitalists build factories.But in the system now adopted in Belgium, both capitalists and a player can build factories.Building new factories is a good way to develop the economy.Click the Build Factory button in Belgian Wallonia.

In 1842, after the Arukstuk War, the Webster-Ashburton Treaty was signed in Washington.Under this treaty, the border between the British colonies in Canada and the United States was established along the 49th parallel, settled the issues of joint use by the British and Americans of the Great Lakes and obliged the parties to prohibit the slave trade on the Atlantic coast of Africa and strictly enforce this ban.

The British "Doctrine of the Deprived Possessions" was used in India to annex many quasi-independent Indian principalities.The doctrine prohibited Indian princes from appointing adopted children as their heirs, that is, only a son from his own father could get the land.Also, the British East India Company could annex lands under the pretext of mismanagement.Thanks to this doctrine, the British East India Company was able to annex Satara, Sambalpur,Nagpur, Jhansi and Avadh.Due to the current situation in our country, the British East India Company has declared our right to reign invalid.

The British "Doctrine of the Deprived Possessions" was used in India to annex many quasi-independent Indian principalities.The doctrine prohibited Indian princes from appointing adopted children as their heirs, that is, only a son from his own father could get the land.Also, the British East India Company could annex lands under the pretext of mismanagement.Thanks to this doctrine, the British East India Company was able to annex Satara, Sambalpur,Nagpur, Jhansi and Avadh.This doctrine was the last straw that overflowed the patience of the Indians.She led to the Sepoy uprising in 1857-1859.After the uprising, the British liquidated the East India Company and revised their policy towards the Indian feudal lords.Due to the plight of $FROMCOUNTRY$,
Now we have even more useless territories !.

in 1878-80s,Niels Adolph ErikNordenskj?ld, with the financial support of King Oscar II of Sweden andNorway, for the first time carried out a through (with wintering on the way) voyage through theNortheast Passage from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean and through the Suez Canal returned to Sweden (1880 ), for the first time bypassing the whole of Eurasia in this way.And although voyages through theNorthern Sea Route have been undertaken before, it is the voyage ofNordenskj?ld that is considered the first fully proven along this route.It has been widely celebrated.

The British South Africa Company was founded by the British imperialist tycoon Cecil Rhodes in 1889.The company was created in the image of the British West India Company and was created with the aim of facilitating the further colonization of South and Central Africa by the British.The Company's area of ??interest extended along the Zambezi River.This area became known as "Rhodesia" from 1895 and was named after Cecil Rhodes.

"Land of Kaiser Wilhelm" was the name of the network of German colonies in the Pacific Ocean, which included the northeast ofNew Guinea, the Bismarck archipelago and other, smaller German colonies in the region.In 1914, these territories were occupied by Australian troops, and after the end of the First World War, the land of Kaiser Wilhelm became "the territory ofNew Guinea", which was ruled by the Australian government.

The Great Idea is the iridentist conception of the Greeks under the yoke of the Ottoman Empire.It implied the creation of Magna Graecia, which was supposed to include all of Thrace, Constantinople, the Dodecanese Islands, Cyprus and the entire western coast of Asia Minor.The concept slowly went to its implementation throughout the 19th century, and was almost completely implemented after the First World War, because according to the Sevres Peace Treaty, almost all of these territories were transferred to Greece.But in the war for the independence of Turkey in 1919-1922, the Greeks and Armenians were defeated, and according to the Lausanne Peace had to give up almost all of their new acquisitions.

Motala Verkstad (Mutal Machine Building Plant) was founded by Balzar von Platen in 1822, during the construction of the G?ta Canal.Under the leadership of Otto Edward Karlsund, in the 40s-60s of the 19th century, the Mutala plant became one of the largest and most famous enterprises in Sweden.The plant is mentioned in Jules Verne's novel 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea as a manufacturer of a ram for theNautilus submarine.
Founded by Balzar von Platen in 1822, during the construction of the G?ta Canal, the Mutala factory is still one of the most famous enterprises in Sweden.

The Swedish constitutional crisis of 1914 was triggered by a sharp cut in defense spending by the liberal government of Karl Staaf.On February 6, 1914, King Gustav V made a speech of support and approval to a crowd of thirty thousand Swedish peasants who marched across the country to Stockholm to support their king, the Motherland and the Armed Forces.This was the last intervention of Swedish kings in the political life of the country ..
We are putting pressure on a foreign country on a specific issue.
A mysterious monster is sinking ships!
$YEAR$ year was marked by an amazing incident [...] The fact is that for some time, many ships began to meet in
Sounds like a retelling of the plot of some children's book.
A mysterious monster is sinking ships!
$YEAR$ year was marked by an amazing incident [...] The fact is that for some time, many ships began to meet in
Sounds like a retelling of the plot of some children's book.
Professor Aronax has been washed ashore!

A famous French professor and marine biologist, Pierre Aronax was discovered on the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ shore.Seven months ago, the professor went on a sea expedition in order to find out the whole truth about a giant cetacean monster that destroyed many ships.The professor told an extremely interesting and amazing story about his misadventures.The professor states that during a collision between his ship and a mysterious monster, he was blown overboard, and he found himself inside this very monster, which turned out to be a human ship capable of swimming under water.Aronax claims that this ship, piloted by the eccentric and desperate CaptainNemo, is home to an entire community of freedom-loving sailors who have renounced human society.It doesn't matter if the professor's story is true, the main thing is

The movement for the unification of Italy sought to include in Italy all the adjacent territories of foreign states, in which a significant Italian minority lived.Thus, Italian territorial claims extended much further than the lands in Italy seized by Austria as a result of theNapoleonic Wars, and included significant territories in Dalmatia and Austria.

A small island in theNorth Sea called Helgoland passed to Great Britain during theNapoleonic Wars, under the Kiel Peace Agreement of 1814.After the unification of Germany, the island became the object of territorial claims from the German Empire, since it was inhabited mainly by Germans.

Miskatonic University is located in the picturesque town of Arkham, on the banks of the gloomy Miskatonic River, in the beautiful County of Essex.Miskatonic University is one of the most prominent institutions of higher education inNew England.He is well known for his collection of curiosities, an extensive collection of ancient and occult books, his sports competitions, and among other things - excerpts from the legendary Book of Abon and the original manuscript of the "Nameless Cult" - the exemplary work of Friedrich von Juntzt.

The Valhalla is a neo-classicist temple overlooking the Danube, built between 1830 and 1842 in Bavaria.Designed by Ludwig I, the hall is a monument to prominent figures in German history, from Arminius to Copernicus.
The Valhalla Hall of Fame, designed by Ludwig I, is a monument to outstanding personalities in German history, from Arminius to Copernicus.

In 1848, the authorities of the Kingdom of Hanover decided to strengthen the popular representation in the State Church of Hanover and introduced the institution of Presbyterianism into it, and from now on all the church ones are entrusted to popularly elected elders.

The Gotthard railway tunnel was built from 1871 to 1881 in order to connect the cities of G?shenen and Airolo.The first tunnel to be built under the mountain range, the Gotthard Tunnel was a great and significant achievement of its time.

The Lambert Pact is a document used by France to justify its infiltration and subsequently the annexation of the kingdom of Imerina.The document was signed by Crown Prince Radama II and allegedly gave the French the right to export minerals and other resources from the island, in exchange for a 10% deduction from the cost of resources in favor of the royal house of Madagascar ..
After the local uprising of 1897, France, which had long formally included Madagascar in its sphere of influence, finally annexed the Imerin monarchy and deposed the local royal house ..
When the power announces the breakdown of alliances because of the revolution.
All our alliances and treaties have been terminated, and influence points have been reset to zero.
Union of the African People of Zimbabwe

In 1884, an international "Conference on the Congo" or "Berlin Conference" was held in Berlin, convened at the initiative of the German Chancellor Bismarck.The result of the conference was the "General Act", which secured for the great powers their present possessions in Africa, and also confirmed the status of the free state of the Congo as the personal possession of the Belgian kings.What will be the result this time? Host Congo Conference and Spin the Roulette! We must be prepared for the fact that sending out invitations, making a decision on participation in the conference, as well as the path of foreign ambassadors to our capital will take several months.

“I don’t want to miss the chance to participate in the carving of the African pie.?
- Leopold II, King of Belgium 
 
Preparations for the international conference on the status of African colonies in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ capital have been going on for a long time, and today $MONARCHTITLE$ is ready to send out invitations to the conference to representatives of all interested parties.The main issue of the conference will be the issue of the status of the Congo.One of the powers will receive the exclusive right to seize the lands of the Congo.Second-class powers and powers without colonial possessions, which, however, claim land in the Congo, will receive negotiating privileges.
Great, we are sending out invitations!
I think it would be wise to do nothing ...

$MONARCHTITLE$, $FROMCOUNTRY$ is hosting a major international conference on the division of Africa among the great powers.The main topic of the agenda is the issue of Congo ownership, and the most likely outcome will be that the entire Congo will fall into the hands of one of the powers.Most civilized countries have decided to send a representative to the conference, but it may turn out that the cost of sending a delegate from our country may be too expensive for our treasury.
do not want to miss the chance to participate in the carving of the African pie
I don't think this conference deserves our attention.

“The Free State of Congo is unique in its own way.I don’t hide anything from anyone and don’t owe anything to anyone ”
- Leopold II, King of Belgium 
 
The Congo Conference has finally come to a solution to the Congolese issue.The conference has ended and the General Act, released today, states that $COUNTRY$ will receive the exclusive right to govern, colonize and exploit the wealth of the Congo.The Free State of the Congo will be ruled by $COUNTRY$, but will formally be considered a separate state.This will help other powers to accelerate the establishment of trade relations with the Congo and help unlock the country's potential.
Demand another great power to recognize your leadership in a given cultural group.

Demand another great power to recognize your leadership in a given cultural group.All countries in the sphere of influence of this power, belonging to your cultural group, will be transferred to your sphere of influence.

The fertile lands along the Congo River are ideal for growing rubber.But, unfortunately, most of this land is either undeveloped or used by the aborigines to grow their meager food.The great economic interests of our country require nothing more than the profitable use of these lands, but local aborigines may be unhappy with the cultivation of rubber on their lands.What do you say, ruler ??
The aborigines will somehow hold out!
We are bringing civilization, not robbery!
Society for the Reform of the Congo

There are numerous reports from the Free State of Congo that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial administration is exploiting the indigenous population too brutally.Reports that aboriginal abuse, aboriginal beatings, multiple killings, and even genocide of entire nations are common in the Congo cast $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial politics in a very bad light.With the aim of changing the human rights situation in the Congo for the better, an international organization, the Congo Reform Society, was created, which included numerous distinguished writers, scientists and artists.

Multiple irregularities in colonial policy in the Congo led to strong international pressure on $COUNTRY$.The Free State in the personal domain of our ruler has received a barrage of international criticism due to overly brutal colonial criticism.Perhaps it would be more prudent to finally include the Free State in our country.
Society for the Reform of the Congo
An international organization created with the aim of making a difference in the human rights situation in the Congo.
After the Congo was declared the personal property of King Leopold II, it would be fair and logical to conduct an expedition to better explore this country, right?

The Franco-Italian explorer and pioneer Pietro-Paolo Savornan di Brazza explored many lands in Central Africa, in particular, lands west of the Congo River, and opened this region to French colonization.The capital of the French Congo, the city of Brazzaville, is named in his honor.

In 1857, Helmut von Moltke became head of the Prussian General Staff and immediately set about reforming the Prussian army.Under Moltke, a department of historical research appeared, "war games" appeared, which recreated the events of the White Wars and considered their mistakes, a department was created to study and cathologize the railways and telegraph networks of Prussia.The end result was the brilliant victories of Prussian weapons in the wars for the unification of Germany, the Prussian General Staff was considered one of the most advanced and effective in Europe.Moltke remained the head of the Prussian and German General Staff for over thirty years, and went down in history as one of the most ingenious strategists of the 19th century.
The Prussian General Staff is one of the most advanced and effective in Europe, but sooner or later other countries will catch up with Prussia.

Published on December 23, 1876, The Midhat Constitution (on behalf of Midhat Pasha, Grand Vizier of the Ottoman Empire in 1876-1877) was the first attempt to constitutionally limit the monarchy in the Ottoman Empire.Although the "Basic Law" was abolished by Sultan Abdul-Hamid in 1878, this constitution became an important milestone in Turkish history.

The Ruhr area, which includes the former counties of Berg, Mark and Kleve, is changing from day to day.New coal mines and mines open every day, railways are constantly expanding, new factories based on technologies bought from the British are growing like mushrooms after the rain.The Ruhr region is experiencing an unprecedented industrial boom, and the rest of Germany is going to have the same boom, if you support it.
Towns and villages across Germany are being transformed from sleepy medieval townships into modern industrial centers, thanks to the positive example of the Ruhr area.
Support industrialists from the Krupp family
Allies cannot intervene in civil wars.

During theNapoleonic Wars, the entire left bank of the Rhine was in the hands of France.In 1840, French Prime Minister Louis Adolphe Thiers publicly stated that in his opinion the Rhine was still the natural eastern border of France.This statement led to the "Rhine Crisis" - a major international scandal between France and the German states.

Built in 1889 as the entrance arch of the Paris World Exhibition of 1889, the Eiffel Tower is still one of the main symbols of Paris and France in general.Named after the architect who designed it, Gustave Eiffel, this tower was the tallest structure in the world for over forty years until 1930 - when it was surpassed by the Chrysler Building.
The whole world is amazed at the sight of this great brainchild of engineering!

The secularization of church property took place in Spain in the 1835-1837s, at the height of the Carlist civil war.This secularization infuriated the traditionalists and exacerbated the rift in Spanish society.During the secularization, many ancient monasteries were destroyed.

During the Second French Empire (1852-1870), Paris was radically rebuilt.The need for the reconstruction of the center of Paris has matured after the onset of urbanization and urban growth.The outskirts of Paris grew, but the center could no longer connect parts of the city with each other and was a cluster of medieval buildings.Wide, long and spacious boulevards remain the hallmark of Paris to this day

It was clear that most Austrians who would say yes to Schuschnigg on 13 March would say yes to Hitler on 10 April.Many of them believed that a strong alliance with Germany, even aNazi one, was desirable and inevitable for Austria, that Austria could not exist on its own for a long time, that it could only survive as part of the German Reich.
It's time for Germany to show who is boss in Europe.

Glorious St.Petersburg, the city of Peter the Great, is inconveniently adjacent to the border.Perhaps it would be prudent to move our capital back to Moscow, to the "First Throne", which will be more difficult for the enemy army to reach ...
Abolition of the right of women to vote
With the rollback of electoral reform, women no longer have the right to vote

Due to the loss of the lands bordering Istanbul, our capital is under threat.We must move her to a safer place - Ankara

Fascists support the implementation of social reforms, while trying to carry out a rollback in political.However, they will oppose any change if the ruling party does not adhere to the fascist ideology.
Reactionaries are always trying to roll back both political and social reforms.
Conservatives prefer to maintain the status quo, but given the highly aggressive population, they can also support reforms.
Socialists demand further social reforms, but they can also support political ones, provided the population is highly aggressive.
Communists want to carry out social reforms, but at the same time dream of a political rollback.
Liberals strive to further promote political reforms, but they can also support social reforms, provided that the population is highly aggressive.
Liberal anarchists demand a rollback of social reforms, and never support further reforms of any kind.

and our prestige in the eyes of the rest of the world has plummeted.

Precious metals are not traded on the world market, but immediately converted into money.

In addition to the regular army, our country can also deploy additional troops in case of war, filling them with recruits from among the conscripts.After the announcement of mobilization, our conscripted armies will begin to form in large population centers, gradually increasing their combat readiness.Although mobilized soldiers can be of great importance in repelling a massive enemy invasion, caution should always be exercised with their conscription into the army, as this has a huge negative effect on the national economy.

Having received the order to demobilize, our conscripts will leave the battlefield and return to their families.And although any country devastated by the hardships of war strives to return to normal life, we must first guarantee ourselves victory before putting the sword back into its scabbard.
Our monthly increase in diplomatic points is equal to §Y$VALUE$§W.

In Victoria II, you must define the objectives of any war you start.All possible war targets are shown on the right in the war declaration window.Remember that when making peace, you can only demand what is stated in the war objectives.\nClick on the War in Progress window to check your war objectives.

To try to forge an alliance with the United Kingdom, we must undertake diplomatic action.Diplomatic actions are very different - from an alliance proposal to a declaration of war.To take the action, we must have diplomacy points, they are accrued every month.On the top panel, we see that we have 1 point.Just so much is required to conclude an alliance.Press the forge an alliance button and then confirm your decision to form an alliance with Britain.
As a consequence of our irresponsible economic policies in the past, banks will only lend us at high interest rates.

This concept of Chinese philosophy is similar to the Western concept of the divine right of kings, and it has also historically been used to justify and substantiate monarchical power.After our recent rise to great power status, our subjects have again come to believe that our government is under the mandate of heaven.

Japan, the land of the Rising Sun.For many years after the black ships of the gaijin appeared on our shores, our nation followed in the wake of states more powerful than us.However, after our recent rise to great power status, everything has changed.From now on, let the winds reflect and scatter any foreign waves that dare to roll over the sacred shores of Great Japan!
Our dominant position among our cultural brothers allows us to form the power of $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$.
There are unemployed factory workers in the following regions:

Lately, a terrible fear has begun to grip you, seeing how silence begins to spread in the country.Where there used to be a free exchange of views and ideas, from street crossings and bus stops to bars and universities, only echoes of silence can now be heard.It becomes apparent that the traditions of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ democracy have been destroyed to the core.Government for the people, for the people and in the name of the people - no longer exists.
All they say is, "Give the world a chance!"

Try taking a loan.To do this, click the 'Take a loan' button, bring the slider to the desired number, and then click on the 'OK' button.

Revanchism (this word comes from the French 'revenge') - the desire to return the territories lost by the nation.In love, in war or in peace, our people will be ready to make great sacrifices in order to return our holy lands.

If you find yourself in danger of losing your status, you will receive a warning in advance, and you will have time to correct the situation.One of the ways to prevent a catastrophe is, of course, war.It can increase your prestige or lower your opponent's prestige.Find France and declare war on her.To do this, click on the 'Declare War' button, select a war target and then click 'OK'.

Camillo Paolo Filippo Giulio Benzo, Count di Cavour, Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Sardinia, was a key figure in the movement for the unification of Italy.He is especially credited with diplomatic efforts to secure support forNapoleon III against Austria during Italy's second war of independence.

On June 28, 1838, Princess Alexandrina Victoria of the Dynasty of Hanover was crowned the crown of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland under the name Victoria.Her reign, which lasted right up to the beginning of the 20th century, remained in the memory of posterity as an era of absolute heyday of the British Empire, over which the sun never set.The last British monarch of the Hanoverian dynasty, whose ascension to the throne ended the personal union between Britain and Hanover.Today, a jubilant metropolitan crowd escorts the young queen to her residence, the newly built Buckingham Palace.

She sneaks along the city streets, afraid of any shadow, because $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may be hiding behind them.The consecrated dial of the clock on the church tower seems to be following it with its huge yellow eye.She is late, but classes are still underway.\nThe clandestine university is based in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, where, despite the ban, they receive higher education in the language of the national minority.

The rise of liberal nationalism in the great power $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$ led to the fall of government in the state $FROMCOUNTRY$.A new parliament was convened, consisting of liberal revolutionaries from all over the country, which announced its unification under one flag.Parliament offered us the crown of this united state.We can accept this offer, but it will increase the concern of the international community, as well as demand from us political compensation for the revolutionaries.

With the invention of breech-loading rifles, mechanical drilling of rifling, semi-automatic rifles and other technical improvements in the development of weapons, the production of small arms increased significantly during the 19th century.

Throughout the 19th century, the development and production of basic ammunition saw many significant improvements.Advances in design - moving from muzzle to breech loading to semi-automatic rifles and machine guns - have led to a huge increase in ammunition production.
The Victorian era witnessed tremendous advances in explosives by humanity.The era, which began almost only with simple black powder, ended with the appearance of plastic explosives and nitroglycerin.

The industrial revolution of the 19th century affected almost every area of ??human activity, and the production of artillery was no exception.What was previously a lengthy process of casting bronze cannons - in the hands of industry luminaries like Alfred Krupp or Hiram Maxim - has become an exact science.

After the Crimean War, the Russian government realized that in the event of a new war with Britain, it would be almost impossible to defend its possessions inNorth America.Therefore, negotiations began to sell what would later become the forty-ninth state of the United States.The site was purchased by the United States in 1867 at 4 dollars 73 cents per square kilometer, or 2 cents per acre.The purchase was widely ridiculed in the American press of the time under the title "Seward's Refrigerator" or "Seward's Whim" because Secretary of State William Seward was the initiator of the deal on the American side.

The fishing rods cast by our envoy in Washington, Baron Eduard Andreevich Stekl, brought their catch.Today the United States offered us to start negotiations on the sale of the territory of Russian America.We're being offered 2 cents an acre and that's a fair price.It will be impossible to defend these colonies in the event of a war with Great Britain, so selling them at a reasonable price now is a perfectly worthy idea.$MONARCHTITLE$, what do you say?

An electronic tube (also known as a radio tube) is a device that works by flowing an electric current in a vacuum.As a result of thermionic emission (Edison effect), electrons leave the surface of the negatively charged cathode and move through the vacuum to the positively charged electrode (anode).Additional electrodes between the cathode and anode were added later, opening up the possibility of amplifying and switching signals.Vacuum tubes were essential for the production and commercialization of radios, telephones, televisions, radars, and early computers.

Until now, farmers have planted seeds by hand, putting them in a bag and walking around the field, scattering them.They threw them with their hands into the plowed and harrowed soil.The problem with this method is that it did not produce an even distribution of seeds.This was a waste of seeds and, therefore, a large part of it was wasted.Jethro Tall invented a seeder that could be harnessed to a horse.It consisted of a wheeled vehicle containing a box filled with grain.There was a wheel-operated ratchet that sprayed the seed evenly along the planter's entire path.

The Rotherham or Yorkshire plow was invented by Disney Stanforth and Joseph Foljamb.He was an improvement on the traditional plow.It was assembled from wood like a normal plow, but the rebar and opener (cutting blade) were made of iron.The blade and the share were also covered with iron plates.It was lighter than a traditional plow and could be easily handled by a pair of horses.

A telephone exchange is a system of electrical components used to connect telephone calls.The first telephone switch was invented by the Hungarian Tivadar Puskas in 1877, when he worked for Thomas Edison.Primitive telephone exchanges for commercial use appeared in 1881 in the eastern United States and Western Europe.Telephone exchanges consisted of hundreds of switches, where a staff of operators manually connected telephone line subscribers.Elmon Brown Stroger patented the first toggle switch in 1891 that could automatically connect subscribers.

Introduced at the beginning of the 17th century, the flintlock weapon quickly supplanted older types of incendiary mechanisms such as the samopal or wheel lock.It is still in common use for over two centuries, during which time the piston was replaced and the magazine system was later added.Although the flintlock weapon went out of mass production, it continues to be popular among fans of gunpowder shooting.

The French Revolution and theNapoleonic Wars also sparked a revolution in military strategy.The influence of this period was felt both in the American Civil War and in the early stages of the First World War.With the advent of cheap small arms and high population growth, the army grew rapidly in size, leading to a change in its structure.It was necessary to divide the army, first into divisions, and then into corps.Along with infantry units, divisional artillery also appeared - light, mobile guns with a firing range and power.A rigid formation of pickeners and musketeers, firing massive volleys, gave way to light infantry, who fought in small skirmishes.

A muzzle-loading rifle is a weapon in which a projectile and a propellant charge are loaded from the muzzle, in contrast to breech-loading rifles.The first manual muzzle-loading weapon appeared in the 40s of the 15th century.The most famous muzzle-loading rifle was the Kentucky Rifle, which was actually created in Pennsylvania.This is an American rifle based on the German 'Jager'.

A breech-loading weapon is a firearm in which a cartridge or projectile is loaded into a special chamber at the rear of the barrel.Despite the fact that breech-loading weapons were developed at the end of the 14th century, their widespread use began with the advent of precision engineering in the 19th century.

Sliding bolt is a mechanism of small arms firearms that provide opening and closing of the barrel bore by rectilinear translational movement of the bolt along the axis of the barrel.It was first used in 1824 by JohannNikolaus von Dreise in the rifle of the same name.European armies continued to improve this mechanism until the end of the 19th century, and in 1898 the Mauser Rifle appeared, one of the most successful and perfect systems of such weapons.

The Gatling Cannon, patented in 1861 by Richard Jordan Gatling, was the first weapon to produce controlled sequential fire with automatic loading.However, during the American Civil War, this weapon had serious shortcomings, and it was subsequently improved and widely used in the Franco-Prussian War and theNorthwest Revolt.This weapon was actively used until the beginning of the 20th century.The first self-powered machine gun was the Maxim Machine Gun, invented in 1885 by Sir Hiram Maxim.It used the recoil energy of the weapon, which had not been used in any way, allowing it to significantly increase the rate of fire than was possible in earlier designs.

Cuirassiers - mounted troops, equipped with armor and weapons, first appeared at the end of the 15th century in Europe.The first cuirassiers were well protected and used a firearm as their primary weapon.They gained great importance during theNapoleonic wars, and were last used at the initial stages of the First World War.Now cuirassiers are an integral part of solemn military parades in many countries of the world.

The word dragoon was originally called the mounted infantry - soldiers who were trained in both horse riding and infantry skills.However, the use of the term changed over the course of the 18th century and dragoons evolved into regular light cavalry.Dragoon regiments were created in most European armies in the late 17th and early 18th centuries.

Hussars belong to one of the types of light cavalry that originated in Hungary in the 15th century.The name and unusual shape of these riders later became widespread in European and other cavalry regiments.Hussars played a prominent role as cavalry in theNapoleonic Wars.Since they are cavalrymen on fast horses, they can be used for lightning attacks and for reconnaissance.

Military aviation is the use of aircraft and other aircraft in warfare.The feasibility of using heavier than air aircraft became apparent immediately after their appearance.The Wright model was acquired in 1909 for the US Army, and in 1911 the Italians used various types of aircraft for reconnaissance, photo reconnaissance and bombardment of targets as part of the Italo-Turkish War.During the First World War, military aviation received a powerful impetus in development, many specialized types of aircraft appeared, such as reconnaissance aircraft, fighters and bombers.

A free, sovereign and independent state called the Republic of Liberia was proclaimed by Joseph Jenkins Roberts.It is governed from neighboring Sierra Leone and is viewed by the Commonwealth and its parent organization by the American Colonization Community (ACO) as "private property" that cannot become a sovereign country.Nevertheless, the process of obtaining independence continues.Although the sovereignty of Liberia was reaffirmed by the United States government, the new republic received official recognition only during the Civil War.

The country, which a few years ago was just a colony, has grown in size and become strong enough to become a free, sovereign and independent state.The draft of the new Constitution is ready to be presented at a referendum.It guarantees basic civil rights and a separation of powers similar to those in the United States, but separating the new country from the American government.
We enjoy all the benefits of independence, and our scientific progress has accelerated towards Modernity.

The lands of theNorth have united to create a new nation - Scandinavia.A crowd of predominantly blonde men and women filled the main square of Stockholm at 5 am and shouted for the establishment of a new state order.Applause and nods of agreement were common on this day, and as evening approached, everyone became more frequent.The city was empty at 9 o'clock in the morning by order of the authorities.Police say the man who shouted "Glory to Scandinavia!" outside the house, was released without any punishment.

The rise of Western influence in Japan reached its climax.The feudal system that had controlled the islands for centuries was overthrown and the empire centered in Tokyo was rebuilt.A new era of social, political and economic reform was proclaimed on Sunday.Today the Shogun relinquished his power and the Meiji era (enlightened rule) came into its own.A bright future awaits the land of the rising sun under the rule of the new government, although some people believe that the new Japan will not be able to compete with European powers in Asia.

The opening day of the canal across the Isthmus of Panama is a day of pride for someone.The canal is 48 miles long and is actually a closed sluice 85 feet below sea level with intricate hatches at both ends.It was built in one of the most "painful" areas of the planet, so it is not so much a monument to engineering as a monument to medicine.The canal should quickly become an important addition to international maritime trade, and experts say the channel's owner will have a great strategic advantage.

In a sequel to Imperial Durbar in Delhi, a royal proclamation announcing Queen Victoria's title of Empress of India was read from a column in Trafalgar Square.India has not had a crowned ruler since the Mughal Empire was supplanted by the British East India Company.After the dissolution of the Company, it was argued that the Queen's authority over many Indian princes should be confirmed by the imperial title.Prime Minister Bedjamin Disraeli is considered to be the originator of this idea.

Horace Mann, a politician and lawyer, began reforming the Massachusetts educational system.His school system became a model for the whole country.Mann is known for his personal visits to every school in the state to learn about the situation in them, as well as for his travels at his own expense to Europe, where he learned about the details of the Prussian school system.He became famous as one of the earliest advocates of non-corporal punishment, which sparked controversy with many traditional teachers, which eventually ended in his favor.

American explorer Hiram Bingham discovered the remains of the lost Inca city of Machu Picchu in 1911.Built in the first half of the 15th century, at the height of the Inca empire, the citadel is believed to have been the estate of the Inca emperor Pachacuti, although some archaeologists have also suggested that it may have been purely religious in nature.Bingham became the subject of controversy, accused by Peruvian locals of stealing their cultural heritage when he tried to transport artifacts to the United States for further study.

$COUNTRY$: The International Socialist Conference in Zimmerwald was the first such meeting following the outbreak of World War II in August 1914.The terrible losses resulting from the fighting called delegates to condemn the war as a result of imperialism and call on the workers to resist its persecution.Many prominent figures of the socialist movement gathered at this meeting, including Lazzari and Modigliani from Italy, Lenin and Bobrov from Russia, the Germans Ledebourg and Hoffmann, the French socialists Bourderon and Merheim, and many others.

Swedish opera singer Jenny Lind was born in Stockholm in 1820.She made her debut with Der Freischutz (Free Shooter) in Stockholm in 1838, and her fame grew even further in the mid-1840s with performances in Europe and the United States.Jenny Lind was the first Swedish mega-star known for her expressive singing, exquisite and incredible vocal technique, and her sincere, natural and humble demeanor.Jenny has made a fortune with her concerts and opera performances, a large part of which she donated to charity.

Swedish writer August Strindberg (1849-1912) was one of the most talented personalities in world literature.Playwright, novelist and short story writer, his work showed frenzy and genius combined with naturalism, psychology and mysticism.The Red Room brought him to fame in 1879.It is a satire about the trappings and state of Sweden in the late 1870s.A versatile person, Strindberg possessed a fanatical hatred of emancipated women, was interested in science and the occult, and also tried his hand at painting, photography and alchemy!

To bolster the budget, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government in Madrid ordered the confiscation and sale of church property without any compensation.The tax privileges of the Catholic Church were abolished, and the state, in turn, agreed to bear the costs of maintaining the Church.Many liberals who believe that the Church was on the side of the Carlists in the recent civil war believe that the confiscation and sale of monastic property is an act of justice, as well as an opportunity for the productive use of the former church lands.

Local Venezuelan generalNarciso Lopez was executed by the Spanish colonial authorities in Cuba.He landed with a small group of people, trying to instigate a riot that would turn Cuba towards the United States, but was unable to succeed due to lack of popular support.The cruel treatment of prisoners of war by the Spaniards caused a wave of outrage in both the southern and northern states of the United States, even among those who did not support the expedition.Lopez's efforts, despite his defeat, inspired countless other soldiers of fortune throughout Latin America.

Spanish artist Pablo Picasso abandoned conventional painting ideas and began to use a much more conceptual style, influenced by sculpture and African art.One of the most influential artists of the 20th century, he spent most of his life in France.He inspired and developed many different styles, in particular he is famous for the co-founder of Cubism.Born with a remarkable talent, Picasso painted realistically in childhood and adolescence, then moved on to more abstract and experimental forms in adulthood.

Vatican, Rome: Pope Leo XIII's Encyclical On the Condition of the Workers begins with the words RerumNovarum.The encyclical says that the spirit of revolutionary socialist change began to penetrate more and more areas of society.The causes of the conflict, as the Pope argues, are quite clear: the overwhelming increase in industrial labor, the changing relationship between employers and workers, the accumulation of huge fortunes in a small circle of people and the poverty of the masses, as well as widespread moral degeneration.

The first Omani ship in theNew World, the Sultana, arrived inNew York in 1840, bringing the personal representative of the Sultan, Said ibn Sultan, to establish trade relations with America and to meet with the American government.Ruling without his brother, Said ibn Sultan moved his capital from Muscat (Oman) to Stone City, Zanzibar.It is famous for its very active foreign policy, aimed at trade agreements with the UK, France and the United States.At the request of London, he banned slavery among his subjects, which was one of the key industries in Oman before his rule.

TheNorwegian painter Edvard Munch (1863-1944) was instrumental in the development of Expressionism and Symbolism.His works shocked the upper classes of society to such an extent that they were even banned at first.His paintings raised awareness of the dire living conditions of people who were less fortunate in life.“Unlike other artists, he sees the very essence and writes it,?his friend defended.Executed in four different versions, Munch's most famous work, The Scream, was sold for the largest amount ever paid at an auction.

The son of a farmer and teacher, Ivar Osen (1813-1896) saw the need to reform theNorwegian written language, which until then was actually Danish.After several trips across the country through small villages and rural communities, he created a grammar and vocabulary for the "new"Norwegian language.Although his codification of the spoken language was too small to educate the people, many of his poems became popular songs.Shortly before his death, Osen's "new language" was officially recognized by theNorwegian parliament.

With the opening of Hawaii to influences from outside, new diseases began to visit the island.Leprosy was one of these disasters, and fearing the rapid spread of the disease, a leper colony was established on the island of Molokai for the victims of the quarantine.Belgian missionary Father Damien offered his services to monitor the colony and work for the benefit of the victims of the infection.Considered a martyr, he died of an illness that overtook him after sixteen years of caring for the sick.

In 1848, a slave revolt took place in the Danish Virgin Islands.Governor Peter von Scholten decided to free them rather than use force to suppress the protests.Von Scholten stated that the reason for the dissatisfaction was the law of 1847, which stated that a child born of a slave was free.Scholars believe that his life with Anna Hegaard, a woman of color, influenced his views on this issue.Von Scholten's actions met with resistance from the planters.He was recalled to Denmark and put on trial, but was later acquitted by the Supreme Court.

The body ofNapoleon Bonaparte, who died in 1821 on Saint Helena, was exhumed and returned to France in December 1840.During the first days after his funeral at Les Invalides in Paris, hundreds of thousands paid tribute to him.In his last will, Bonaparte begged to be buried on the banks of the Seine, among the French people he loved so much.Buried with the sword he carried at Austerlitz and Marengo,Napoleon's body rests in a sarcophagus placed on two marble slabs in a circular crypt without a ceiling.

At the age of 67, the emperor of Austria-Hungary Franz I died, after which his son Ferdinand I, rich in mental and physical disabilities, ascended the throne.Because of Ferdinand's inability to rule, the so-called "Geheime Regierungskonferenz" (secret government conference), which included Metternich, offered the emperor daily control of the government.The regents insisted on the legitimacy of the new ruler and recognized him fit for reign under their leadership.Ferdinand's only position on this matter was the phrase: "I am the emperor and I want dumplings."

The Bavarian princess Elizabeth, nicknamed Sisi, married the Austrian emperor Franz Joseph I in 1854.Her unusual manners, often completely disregarding etiquette, endeared people to her.Brought up in a very relaxed and free environment at the court of her father, Maximilian Joseph of Bavaria, she often ran away from school to go horseback riding in the country.Fascinated by the personality and beauty of Elizabeth, Franz Joseph I broke off his engagement to her older and more pious sister, ignoring the arguments of his mother, and demanded that Sisi become his wife.

Valhalla, a classicist monument styled after Greek temples and named after a legendary afterlife from northern mythology, was unveiled last week in Donaustauf, near Regensburg in Bavaria.This majestic memorial is a famous landmark located above the Danube, so huge and magnificent that it can be seen from afar.In this hall of fame, busts of famous Germans are exhibited, not only of fallen soldiers, as in its mythical namesake, but also of scientists, writers and artists, both men and women.

King Ludwig I's romance with the dancer Lola Montes, whom he made a countess, brought about the end of his reign.Eliza Rosanna Gilbert (her real name), until today Countess of Landsfeld, was Ludwig's mistress since 1846 and was not popular with local residents who were against her being recognized as a citizen of Bavaria and being elevated to a noble title.Conservative Catholic circles protested and objected so strongly to their relationship that the king was forced to abdicate.

News from Prussia: Last Sunday, King Frederick William III died at the age of 70.After his ascension to the throne in 1797, he became known for his efforts to restore the morality and dignity of his dynasty, which were undermined during the reign of his father.His reign was also marked by events such as theNapoleonic Wars and the peculiar influence of his wife, Louise of Mecklenburg-Strelitz, in the king's private life and Prussian politics.His eldest son, Frederick William IV, a romantic, succeeded the throne.

Last Sunday, King Frederick William III died at the age of 70.His reign was also marked by events such as theNapoleonic Wars and the peculiar influence of his wife, Louise of Mecklenburg-Strelitz, in the personal and political life of the king.His eldest son, a romantic, became the successor to the throne.

News from Prussia: This month Berlin saw the opening of the first German zoological garden with a huge selection of exotic animals.Martin Heinrich Lichtenstein, a zoologist at the University of Berlin, convinced King Friedrich Wilhelm IV to donate a plot of land for this garden at the expense of the king's pheasant nursery in the Berlin Tiergarten.The king also provided a significant amount and donated the first animals from his menagerie and pheasant nursery.Other such gardens, already in existence in London and Antwerp, are becoming very popular in Europe.

This month Berlin saw the opening of the first German zoological garden with a huge selection of exotic animals.The first animals were donated by King Frederick William IV from his menagerie and pheasant nursery.Other such gardens already exist in London and Antwerp.

After careful preparation, King Frederick William IV of Prussia issued an order to the Cabinet of Ministers, effective from next month, in which Jews are ordered to present an official declaration where they must choose a surname within fourteen days.It will become the official surname of the person, which will be inherited by any children who appear in the future.Until now, there have been no official rules regarding the establishment of fixed surnames for Jews in all German territories.They are also now obliged to serve in the army.

A new Prussian law, in effect next month, orders Jews to present an official declaration where they must choose a surname that their children will inherit within fourteen days.They are also now obliged to serve in the army.

Prussian astronomer Johann Gottfried Halle announced the discovery of the planetNeptune this week.The existence of this planet was confirmed by Halle after observing disturbances in the orbit of Uranus.They were spotted by his colleague Urban Le Verrier, who asked him to trace a specific area of ??the sky to find possible planetary bodies.After that, Halle and his assistant Heinrich Louis d'Arr? noticed an unknown new star of magnitude 8 around the indicated position, which confirmed the presence of a new planet.

The Little Wives of Windsor is a comedy opera based on Shakespeare's play of the same name, which premiered today at the Royal Opera House in Berlin, Prussia.The opera by OttoNicolai with the German libretto by Solomon Hermann Mosenthal consists of three acts and lasts about two and a half hours.The music was written over the course of three years byNicolai himself, and is already considered by critics the masterpiece and greatest success of OttoNicolai.

The Little Wives of Windsor is a comedy opera based on Shakespeare's play of the same name, which premiered today at the Royal Opera House in Berlin, Prussia.Critics are overjoyed and praise the opera as OttoNicolai's masterpiece and greatest success.

The comedy opera "TheNaughties of Windsor" based on the play of the same name by Shakespeare was shown for the first time in Berlin today.Critics point out that this is OttoNicolai's greatest success.

News from Prussia: The Krupp company in Essen has provided a health insurance fund for all its 970 employees.Membership is imposed by the company management as mandatory.This move is considered by many to be very advanced and progressive for the current era, and could possibly become a model for future social reforms that the population could take advantage of while others see the initiative as socialist folly and a gross violation of employees' personal freedom.

News from our correspondent in Berlin: Following the example of Great Britain, this month the Prussian government, under the influence of some religious and public figures, passed a law strictly regulating child labor.Prior to this, all efforts to approve laws met with opposition from politicians who saw the initiative as a threat to industrial growth.However, many see the law as a first step against child abuse as a cheap labor force.

Music news: 42 choral communities from the Rhineland, Baden, Hesse and Franconia meet in Frankfurt to celebrate the three-day Mozart Music Festival.Donations were raised in preparation for the event, and hospitable accommodations were organized in preparation for the influx of singers.Thousands of people gathered on the banks of the River Main to greet them.Even the lanterns were filled with the amusement of the spectators waving their headscarves and rejoicing.However, the event reportedly quickly turned into a demonstration in the name of the political unification of Germany.

The German government in Schleswig has proposed reducing the number of anti-German elements by promoting German-language education and expelling Danish citizens still living in the province.The history of the conflict between ethnic Danes and Germans in the region has been going on for many decades, since the annexation of these territories many years ago.Although the Germanisation of the region has always been a priority, many pockets of resistance still exist.This proposal is currently being discussed in the Reichstag.

The theater troupe of the Duchy of Saxe-Meiningen performed in Berlin with great success.The troupe's popularity has grown steadily in recent years.She concentrates on a style that seeks to integrate design, conceptualization and performance of theatrical art through the use of real costumes and sets, as well as through the fluidity of action and the natural integration of actors and environments.Soon they will begin a series of tours throughout Europe.

Five years ago, Karl Hagenbeck, the son of an animal dealer, gave his first talk about exotic peoples such as theNubians and Inuit in Hamburg.Three years later, he elaborated on the concept, founding a circus that relied on training animals without the use of force.This month, Hagenbeck opened his open-air zoo in Hamburg, the Hagenbeck Zoo, a one-of-a-kind zoo where animals are presented in their natural environment and where the innovative idea of ??dividing visitors and animals with ditches rather than trellises was introduced for the first time.

School Director Konrad Duden published his Complete German Spelling Dictionary this month.It should become the foundation of German spelling in the coming years, and many scholars claim that it is a completely new work, which should be the final version of the German dictionary.With twenty-eight thousand entries, the dictionary is also becoming accepted in government and bureaucratic circles, being the source of the correct spelling of official documents, and now serves as the standard of quality in the German administration.

A plan was announced yesterday to connect Constantinople and Baghdad with the help of the Baghdad Railway, a German-funded project.Useful for both Germans with economic interests in Iraqi oil fields and residents of Constantinople who can connect with cities as distant as Ankara and Konya, this project is seen as controversial, causing conflicts with the interests of other great powers.However, it is highlighted as one of the highlights of the Berlin-Constantinople relationship.

Princess Alexandrina Victoria of the House of Hanover ascended the throne of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland as Queen Victoria.Today, a jubilant London crowd escorted her to her residence at the newly built Buckingham Palace.People of all walks of life and denominations are delighted to see a new monarch taking her place as ruler of Great Britain, and the Queen herself is reportedly looking forward to the challenges and challenges that will accompany her reign.Her father, George III, will be sorely missed by the British people.

Princess Alexandrina Victoria of the House of Hanover ascended the throne of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.Today a jubilant London crowd escorted her to her residence at Buckingham Palace.People of all walks of life and denominations are delighted, and she looks forward to the challenges that will accompany her dominion.

Charles Dickens' novel Oliver Twist was published in 1838 in London.In it, he drew attention to poverty and the lack of rights among workers at that time.In the story of an orphan boy who went through an orphanage and a workhouse, and eventually joined a gang of street pickpockets in London, the novel sheds light on what is called the "great London street child crisis", drawing attention to the large number of orphans on the streets of London while.It is likely that Dickens, the greatest writer of the Victorian era, was himself a beggar as a child.

$COUNTRY$: Queen Victoria married her first cousin, Prince Albert of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha.Unlike many other marriages of the time, this one was based primarily on mutual affection, and not on dynastic calculations.Albert became an influential figure at court and an important companion and adviser on government affairs to his wife, the Queen.The wedding meant that young Victoria was no longer socially constrained to live with her mother, so the expulsion of the Queen's mother from Buckingham Palace soon followed.

The second volume of poetry by William Yates, The Rose, was published in 1893.Now his voice has become something more than just original, and his control over rhythm and rhyme seems to be just genius.Currently, Yates, developing Irish themes, began his long association with Irish republicanism, mixed with aesthetic mysticism.An Irish nationalist in his youth, Yeats hid his beliefs in recent years and remains at a distance from radical nationalist movements and the turbulent political scene of the second half of the nineteenth century.

The collection of poems by Gerard Hopkins was published posthumously in 1918, although Hopkins himself did not care about printing his works during his lifetime.His poetry introduced the world to a new rhythm known as the drunken rhythm and gave impetus to the growth of modernist teachings.Hopkins' poetry was modernist, but at the same time he was considered a religious poet.He converted to Catholicism in his youth and was a student and professor of medieval Christian philosophy.

FlorenceNightingale has been recognized worldwide as the founder of modern nursing.During the recent war, the British Minister appointed her Lady Commander of 38 nurses in military field hospitals.The success of this commission led to the creation of the first nursing school in England and to the emergence of a program for the study and reorganization of the British Army's medical service.Nightingale also works in public health, hospital administration and health reform.Glory shines over this angel, popularly known as "the lady with the lamp."

At the Oval in London, England and Australia played the most memorable international match in history.In a three-day game that swung back and forth, the English side have failed at least seven times, trying to beat the Australian in the final innings.The match was so exhilarating that one spectator died of a heart attack.The Sports Times published this obituary: “in memory of the English cricket who died yesterday in the Oval and is mourned by a circle of fans and acquaintances.Rest in peace".The body will be cremated and the ashes taken to Australia.

The respected naturalist Charles Darwin, based on notes made during his voyage to distant shores aboard the Beagle, and summarizing the observations of many of his contemporaries, published The Origin of Species, in which he argues that all life forms on Earth slowly evolved over time.time through a scientific process known as natural selection, and not through an act of divine creation.His views are hotly contested, and will undoubtedly be contested hundreds of years from now.The book is written for non-specialists.

The murders of at least six prostitutes by Jack the Ripper shocked and frightened all Victorian institutions.The anxiety caused by these killings indirectly drew the attention of the British public to the extreme poverty and disorder that reigned on the streets of east London, especially in Whitechapel, where the killings were committed.Rumors among traders attribute the killer's ability to evade capture due to his high position.The details of the atrocities are too horrible to be published in this newspaper.

$COUNTRY$: Lord Dalhousie, Governor General of India, introduced a series of reforms that were unpopular in some quarters, but extremely effective.Through infrastructure development, expansion of railways, metal bridges, telephone lines, military and medical reforms, and a set of special legal tools called the Doctrine of Ownership leading to the annexation of new lands, Dalhousie not only expanded British power in the subcontinent, but and accelerated the rise of anti-British sentiment among the local population.

$COUNTRY$: The signing of the treaty with the people ofNew Zealand was completed by signing it, where the leader of the Maori people recognized the authority of Queen Victoria, and she, in turn, guaranteed the natives the opportunity to manage their lands, estates, forests and fishing grounds.The Maori and English versions of the signed treaty differ, raising doubts as to whether the document has been agreed upon.According to the British version, the Maori agreed to be governed by a governor, and the natives version says that they should retain a greater degree of freedom and autonomy, while managing their affairs on their own.

$COUNTRY$: Disappointed with Britain, Maori chief Hon Hecke cut the British flag off the flagpole three times, marking the beginning of the First Maori War.Very tenacious, emboldened by early successes, but economically limited, deprived of food supplies, the natives quickly died in epidemics, and eventually the Maori leaders asked for a ceasefire.The British retained their grip onNew Zealand, but the rebellious Maori leaders further strengthened their position, gaining the respect of other tribes.

Professor Hitchhock discovered the remains of fossil birds near the Connecticut River in Massachusetts.Some footprints indicate that they were made by some kind of giant bird species.
In honor of Dr.Engelhard, the first person to find the remains, Dr.von Meyer named the new giant lizard Plateosaurus engelhardti.It appears to be related to Iguanodonts and Megalosaurs.
This amazing lizard has its teeth in nests, rather than attached to the jaw like in modern reptiles, said Drs Riley and Stutchbury, who discovered the lizard.
Dr.Ed Delongchamp has discovered a new raptor that has ribs, a neck, and limbs.He believes that the animal is related to megalosaurs.
Dinosaurs is the name Professor Owen proposed for a new tribe of fossil dinosaurs that includes the Megalosaurs and Iguanodonts.They are known for their large size.
A new marine reptile has been discovered.Professor Owen named her Cetiosaurus, which means 'Whale lizard'.
A heart-shaped tooth was discovered in Wiltshire, England.After analyzing it, Professor Owen decided to give her the name Cardiodont.
After finding several Iguanodont jaws, Dr.Mantell discovered his mistake in attributing the jaws to this animal, and now he believes that the jaws belong to a different species.
Biologist Richard Owen creates the first life-size sculpture of an extinct giant reptile found in South Africa andNew Zealand.He calls them dinosaurs.
Dr.Leidy discovered two new dinosaurs in America, which he named Trakhodont and Deynodont.Other previously unknown species were also found, named Paleoskinkus and Troodon.
It looks like this new dinosaur is close to the Iguanodonts.Dr.Leidy believes that this animal walked in an upright position on two legs.
A new species of dinosaur called Compsognathus was discovered.Dr.Wagner claims that this lizard is a relative of birds, but this has yet to be proven.
A well-preserved feather was found and Dr.von Meyer named it Archeopteryx, which means 'Ancient Feather' or 'Ancient Wing'.
After Dr.Johnston discovered several teeth of a reptile fossil, which he named Astrodonts, Dr.Leidy supplements the name by adding a specific epithet in his honor.

The collapse of the securities market!

$COUNTRY$ is experiencing a rainy day - the financial center of $CAPITAL$ cannot recover due to the bursting bubble of speculation.Property prices have been on the rise in recent years, and while some analysts have long warned that prices are overpriced due to inflationary overconsumption, bulls in the market have ignored their warnings.The government is hearing demands to regulate banking and currency, calls for an end to the problems of "wolf capitalism."
Balance the state budget, reduce regulation, pursue sound monetary policy
Our country is experiencing the consequences of a stock market crash.

The collapse of the $CAPITAL$ securities market is turning into something much worse: people's confidence in banks has fallen, there is a continuous stream of withdrawals.While people are trying to save their savings, more and more banks and lending institutions are going bankrupt, and soon, like a chain of dominoes, the entire $COUNTRY_ADJ$ financial market collapses.The impact spills over to other industries in the private sector, loan defaults begin, savings melt.Then, due to the bankruptcy of entire industries, huge masses of unemployed appear.Due to the close interconnection between the economies of Western countries, the crisis is rapidly spreading throughout the world.From now on, it is known as the Great Depression of the $YEAR$ of the Year.
These are only temporary difficulties.There is no need to look for the guilty ...

Since there are no laws in the country of $COUNTRY$ to restrict or regulate the activities of banks, some of them issue their own banknotes.While many say that the savings earned by ordinary people should not be trusted by the private sector, in one area the situation is exactly the opposite: many banks give people the freedom to choose which one to store their money in, as well as banknotes that they can trust.
There is always a chance of a private organization going bankrupt - and then what?
If people are happy, I don't mind

A newly formed railway company in one of our regions issued shares to finance the development of its enterprise and is now looking for buyers and investors in the region.The CEO of the company asked local politicians to help advertise these actions, citing the fact that the development of the railway in the region would only bring benefits.Some argue that the involvement of politicians will violate the principles of non-government interference in the affairs of private companies.Others see only an opportunity to make money.
Of course, we must help such a noble private initiative
I think the less government intervenes, the better

Our government has acquired a central bank long ago.Now some are calling for the imposition of a tight government monopoly on the issue of money into circulation.Monopoly supporters argue that this will enhance economic stability, while opponents see it as undermining the foundations of free trade.
The central bank of our government maintains a tight monopoly on the printing of money.

Greenwood & Burns - Selling at 9.76, Buy at 9.5! "Etman and Sons", I sell, I sell at 8.12! "\n \nA local businessman in one of the provinces opened a joint venture to trade on the local exchange - mainly commodity.Undoubtedly, the exchange will help the local economy!
There is a local stock exchange in this province, it increases the production in the province.

In one of the regions, a massive withdrawal of funds from the bank began today after the news that the banknotes it issued were not backed by liquidity.The situation attracted the attention of parliament - opponents of the free banking system used the opportunity to once again oppose it, demanding from the government tighter regulation of the banking sector.They are opposed by powerful industrial and free-trader lobbies.
Free banking system - the basis of free trade
We will not allow grabbers to dictate the economic policy of our state

The economy of our country has entered a period of rapid growth after long years of low unemployment and high living standards of the population.A significant amount of savings, high productivity, as well as new economic instruments and the establishment of investment banks mean that our country is more ready than ever to develop a national industry and reach a new level of prosperity.
Our economy is booming thanks to our investment banks and a long period of low unemployment.

A large company in one of our regions recently went bankrupt: it worked for a long time at a loss.Local politicians have asked the government for support, arguing that the downturn is temporary and the company will get back on its feet if given time to restructure and consolidate funds.While we could have helped, parliament criticized the idea as a violation of the principles of free trade and non-interference.
Of course, we must help the company during this difficult time.
We will not spend public funds to support a private company

$COUNTRY$ is buzzing with news about a railroad trust recently disclosed by an antitrust commission in one of the regions.Local capitalists deny the accusations, calling them ludicrous, and argue that there was no price fixing or manipulation.Discontent is brewing among the working class.The workers believe that the bourgeois tycoons rip them off as sticky, and they themselves receive fabulous profits.By destroying the trust, we will slow down the development of railways in the region for a couple of years.But if we do nothing, the general population will be unhappy.
We must defend workers' rights at all costs and the monopoly will end here
Freedom of trade is our main principle
