And if you remember all the unjust acts of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ representatives in the colonies, it is not surprising that the word '$COUNTRY$' far beyond the borders of our country has become synonymous with robbery, profit and murder.Our slogan is simple: ?COUNTRY$! Get out of the colonies! "\n \nRadually-minded $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens have founded an anti-colonial league.From the reports of the secret police, it became clear that this organization, full of supporters of the independence of the colonies, has many connections with the socialist international.

The struggle for colonies is intensifying, the European powers are striving for new acquisitions in Africa and around the world.The $COUNTRY$ government is doing pretty well too.One of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies has become one of the best European colonies in recent years.She increased the prestige of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonial policy in Europe and also promoted the development of scientific research.

“And although I deeply respect my opposition colleagues, I cannot understand why they are again raising the issue of the expenses of the Department of Colonial Affairs.Colonies are the backbone of our politics and are worth any cost.”\n \nColonies are back on the front pages of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ newspapers after a heated debate in the upper house.Opposition members are in favor of budget cuts for the Colonial Office.In the upper house, a struggle for votes broke out between the opposition and the ruling majority.

A major corruption scandal is brewing in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonial Office - a report in the $CAPITAL$ newspaper shocked the nation.The article reveals a huge network of bribe-takers and corrupt officials acting in the interests of certain private companies that benefit from the trade and exploitation of the colonies.Government critics point to low wages and underfunding of the needs of colonial officials.But there is a perception in government circles that ubiquitous corruption has infiltrated the Colonial Administration from the private sector.
The government must accept responsibility for its mistakes
The management was bribed by the big capitalists - it is their fault!

The growth of our colonial possessions turned $CAPITAL$ into a growing metropolis, cultural and economic center of the empire.Every day, every hour, people from all over the world come to our capital - for negotiations with our ministers, for trade with our merchants, for contracts with industrialists and engineers - and to see the greatness of the city with their own eyes.At the central station of $CAPITAL$ you can see the whole world in miniature - hear any foreign language, feel the smells of distant countries.The era after the $YEAR$ year will forever go down in the history of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ empire as the golden age of Mr.$CAPITAL$.
...and may these days never be forgotten.

Although the discovery of new lands brought new diseases, one of the colonies earned a particularly creepy reputation for itself.Malaria, flu of common and unusual varieties - everyone who goes to this colony inevitably becomes infected with something very unpleasant.A report by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ by a doctor living in the colony proposes large-scale measures to drain local marshes and swamps and improve health care.These actions will help the colony, but they will require considerable expenses from us.
We are, of course, obligated to help the colony.

One of our colonies has achieved incredible success in the development of local trade and entrepreneurship, reports the Office of Colonial Affairs.According to the local governor, the main reason was the ambitious land reform, which was adopted with the assistance of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ industrialists and capitalists.The colony is becoming more and more attractive to emigrants.The report is also generous with praise for our industrial magnates.
Do not trumpet the report, otherwise the capitalists will become proud!

Archaeological excavations in one of our colonies have brought incredible success: several items have been found, apparently from the late Paleolithic era.The discovery will allow us to learn a lot about the life of ancient mankind and the history of these lands.The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Archaeological Society calls the find a huge success for our archeology.The artifacts should be on display in a museum, but where exactly? The Archaeological Society insists on the $CAPITAL$ History Museum, but some hint that it is better to keep them at the local museum.
Display ancient trinkets somewhere with the locals
These findings will tell future generations about what was the common past of mankind.

An unpleasant situation arose in one of our colonies: several capitalists from $CAPITAL$ seized control of local trade.One of their businesses, a small machine shop run by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ specialists, operates according to Western industry standards.Work starts before dark.The noise from the workshop does not allow anyone in the vicinity to sleep peacefully at night.This problem is just one of many similar ones.Dissatisfaction with our rule in the colonies is spreading more and more.
If the workshop has to work at night, there is nothing to argue here.
I guess you can drop by the chamber of commerce and talk to the guys ...

AlthoughNapoleon's armies were defeated and he himself was defeated, the basic ideas of the French Revolution cannot be crushed.In Germany, the rule of the Holy Roman Empire collapsed and feudal relations replacedNapoleonic civil laws.Throughout Europe, both in universities and in eateries, talk about liberalism, political reform, freedom of speech, human rights, and not the monarch's, confirms the ancient saying that the passage of time cannot be stopped.National and cultural minorities, hitherto under the yoke of scepters and mantles, are awakening to determine their destiny.Far beyond the oceans, the untouched riches of Africa and Asia await.Dust settles in the fields of Waterloo.Europe is on the verge of a new era - the era of liberalism.
Liberal activity will intensify in the coming years

“And while our people are working in unbearable conditions in the fields, what has our government done to alleviate the suffering of the farmers who are starving this year because of the loss of the potato crop? Free trade could have helped food imports, but instead, the government is backing someone's ancient privileges.”\n \nThe supporters of the liberals speak out openly both among the people and in parliament.Our government has been criticized for not responding to the death of potatoes in one of the provinces.Strengthening the liberals could lead to a new revolutionary conspiracy.We should consider sending troops to provinces where liberal agitation is taking place.
Reinforce them in parliament and hope that the situation in the provinces does not get out of control
Let them speak out in parliament - perhaps the situation will resolve itself

The guards in $CAPITAL$ are unwaveringly loyal to us, according to a local poet.A pamphlet attacking the situation in the country, political backwardness and oppression caused a surge of militancy in one of the regions.All over the country $COUNTRY$ calls for national unity are heard - liberals take to the streets, protesting against the old order, calling for unification with fraternal peoples in other countries and the liberalization of the political system.It is necessary to send troops to the provinces where liberal agitation is taking place.
We must defend the old order!
Issue a local decree prohibiting it

The presence of a large military contingent in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has led to the fact that the liberal agitation and revolutionary speeches, which have recently been heard at every intersection, have completely died down.
A heated debate before the elections

The tense pre-election race reached a tipping point in $COUNTRY$, where a fierce trade policy debate erupted between free traders and protectionists trying to shape the future of our merchants.Free traders believe that goods should cross borders without hindrance, and protectionists believe that the fragile foundations of our nation's industries need protection from foreign competitors who threaten them with ruin.Which path should our country choose? Free trade or protectionism? We have provided information, but it's up to you to decide.
Our trade must be protected from the destructive effects of foreign competition
Some measures are needed to protect the industry
Let the debate take its course, and fate will decide everything!
Our traders must have the right to move freely!

The pre-election debate in $COUNTRY$ has been going on for several days - the main issue, not surprisingly, has become the economy.Supporters of several theories speak out, but the electorate expects to hear the government's opinion.What system will the government support to provide each $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen for the next term?
Speak out strongly in favor of the free market
Speak out strongly in favor of interventionism
Speak out decisively in favor of state capitalism
Speak out strongly in favor of a planned economy

"The moral foundations of our people are crumbling!" This claim sparked controversy among supporters of religious tolerance and equality of religions during the $COUNTRY$ campaign.Many have questioned the government's policy on religion, and no doubt this issue will play a role in the upcoming elections.
Religion has nothing to do with politics!

There is only one true faith!

The two argue heatedly in the stale air of the city hall.The listeners try to understand the essence of the dispute, in which every now and then "outsiders", "minorities", "national diasporas" are mentioned.One of the disputants believes that immigrants should follow the cultural customs of their new homeland, while his opponent defends their right to preserve cultural heritage and argues that the $COUNTRY$ state will only benefit from "fresh blood" ...

Supporters and opponents of the military take different sides before the elections.The militarists argue that the growing tensions in the world and the arms race between the great powers are sufficient reasons to maintain the strength of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ army.Others are less convinced of this: the government's military spending seems like a waste to them.
We are patriots and are ready to fight for our country!
We must be vigilant in foreign policy
War between countries is always bad
War is an evil to be avoided
$COUNTRY$ got into trouble with smuggling after raising duties on several imported goods and is now the main issue of the upcoming elections.Several solutions to the problem are proposed.
Reduce duties on these goods, but raise duties on other goods
It is necessary to reduce duties altogether

New foreign goods are replacing some of the goods produced in $COUNTRY$.Some of our producers find it increasingly difficult to compete with foreign goods on the market.Local politicians raised the issue in pre-election debates.
Free trade will give us an edge in the long run
Free trade is preferable in principle
Free trade is the best guarantee of our prosperity
Local markets sometimes need to be protected
Local markets should always be protected from foreign competitors

Traders from the $COUNTRY$ region are arguing with the Minister of Finance, who has put forward a plan to nationalize part of the region's enterprises.The heated debate has reached your ears too - try to calm down the debaters.
I see no reason to monopolize
Both sides have good arguments, but we will not create a monopoly
Let everything be as it will be - the world develops by itself.You don't need a monopoly ...
Great idea, but let me take a look first.

“The production rate is too high.We will not be able to fulfill it." Other farmers stand behind him, waiting.Their tanned faces show that they are worried about the same questions as their representative.
Nonsense.The rate will remain the same ...
You have nothing to worry about
If the norm is not met, we will come up with something
Pre-election debate on regionalism and the state

In the $COUNTRY$ election, a debate unfolded over government intervention in the local economy.Proponents of state capitalism argue that more direct state control over investment will help local industry develop in the long term.
It will take time, but the effect will be achieved
Perhaps more moderate action should be considered
Perhaps we should consider this idea again.
We need to resist government interference in the economy
Debates about plan, freedom and economics

The $COUNTRY$ region administration has come under fire for government subsidies to local industries.Opponents of subsidies argue that "economic planners will not be able to account for consumer preferences, scarcity and surplus with the necessary precision, and therefore will not be able to effectively manage production." The gradual increase in government intervention worries the citizens of the $COUNTRY$ region.
Planners know what they are doing
Most likely, this is nonsense, but we will study the situation.

Some believers in the $COUNTRY$ region believe that the state did not reward them for their hard work.They claim that they have worked for the benefit of the local community for years - caring for the sick, orphans, helping those in need.They believe they have earned the right to government support in order to continue helping people.This issue became the subject of discussions during the election campaign.
Charity is good, but our answer is no
Perhaps there is something we could help

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ religious policy has been the subject of local election debates at $COUNTRY$.Many believe that the government should pursue gradual secularization, but this threatens to abolish the old privileges of the church.Many local believers are opposed to this.
Secular power will ensure the neutrality of the state in relation to morality
Believers must be able to influence politics

Religion has come to the fore in the upcoming campaign debate - a local religious leader in $COUNTRY$ is protesting religious freedom as his flock is shrinking, damaging the moral $COUNTRY_ADJ$ community.
There is nothing we can do
We can only try to reconcile the parties, although the situation is very unpleasant
We will do our best, we will not tolerate this
Pre-election debate on religion and state

The rebuilding of a local temple with government funding has been the subject of debate in local elections for $COUNTRY$.Supporters of the project argue that religion needs government support not only to maintain faith in people, but also to resist the forces of the revolution - and opponents say that the state should not interfere in religious life.
Of course, the temple needs to be restored!
Part of the funds can be allocated for the preservation of the temple as an object of cultural heritage
Let people deal with this issue on their own.
We must clearly speak out against such projects

The influx of immigrants has created a demand for jobs.Defenders of the rights of migrants demand the same rights for new citizens as for citizens born in our country.This topic is hotly debated in local elections.
They are not entitled to make demands
Why should they have the same rights?
Let's see what we can do
It won't be easy, but we'll do our best

Some residents of the $COUNTRY$ region believe they are subject to government discrimination based on their origins.This issue has become a bone of contention in the local elections - liberals demand respect for the rights of immigrants and visitors.Their opponents, on whose side public opinion, believe that $COUNTRY_ADJ$ cannot become a citizen overnight.The naturalization process should take years, maybe entire generations.
Limited citizenship is our main policy
You see, I have a dream ...
New Citizens and the Right to Vote

Immigration has become a major issue in local elections at $COUNTRY$.Liberals demand universal suffrage for all members of society, including immigrants.Others cling to ancient privileges and disagree.The election draws near and the debate is heating up in the $COUNTRY$ region.
You need to strive for freedom in everything and always!
Full citizenship with few restrictions is our way
Full citizenship, alas, cannot be given out just like that

The pre-election $COUNTRY$ debate mainly revolves around the country's $COUNTRY$ army and military policy.The views of "hawks" on foreign policy have long been prevalent in the region.Everything is the same this year.Obviously, the electorate is sympathetic to the militant politics, but the course of the debate can smooth over the influence of these sentiments.
It is not worth increasing military spending
We thought to cut military spending ...
Mama said the pistol is an invention of the devil
Pre-election debate on the army and defense

Our generals complain about the poor supply of food to the soldiers and demand more funds for food.They argue that poor ration lowers the morale of soldiers, and they want to fix the situation by improving meals.For many families of the military in $COUNTRY$ this issue has become the main one.
They need to eat better to fight better.
Let's see how much can be allocated to improve nutrition.
You shouldn't attach much importance to it.
Perhaps the cost should be cut by cutting the soldiers themselves ...

A report was received on the state of the army - the weapons of most of the soldiers are worn out, and the officers demand to check the weapons and send part of them for disposal.The rearmament of the army will cost much more than planned in the current budget.
And without weapons they will not be able to fight?

In $COUNTRY$ pacifist sentiments have been roaming for a long time, but in the current elections it seems that the one whose pacifism is stronger will win.True, it is not clear whether sympathy for the pacifists will be so strong after the election debate.
Nothing can be solved by violence
A feather is stronger than a sword
The military needs guns, not words
In fact, violence can solve everything

“And we, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ youth, are united by a common demand - we yearn for the revival of the freedoms of antiquity.Let the $COUNTRY$ state become a new Greece.”\n \nRadial students, inspired by the romantic ideals of the ancient world - freedom and democracy, founded a society in one of the state universities.They published a manifesto calling for suffrage reform and the revival of "the ancient traditions of freedom in the country of $COUNTRY$." The society is rapidly gaining popularity at the university, and the new ideology has more and more supporters.
They have the right to express their opinion
Can't the rector handle this nonsense?

“And when I read about the Athens of Pericles, I was always amazed at the enlightenment of ancient society.Today, millennia later, I am less free than the citizens of ancient Greece.”\n \nIn the 19th century, interest in the classics of ancient literature was revived.The societies of Greece and Rome inspired liberal thinkers who saw in ancient times examples of the rights and freedoms they wanted to achieve in the present.The local reformist club has published several classics that are gaining popularity among the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ educated elite.
Don't you have anything else to do?
It's good that people are turning to the classics.How about Socrates' Dialogues?

“And seeing the suffering of a people deprived of the most natural human right - freedom, he wept.?\n \nOne of the most famous writers in our country recently published a book that critics have already dubbed the most severe criticism of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ political system ever censor.The writer calls for freedom and the abolition of ancient monarchies, in the place of which republics based on human rights will arise.
Make sure that the circulation of this book does not increase
His voice must be heard throughout the country!

A chamber of commerce in one of the regions sent an angry protest to the local government, complaining about economic interference from the state: it allegedly infringes on local entrepreneurs and harms the free market.The Chamber of Commerce, inspired by the ideas of the French physiocrats about free trade and non-interference, demands from the state a change in economic policy.They want the market to be left alone.If their demands are not met, they threaten to raise the issue at the state level.
It might be worth considering local indulgences
The demands of the ruling classes? I do not obey them.

At one of our universities, a liberal professor published a treatise on economics that attracted the attention of liberal circles both in the country $COUNTRY$ and abroad.It's a small piece of work full of neat arguments for the free market and laissez-faire.The author is now mentioned alongside such luminaries of economic thought such as Ricardo and Smith.We could brand the treatise as false liberal propaganda, but perhaps the professor is right?
Of course, we are proud of this work!
This is just propaganda aimed at exploiting the working class

In one of our regions there is a demonstration organized by members of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Chartist Club.The demonstration calls for the empowerment of the wider population to vote.Although the demonstration is proceeding calmly, the situation could get out of hand at any moment.The police are ready to intervene at any moment, waiting only for an excuse.
Let the police conduct an explanatory conversation with these would-be revolutionaries

A number of highly unpopular tariffs, which have become a rare example of mercantilism in Great Britain, were called "Bread Laws".These laws were supposed to "protect" British farmers from competition with cheap foreign grain.Naturally, this led to an increase in the price of bread for the poor British.After a poor harvest in 1845 and the subsequent potato famine in Ireland, the Bread Laws were finally repealed in 1846.The abolition of these duties marked the beginning of a long period of non-intervention of the state in the economy in Britain: it lasted most of the 19th century.
Unpopular import duties abolished - Bread Laws.

Throughout the 19th century, the idea of ??equal rights for women gained momentum in Western society.At first, it was defended in their works by liberal philosophers (for example, in England - Mary Woolstonecraft and John Stuart Mill), and then the suffragist idea gradually developed into an integral and independent ideology: feminism.It is believed that the experience of the First World War, when women worked in factories and performed other work, which in peacetime was considered exclusively male, had a decisive influence on the granting of women the right to work, suffrage and their equal rights with men in general.

“With the weather in the city of $CAPITAL$ we were terribly unlucky: mud, mud and more mud.There was a sea of ??mud, among ourselves we later called this event the Mud March ?This is how one suffragette described a demonstration in which more than three thousand women from various organizations took part: weavers, members of the temperance league, actresses and many others.All of them advocated the right to vote and the emancipation of women on the streets of $CAPITAL$.Despite the weather, the demonstrators were enthusiastic.

The so-called "Cat and Mouse" Act is an infamous law passed in the UK in 1912.to combat the suffragettes' hunger strikes, which arouse sympathy among the population.According to the law, it was possible to release a detainee from prison to recover from a serious illness, but after being healed, he could be detained again.Thus, the government washed its hands: any suffering a starving woman endured exclusively of her own free will.A similar bill appeared in the legislative assembly of one of the regions, where it was decided to deal with the hunger strikes of the suffragists in the same way.
Use government influence to abolish the law

A small study circle dedicated to the activities of suffragettes has earned a reputation over the past few years in international meetings on women's rights.The circle became known as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ School - they published several works on philosophy, politics and economics related to the fate of women around the world.

Our country is under the intellectual onslaught of modernity and the Western world.In the field of modern technology, industry and military theory, old traditions and institutions can no longer serve us as before.Western influence is spreading like wildfire throughout our state, among our people and in our souls.If we want to remain ourselves and not lose our essence, now is the time to take our destiny into our own hands.It became obvious to the leading representatives of our intellectual elite that the only way to stop the destructive onslaught of the monster from the west is to sail its course.Sun Tzu said: "The reed bends with the wind and thus resists it."

Education in the Soviet Union was closely related to the upbringing and formation of personality traits.The Soviet school was called upon not only to solve general educational problems, teaching students knowledge of the laws of the development of nature, society and thinking, labor skills and abilities, but also to form on this basis the communist views and beliefs of students, to educate students in the spirit of high morality, Soviet patriotism and proletarian internationalism ...

In an extremely short time, Japan is making an industrial revolution.Having no inventions of its own, it borrows them from more developed countries.The lack of private capital is compensated by an active role in the industrialization of the state, which creates here the factory industry, especially the enterprises of heavy industry.The Japanese state supports private entrepreneurs by providing them with subsidies, exempting them from taxes, and selling built factories in installments to those fictitious firms that carried out government orders.

Collaboration between private industrialists and the military on national defense and military policy has led to an extremely important web of connections, personal relationships and acquaintances, with very little corruption.This phenomenon can be best described by the term "military-industrial complex".If you support the intentions and ambitions of these informal networks towards our academy, we can spur military and industrial research at the expense of the navy and culture.

They say that in our country the best way to prosperity is through the naval school.A significant part of the country's military and political elite received a naval education or served in the merchant marine.The importance of the fleet for a country like ours cannot be underestimated.By giving these "naval" circles political support, we will be able to accelerate the development of marine technology.True, at the expense of other studies.

In 1707,Neuch?tel passed into the possession of the Prussian king Frederick William I because of his relationship with the Orange-Nassau dynasty, and the principality actually found itself in a personal union with the Prussian kingdom and the Hohenzollern dynasty.During theNapoleonic Wars, Prussia lostNeuch?tel after being defeated byNapoleon.ThenNeuch?tel, at the suggestion of Frederick Wilhelm III, became part of Switzerland as its 21st canton, but formally remained a Prussian principality.In 1848, the province got rid of its monarchical heritage and was proclaimed a republic within the Swiss Confederation.Prussia finally renounced its claims in 1857.

"Although John Brown's body is rotting in the damp earth, the soul goes forward!" - "Body of John Brown", one of the Union marches.\n \nFamed abolitionist hero John Brown was hanged today in Charlestown, Virginia after a failed raid on an armory.By all accounts, Brown wanted to use the weapons from the workshop to arm the slaves who would raise rebellion throughout the South.The raid and the death of John Brown sparked violent unrest in the slave states, and in some of them there is talk of secession from the Union.

“A house divided into itself will not stand.So our state will not be able to constantly be half slave, half free.I do not expect that the Union will be dissolved, and I do not expect that the house will fall, but what I really expect is that the house will cease to be divided.It will become either one or completely different." - Abraham Lincoln \n \n It's over.Attempts at a compromise, decades of negotiations on the issue of slavery have failed.Congressmen from the South have resigned today, and slave states have announced their secession from the United States.Missouri and Maryland, as well as western Virginia, sided with the Union.Union troops occupy the capital, Washington.South winds rage over the house, which is divided.

The Emancipation Proclamation refers to two pieces of legislation signed by President Abraham Lincoln during the Civil War.In them, all slaves of the southern states were declared free.If we issue the Emancipation Proclamation, we will show the world that this war is for the freedom of all blacks in the United States.

The ideals of the French Revolution seemed to have ended at the hands of the old European regimes.Although the flames of the revolution have been temporarily extinguished, it will soon become clear that the ideas of civil liberties, nationalism and liberalism are more alive than ever before.In this era of unprecedented technological progress, beliefs that have been unshakable since time immemorial will be questioned, and new ideas will take their place.From afar, because of the seas and oceans, the riches of Asia and Africa beckon, the melodies of which can also be heard in the European concert.Maestro, choose your instrument and let the music play!

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ squad of citizens who recently embarked on an expedition to the $FROMCOUNTRY$ country were denied entry.Apparently, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is increasingly turning to a policy of isolation in order to avoid problems with the modernization of its political, economic and social institutions.Such a policy, of course, interferes with $COUNTRY_ADJ$ trade, diplomacy, and missionary work in the region.This should be viewed as a violation of the freedom of movement of citizens.
We must respect cultural differences between our peoples

“The foreigners have gone too far! Their missionaries are spreading false doctrines, enthralling our people and destroying the unity of the nation.They violate our customs, and their opium intoxicates the minds of our people." This is what the people in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ will tell you, where for several months dissatisfaction with foreigners has not subsided.

“For this reason, we want to purchase and send you elephants so that you can release them in order to increase their number on the American continent.?\n \nSo in 1861, King Rama IV, also known as Mongkut, the fourth Siamese monarch from the dynasty Chakri, wrote in his letter to US President James Buchanan.Having learned from the American captain who visited Siam that there are no elephants in the United States at all, the king expressed his desire to give them one.This letter did not manage to reach Buchanan, since while it was crossing the Pacific Ocean, this president had already managed to leave office.As a result, the message ended up on Abraham Lincoln's desk.Who, as history says, politely declined the offer, arguing that the American climate was unsuitable for the life of elephants.

In 1861, King Rama IV, also known as King Mongkut, the fourth monarch of Siam from the Chakri dynasty, wrote a letter to US President James Buchanan.From an American captain visiting Siam, he heard that there were no elephants in America, and in a letter he expressed a desire to donate one elephant to the United States.If we offer the Americans an elephant, our relationship will definitely improve!

The Old Summer Palace, known in Chinese as the Gardens of Immaculate Radiance, is a complex of gardens northwest of the Imperial City in Beijing.The gardens were laid out in the 18th and early 19th centuries and were used as the residence of the emperors of the Qing Dynasty.This palace was burned to the ground by the Anglo-French troops during the occupation of Beijing in the Second Opium War.It was a severe blow to the morale of the Chinese, but the destruction of the palace was condemned by many European intellectuals, including Victor Hugo.In their eyes, it was a criminal act of cruelty towards the Chinese.If we burn this unique cultural heritage of Chinese history, we will undermine the morale of the Chinese people.

The Ancient Summer Palace, known in Chinese as "Pure Ripple Gardens," is a garden complex north of the Imperial Palace in Beijing.This palace complex was built in the 18th and early 19th centuries and for a long time served as a residence for the Qin emperors.Renowned for its rich decoration, this palace has become one of the greatest achievements of Chinese culture.Today it was reported that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers who occupied Beijing had burned the palace to the ground.The people are mourning, and news of this barbaric outburst is spreading throughout China and around the world.

From the very beginning of the Qing dynasty, the powerful Manchu elite occupied key positions in the administration and bureaucracy of the Chinese empire.Under the Qing emperors, ethnic Han people were severely discriminated against.In the 1860s.Empress Dowager Cixi effectively ended the practice when, during the Taiping uprisings, she entrusted the command of the country's most powerful combat unit to a Han-born warlord, Zeng Guofan.If we get rid of the Manchu elite, then we will take an important step towards modernization.

Albanian Muhammad Ali was born in Macedonia, then part of the Ottoman Empire.In the early 19th century, he served in the Ottoman army in Egypt, in the Kavala Volunteer Corps.After the retreat ofNapoleon's army from Egypt, as a result of long political maneuvers, Muhammad achieved the election of a wali (governor) of Ottoman Egypt.He used this position to effectively rule Egypt on his own, as the power of the Mamelukes was weakening.During his reign, he carried out a series of more or less popular and more or less successful reforms, the purpose of which was to transform Egypt into a modern state on the European model.Among other things, he built a shipyard in Alexandria, transferred a significant part of the cultivated land to direct government administration and sent delegations to Europe.who were supposed to obtain and deliver Western knowledge and technology to Egypt.The implementation of these reforms will allow Egypt to take a small step towards modernization.
We started the reforms of Muhammad Ali, and this accelerated our research.
Declaring war will allow our troops to attack their army and enter their territory.The war will continue until one of the parties surrenders.

Our state is in a state of civil war!

The collective term "Reconstruction" refers to laws, regulations, constitutional amendments and presidential decrees passed after the US Civil War with the aim of reintegrating the former confederate states into the Union.They mainly dealt with such issues as the end of the "Power of slaves", the suppression of nationalism and revanchism of the southerners and the recognition by the southern states of the 13th amendment to the constitution.In 1877, the reconstruction ended with a compromise, and the federal troops were finally withdrawn from the South.Trampled Confederate banners lie in the ashes of Savannah and Richmond.It's time to start renovating.
Birth of the Ku Klux Klan

The Ku Klux Klan, abbreviated as "KKK", was a terrorist organization composed primarily of white southerners.In 1865.it was founded by confederate veterans from Tennessee.Their squads instilled fear with the infamous burning crosses and white hoods and cloaks.The Ku Klux Klan resisted the reconstruction of the South in an effort to maintain white man's rule in the former Confederate states.They did not stop at violence against both blacks and Republicans.The federal government began its struggle against the clan by adopting acts of the use of force in 1871, during the first term of President Grant.Today we received news that we saw burning crosses in the south.Black smoke blankets the sky on this warm southern night.

The institution of serfdom as a type of feudal relations has existed in various forms since the times of Kievan Rus.Over the centuries, this institution changed and reformed, but the first steps towards its complete abolition were taken only in the 1810s, when serfdom was abolished in Courland, Estonia and Livonia.Serfdom was completely abolished only by the reform of 1861, during the reign of Alexander II, who feared that otherwise the Russian peasantry would try to gain freedom by force.

Tanzimat (Turkish for 'reforms') is a series of reforms carried out in the Ottoman Empire in the second half of the 19th century.They were supposed to bring down the rise of nationalism among the numerous and different peoples who inhabited it, and unite the various ethnic groups under the banner of "Ottomanism." The Ottoman state positioned itself as an alternative to ethnic-based nation states, which radical minorities aspired to create.The reforms also gave them greater representation in government and autonomy.Although the tanzimat ultimately failed to prevent the decline of the Ottoman Empire, it can be said that the reforms delayed it somewhat.

TheNational Guard (literally 'Civil Guard') is a gendarme corps created during the reign of Isabella II to suppress Carlist sympathies in the countryside, after the Liberals won the Carlist wars.TheNational Guard is a cross between the police and the military, it reports directly to the government and exists to this day.
The gendarmerie is the pride of our country.

The Foreign Legion is a military unit in the French army, which accepts recruits regardless of their nationality and without looking at their past.The legion was first created back in 1830, but gained well-deserved fame only after it took part in the Carlist Wars in Spain, in the French intervention in Mexico, in the Battle of Camarone, in the Franco-Prussian War, and later in almost every military conflict involving France to the present day.The image of a young man fleeing personal tragedy, oppression, debt or criminal history and joining the French Foreign Legion to undergo redemption in the Algerian deserts became one of the most common signs of the 19th century.Form a Legion and recruits will flock to our banners.
The glory of our army resounds throughout the world, not least thanks to the history of the Foreign Legion.

Dar al-Funun was the first university of a modern type established in Persia.It was founded in 1851 by Amir Kabir, vizier ofNasruddin Shah of the Qajar dynasty, to train upper-class Persian youths in medicine, science and military science.Let's give our youth a taste of the modern world and start this wonderful university!

During the war with the Triple Alliance, Paraguayan troops invaded the Brazilian province of Mato Grosso.The Brazilian Emperor Pedro II, furious at the incompetence of his military leaders, demanded that he be allowed to go to the front in person.When the Cabinet of Ministers and theNational Assembly refused to do this, Pedro threatened to abdicate the throne and join the army as a volunteer, saying "they may not let the emperor go to the front, but they cannot forbid me to abdicate and volunteer for the Fatherland." Of course, the government had no choice.Brazilian volunteers in this war were called "Fatherland volunteers," in the words of the emperor.Say what Pedro said, and the country will follow you to the ends of the world.

Law number 420 on general education was passed in Argentina in 1884 under President Julio Argentino Roque.The first system of free, compulsory, state and secular education was created in the country.The secular bias of this law caused some friction between the Catholic Church and the Argentine government, but in any case, this law marked a turning point in the history of education in Argentina.

Since 1660 Denmark has been an absolute monarchy.On June 5, 1849, King Frederick VII enacted the Danish constitution.Frederick's predecessors tried with all their might to avoid the adoption of a constitution that limits the power of the monarch.However, during the period of national unification of Denmark, following the first war over Schleswig, this happened.The Constitution marks Denmark's transition from absolutism to a constitutional monarchy.Let's give the people a constitution!

"We will live and die for You, South Africa!" It was originally a poem written in 1918 by Cornelis Jacobus Langenhoven.In 1921 Martinus Lawrence de Villers wrote music for him.The Call was a frequent feature on the African Broadcasting Company, completing daily programs along with the hymn “God Save the King?Approve the "Call" and give our young country a suitable anthem!

The British Broadcasting Corporation was founded on October 18, 1922 as the state broadcasting and later television company.Its founders were six radio companies, and the first program was broadcast from London onNovember 14, 1922.Create a BBC, and let "the people of the people carry the words of peace."
Establishment of the Council of People's Commissars

The Council of People's Commissars for the Constitution of the RSFSR in 1918 became the highest body of executive power in Soviet Russia.The Council of People's Commissars was accountable to the All-Russian Congress of Soviets, and in the intervals between sessions of the congress he had full power.

Immigrants from other countries in their new homeland often settle close to each other, trying to find support from their compatriots, creating ethnic enclaves like "little Italy" inNew York.The province of $PROVINCENAME$ is no exception - immigrants have created their own district there, in which everything - both cuisine and culture - reminds them of their homeland.
This is a victory for our tolerant society!
A great opportunity to establish peace and harmony!

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$ today love triumphs - family and friends celebrate the wedding of the son of one of the immigrants and a local girl.Some call it the end of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ civilization, but the newlyweds are quite happy.Immigrants have brought change to the province of $PROVINCENAME$.
This indicates that immigration should be stopped
Immigrants from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ marched demanding full citizenship and equality of all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens before the law.

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$, riots broke out among immigrants.Although they are technically citizens, many of them believe that the government has not taken care to ensure that they have equal opportunities with local residents.
These are the problems of the local police

"I swear allegiance to the flag of the country $COUNTRY$ and its government" \n \nTears of pride are in the eyes of the inhabitants of $PROVINCENAME$ - some of the immigrants have taken an oath of allegiance to our country today, demonstrating $COUNTRY_ADJ$ loyalty to the state.

Immigrants arriving in a $COUNTRY$ country are often poor and have few opportunities.They congregate in the poorer neighborhoods of the province of $PROVINCENAME$, which increasingly resemble ghettos.It might be worth addressing their living conditions before the situation gets worse.
I don't think it's worth worrying about
We will definitely understand the situation

Belgium achieved de facto independence from theNetherlands by force of arms, during the Belgian revolution of 1831.However, this independence was legally confirmed only in 1839 in the London Treaty signed by theNetherlands and all the great powers.The treaty guaranteed the independence and neutrality of Belgium.If we sign this agreement, we will abandon our claims to Belgium, but our reputation on the world stage will benefit from this.

Immigrants in the $PROVINCENAME$ province find it difficult to integrate into the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ community, and many of the locals see them as just outsiders.Immigrants live in separate neighborhoods, go to separate schools and shops, and generally have little contact with others.
They should be integrated - violently if necessary
The locals are doing the right thing!

After civil unrest in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, discontent with immigrants turned into a pogrom.People smashed shop windows, several newly arrived immigrants were killed - the newcomers are accused of all mortal sins.

Immigrants who recently arrived in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ brought the culture of their native country with them, and now our melodies and theirs are combined in a new style, in a harmonious symphony of the country $COUNTRY$.Their customs have enriched ours.New forms of self-expression have emerged in science, art and architecture.
Another reason to brag to the whole world!
Why are you telling me this at all?

An immigrant who recently arrived in $PROVINCENAME$ province was put on a ship and sent back after being caught stealing by local police.This case has caused alarm among local immigrants, many of whom are not familiar with our laws and fear further deportations.

Immigrants in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have opened several restaurants where you can taste the dishes of their home country.Now local residents can taste dishes from hitherto unknown lands.Those who previously ate the same food as their forefathers can discover delicacies from all over the world.

Germany was unified only after the proclamation of the German Empire as a result of the Franco-Prussian war, but the idea of ??unification had arisen long before that, with the rise of nationalism.An important harbinger of unification was the Frankfurt Assembly in 1848.If we occupy a dominant position among theNorth German states, we can create aNorth German Confederation.

Germany was unified only after the proclamation of the German Empire as a result of the Franco-Prussian War, but the rise of nationalism in the 19th century led to the idea of ??unification having arisen long before that.An important harbinger of unification was the Frankfurt Assembly in 1848.If we occupy a dominant position among the South German states, we can create a South German Confederation.
Only the §Ygreat§W or §Ycolonial powers§W can colonize.
This province is part of our great power.

Talk of secession from the Union can be heard on any street in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.These conversations are going on throughout the state of $STATE$.Fewer and fewer people believe that a reasonable compromise that would preserve a "special institution" - that is, slavery - in the South can be achieved in the current situation, when Congress is increasingly leaning towards political reform.

The only issue that the founding fathers of our great nation could not resolve is the issue of slavery in the states of the Union.The debate is only getting hotter every year after the revolution, and today this issue has become the main one for our country.Some of the radical southerners believe that there can be no compromise and that the only alternative to the liberation of slaves imposed from Washington is withdrawal from the Union.If our Senate tries to force the South into political reform, despite the fact that there are only 40 percent of the liberals in the upper house, it is obvious that these reforms will meet with resistance.

The slavery debate continues in the United States.Popular interest in this issue is growing every day.If the Liberal representation in the Senate reaches 30 percent, the South may well decide to secede.

The $MONARCHTITLE$, $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Ambassador informed us about the results of the $UNION_ADJ$ Congress.The $FROMCOUNTRY$ state recognizes the power of the $UNION_ADJ$ crown and proclaims itself a single $UNION_ADJ$ nation.These winds of change are hard to stop.

In 1867, at the request of the Japanese shogun, France sent a military mission to Japan to train the shogun's troops in the European art of war.The mission was led by Captain Charles Chanuan, who later became French Minister of War in the Brisson government in 1898.Send a military mission to Japan to improve our relationship with it.

During the reign of Prince Regent Luitpold, the Munich district of Schwabing, thanks to a large university and numerous students, became famous as a place of concentration of intellectual bohemia.This attracted many artists and writers there - from the Mann brothers to Henrik Ibsen and Wassily Kandinsky.Support Swabian circles to increase your prestige.

The era of grunders ('Founding' in German) is a period from about 1840 to the mid-1870s, a time of rapid economic modernization and industrialization in Germany and Eastern Europe (including Vienna) as a whole.This era stands out, among other things, for its special architectural style, inspired by neo-Gothic images and techniques, as well as the new building schools that industrialization brought to life.Moreover, it was a time of increasing liberalism in politics.Support these new trends to kick-start Vienna's prosperity.

In 1840, the French Prime Minister Adolphe Thiers declared the Rhine River the natural border of France.His statement caused the so-called "Rhine Crisis", as it was perceived in Germany as a threat to the Prussian possessions on the west bank of the river.Poet and merchant Max Schneckenburger, inspired by these events, wrote a patriotic poem, in which he urged "Fatherland to remain calm", because "the sentries are firmly and confidently on the Rhine." It was a hint that Germany would protect the river from any, that is, French, encroachments.The poem was set to music in 1854 and gained exceptional popularity in Germany during the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-71.
We cannot have national priorities in a foreign province, unless it is a potentially dangerous situation for you.

The Fist for Justice and Reconciliation, or Boxers as they are called, a Chinese political movement to defend China against European expansion in Asia, have committed massacres of European missionaries and traders in China.Chinese Christians were attacked along with the Europeans.The Chinese government doesn't seem to care about the killings.It is even rumored that the Qin government supports boxers.

The "Fair Society of Harmonious Fists", whose members were called "boxers" in the West, is a movement advocating the restoration of China's independence from the encroachments of foreign imperialists.This traditionalist movement does not neglect any means to achieve its goal of "cleansing" China.Under the slogan "Support the Qing, destroy the alien," the boxers will, at the earliest opportunity, massacre Europeans and Chinese converts.
A fair society of harmonious kulaks began to operate in some provinces, which were invaded by foreigners.Support this movement and hopefully boxers can end European influence in China.

The death of the childless Voldemar, Prince Lippe-Detmold, in 1895 marked the beginning of a twenty-year dispute between the two branches of the Lippe dynasty, the Schomberg and Bisterfelds.If we bequeath the principality to one of the parties, we can prevent this dispute from arising.

The death of the childless Voldemar, Prince Lippe-Detmold, in 1895 marked the beginning of a twenty-year dispute between the two branches of the Lippe dynasty, the Schomberg and Bisterfelds.If we transfer the principality to one of the parties, we can prevent this dispute from arising.

The Royal Order of Francis I was established on 28 September 1829 as the Order of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies, awarded for civil and military merit.If we award this order to an honored dignitary, then we will be perceived as a just and magnanimous monarchy, which, of course, we are.

The Albertine Statute is a constitution adopted in the Kingdom of Sardinia-Piedmont on March 4, 1848, in response to revolutionary sentiments in the country.The statute officially established absolute monarchy as a form of government in the country.Subsequently, the statute, in a slightly modified form, was used as the basis for the Italian constitution, which was in force until 1948.
No immigration in the last §Y$DAYS$§W days \n

Tenth Landtag (Parliament) of the Grand Duchy of Hesse at meetings in 1844-47.devoted a lot of time to trying to combine the Civil Code ofNapoleon, which was in force in the province of Rhinehessen, including Mainz, with customary German law, which was applied in the rest of the duchy.The result of these efforts was the publication of the Book of Civil Laws in 1847, which became the single source of law for the entire duchy.
Our §Y$POPTYPE$§W are not planning anything right now.

TheNiederwald Monument stands in theNiederwald Park (Hesse, Germany).Its central figure is the ten-meter statue of Germany, the embodiment of the Germanic people, which raises the restored imperial crown of Germany.Two statues on the sides symbolize War and Peace.The monument, which became a symbol of the revival of the German Empire, was created between 1871 and 1883, its construction began after the Franco-Prussian war.Let's create a symbol of the glory of our nation and build a monument that will never be ruled by the ages!

Altar of the Fatherland, or "Vittoriano" - a monument in Rome, opened in 1911.It is dedicated to Victor Emmanuel II and was built in honor of the creation of the Italian nation.Let the rest of the nations bask in the glory of the revived Rome! Let's create a monument worthy of our young nation.
Our form of government does not allow us to appoint a ruling party.

Emir Gwandu Abdullahi dan Fodio (1766-1828), wrote a book about Jihad Fulani, whose fiery faith created the Sultanate of Sokoto.If we contribute to the dissemination of this wonderful historical book, then our country will gain glory and recognition.

The "era of princes" in the history of Ethiopia lasted from 1769 until the coronation of Tewodros II in 1855.At this time, Ethiopia was fragmented due to political strife, and the power of the emperor was practically reduced to zero.The coronation of Tewodros, who received the title "NegusaNagast" or "King of Kings", ended the era of princes and marked the beginning of the modern imperial era in Ethiopia.Is it time for your coronation?

The first national parliament of the modern Greek state was created only in 1843, and only after the revolution on September 3 of the same year, he forced King Otto to give the country a constitution.The convocation of the first Greek parliament means not only the country's transition to a constitutional monarchy, but also the first breath of democracy for Hellas since ancient times.

From the time the Palais Garnier was built in 1875 until 1989, it was the main building of the Paris Opera.Garnier created it in the style of the new baroque, and at one time it was considered a masterpiece of modern architecture.This palace was imitated by many Western architects.He also inspired Gaston Leroy to write the classic novel The Phantom of the Opera.
