In this province, the government maintains a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients.
The instigators preach the ideas of liberalism and revolution.
The crops in the fields are rotten, the people are starving.
In our country, a brochure in defense of counter-revolution, order, religion and monarchy has been widely disseminated.
Cholera has appeared in the province, there is a threat of its spread.
A cholera epidemic began in the province.There is a threat of its spread.
The whole country is mourning another young girl who disappeared in a coal mine.
Silkworm diseases have reduced silk production by local silkworm breeders.
Our government is pursuing a policy of all possible encouragement of the influence of the West.
Our country has closed borders and ports for foreigners.
A colony of foreigners from various European countries was formed here.
There is a network of foreign smugglers in the province.
A group of our citizens, who keep themselves apart from the rest of the population, runs the business of a foreign trading post in this province.
Our citizens in this province are massively addicted to opium.
Our country pursues a policy of regulating imports and exports and prohibiting foreign trade in certain goods.
We have translated many Western books and mastered their knowledge.Our science has received a great impetus.
One of the great powers established a military mission in this province.
Our country has granted the privilege of extraterritoriality to the citizens of the great powers.
We are in the process of reforming our army according to European standards.
We have reformed our education system.This measure will give an impetus to our science, but it is extremely unpopular with traditionalists.
The province has an embassy quarter for foreign embassies.
This monument to a foreign diplomat serves as a constant reminder of how our government sold our freedom cheaply.
There is very little rainfall in this province in the summer, and crops are suffering.
We milk everything of value from this province.
The enraged soldiery ravages the province.
The colony has rebelled against us.
You have the opportunity to get even with the rebels.
There is a secret organization operating in your colony.She seems to be planning a rebellion.
The meeting of the rebels alarmed the inhabitants.
You have withstood all the attacks perfectly.
The eyewitness accounts drew a wave of criticism.Other countries criticize you for the methods used in your colony.
The prisoners managed to escape from the prison.
The soldiers saved the defenseless people.
More troops can be deployed to suppress the last hotbeds of the rebellion.
You have dealt with almost all the rebels, there are very few of them left.
Rebellious workers protest against low social protection
The slaves in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have revolted.
Inhabitants of the colony protest against the actions of the missionaries.
Economic activity in the province has temporarily dropped, but should recover in a few years.
Our country is pursuing a policy of prohibiting capital construction for members of minorities, even on their own land.
Old man Jimala bypasses the building ban by living in a wagon.
An underground organization providing higher education in the minority language.
Border bandits ruin the lives of the inhabitants of this province.
The solution to the women's issue is already close.
This law gives eligible citizens 160 acres of land.Rumors about the free land are spreading throughout Europe, and masses of poor people, who want to breathe freely, are striving for our shores.
Our school system discriminates against citizens who do not belong to the national culture.
A flu pandemic has broken out in our country, people are dying in thousands.We can only hope that our enemies will not escape it either.
In the prisons of this area, some inmates are given authority over others, and this increases productivity.
Scattered around the outskirts of our empire are several penal colonies of various types and sizes.We send the most dangerous criminals there.

The first thing people see as people sail from the Old World toNew York Harbor is the flickering top of a huge torch that symbolizes the freedom of theNew World.For many immigrants, this becomes an unforgettable first impression of a country born in the flame of freedom - their new home.
The ships leave the dry dock at Kiel with astonishing speed.This is the work of the German shipyard, owned by the Krupp family.
A natural history museum has been established in this province.
The lack of funds allocated to the colonial administration for administrative expenses plunged this colony into administrative chaos.
A government campaign attracts immigrants to the province by promising them land and good opportunities.
The campaign to increase the birth rate has led to an increase in the number of newborns in the province.
The people of this province mostly support us.Some of them are already serving or want to serve in the regiments of the colonial troops.

“Every day drunkenness causes serious harm to our people, more and more undermining the moral and spiritual foundations of the nation.We need to unite to protect public welfare and bring the ideals of sobriety to the poor and oppressed masses.”\n \nAlcohol consumption has been growing in our country for a long time.Cheap and affordable hard liquor and harsh working conditions make the poor classes particularly vulnerable to deadly poison.Unsurprisingly, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Temperance Society was founded.
What's wrong with a couple of glasses? * hic *

In one of our provinces, another pub opened today, confirming the province's reputation as a haven for vagabonds, swindlers and drunks.For every hundred inhabitants of the province there is a bar, a brothel, a pub or some other den of sin and vice.Although wine can be poured over any grief, the consequences of an excessive passion for alcohol will be very serious.
Force local authorities to close the bar

A police raid in a bar in $PROVINCENAME$ provoked riots against the police and authorities.Local residents, enraged by the decision of the police to close the bar, and far from sober, took to the streets and staged a drunken pogrom in the city.

Poverty and poverty, as well as other social evils associated with alcoholism, are spreading more and more in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ and throughout the $STATENAME$ region.Local sobriety advocates blame the multitude of shops, bars and pubs in the $PROVINCENAME$ province, while other less convinced observers point to unemployment and harsh working conditions as the root cause of all evil.

Sobriety activists picketed a bar in the $PROVINCENAME$ province today, claiming that bar drinking has destroyed many marriages and families, broke lives, and caused dozens of broken windows and noses throughout the $STATENAME$ region.The demonstrators demanded the immediate closure of the institution, and only the presence of the police deterred them from solving the problem on their own.

“For a true believer is not fit to waste his life under the burden of a grave vice.We must cleanse ourselves and our congregation from sin, once and for all banishing from it the malign spirit of the bottle and lifting our eyes to the Spirit in heaven.”\n \nThe soberness movement is gaining influence in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ religious circles a meeting in one of our regions is the best confirmation of this.
Sobriety is needed more than ever

Influenced by strong lobbying by the temperance society, one of our provinces has passed legislation allowing citizens to issue or withdraw alcohol licenses in their area.With strong public support, this bill effectively banned the sale of alcoholic beverages in the region.Many local breweries lost their right to sell products in the surrounding areas and went bankrupt.

“And if we intend to free our fellows from terrible suffering and from the consequences of drunkenness and alcoholism, the best thing is constant, complete abstinence from drunkenness.Otherwise, what is the point of freeing ourselves from oppressive capitalists if we remain ruled by vice and addictions? ”\n \nBecause the negative effects of mass alcoholism hit the poorest classes hardest, the temperance society has found allies among the socialist movement.Among the workers in one of our regions, they are campaigning against the use of alcohol.
Do not interfere with their work
Socialists must be fought at every step

“Quiet, guys, wait a little.As soon as the border guard turns away, we will rush across the border.In the city of $CAPITAL$, thousands of sips are eager to taste at least a glass from these boxes."\n \nDry law has led to the emergence of a market for contraband alcohol.Neighboring countries and clandestine factories and moonshine factories - this invisible army works day and night to present to the public a huge selection of thinners, wood spirits and contraband.The police have learned that a shipment of contraband goods is scheduled for today in one of our areas.

A wine connoisseur has been established in one of our regions in response to the antics of teetotalers and sobriety advocates.The society aims to preserve what they say is a rich $COUNTRY_ADJ$ cultural heritage, that is, traditions and rituals associated with alcoholic beverages.The wine connoisseur opposes any attempts at prohibition and suggests moderate consumption as an alternative.

Karl Marx published the Communist Manifesto.The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ workers have founded a party to fulfill the objectives of this document.They call themselves socialists and believe in the rule of the working class, where the workers will take possession of the means of production.Equality, justice, solidarity and democracy are important elements of the socialist ideology.

“We demand a society free from class oppression, free from exploitation, where no one will need.We demand a society without a state, without classes, we demand public ownership of the means of production."

Libertarians take to the streets: “Instead of the state police, the courts, the army, the law should establish a multitude of private organizations, funded by private donations, in the free market.Personal and economic activity must obey the natural laws of the market and the right of private property, not political decisions.”\n \nLibertarians conduct propaganda, trying to win sympathy along with other political forces of the state.

“Strength is in unity! The government is weak, we need a party capable of uniting the people, regaining national pride, without being deceived by the sweet promises of liberal capitalism." The Third Way Party, or simply theNazis, is trying to get a seat in the upper house of parliament.
A weary old traveler has returned from uncharted lands.After a shot of whiskey, he exclaims in a rough voice: “Gold! I found gold! Mountains of gold! "
A weary old traveler has returned from uncharted lands.After a shot of whiskey, he exclaims in a rough voice: “Diamonds! I found diamonds! Mountains of diamonds! "

A small expedition sent to the vicinity of the region reported an important find.According to the researchers' report, rubber trees are quite common in this area.They can be of great benefit to us in the future.
A weary old traveler has returned from uncharted lands.After a shot of whiskey, he exclaims in a rough voice: “Oil! I found oil! A sea of ??oil! "

For a long time, among the aborigines, there were legends about a fabulous plateau, where gold bars the size of an apple are lying on the ground.It is not known what these legends were based on, but now they have received confirmation: the miners stumbled upon the richest gold deposit in the Witwatersrand.The news of the gold rush instantly spread all over the world, and a new city appeared in the province, into which a real stream of fortune seekers flows.From now on, this province will be known as "Johannesburg".

Lieutenant Colonel Caster returned from the Black Hills with the news that significant quantities of gold had been found in Dakota.Gold prospectors, miners and fortune seekers have flooded there, but there are alarming reports of strange groans and screams that can be heard from the hills at night.Some believe that the Sioux are on the warpath ....
Reducing the cost of fighting crime increases the risk of anarchist organizations emerging.
Reducing crime-fighting costs increases the risk of street gangs emerging.

Rising crime rates and declining government control contribute to the concentration of business efforts on increasing their own profits.This may end with the collapse of the entire system, since everyone pursues only personal interests.
The politicking of the "party machine" means bribing dissatisfied politicians by appointing them to government posts.
If organizations designed to fight crime do not fulfill their functions, criminals can unite into mafia structures.This negatively affects productivity in the province.
The system of "rotten boroughs" meant the creation of small constituencies, with the help of which victory in elections was achieved.
Due to the lack of proper oversight, politicians often use official powers for personal gain.This causes an increase in discontent among all segments of the population.
The downsizing of the provincial police force is making it easier for anarchists to strike at any moment.
The government cuts spending on fighting crime, which causes even more inequitable distribution of income: the rich get richer, and the poor even poorer.
Reducing the cost of fighting crime increases the risk of anarchist organizations emerging.
Reducing crime-fighting costs increases the risk of street gangs emerging.

Rising crime rates and declining government control contribute to the concentration of business efforts on increasing their own profits.This may end with the collapse of the entire system, since everyone pursues only personal interests.
The politicking of the "party machine" means bribing dissatisfied politicians by appointing them to government posts.
If organizations designed to fight crime do not fulfill their functions, criminals can unite into mafia structures.This negatively affects productivity in the province.
The system of "rotten boroughs" meant the creation of small constituencies, with the help of which victory in elections was achieved.
Due to the lack of proper oversight, politicians often use official powers for personal gain.This causes an increase in discontent among all segments of the population.
The downsizing of the provincial police force is making it easier for anarchists to strike at any moment.
The government cuts spending on fighting crime, which causes even more inequitable distribution of income: the rich get richer, and the poor even poorer.
Anarchist terrorists are no longer a problem
By increasing spending on crime fighting, we have improved our ability to counter security threats such as anarchist protests.
Street crime is no longer a problem
By increasing spending on crime fighting, we have improved our ability to deal with security threats such as street gangs.
Dishonest business is no longer a problem

By increasing spending on fighting crime, we have strengthened government control and reduced crime rates.Businesses are less focused on increasing their own profits.As a result, the risk of collapse of the entire system has been sharply reduced, as fewer and fewer people pursue only personal interests.
Party machine politics is no longer a problem

By increasing spending on fighting crime, we have improved our ability to counter the politicking of the "party machine."Now politicians are much less likely to bribe disaffected by appointing them to government posts.
Mafia is no longer a problem
By increasing spending on crime fighting, we have improved our ability to counter security threats like the mafia.It no longer affects province productivity.
"Rotten places" are no longer a problem

The system of "rotten boroughs" meant the creation of small constituencies, with the help of which victory in elections was achieved.By increasing spending on fighting crime, we were able to solve the problem of too much representation in parliament from towns with a small number of electors.
Plundering is no longer a problem

By increasing spending on fighting crime, we have been able to increase the number of oversight institutions, thereby making it harder for politicians to use official powers for personal gain.As a result, the aggressiveness of the population of the province of $PROVINCENAME$ will no longer grow so rapidly.
Terrorist cells are no longer a problem

By increasing the size of the police apparatus in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, we have dramatically complicated the life of the anarchists, because now it is much more difficult for them to strike at us.
Trusts are no longer a problem

By increasing spending on fighting crime, we have been able to achieve a more equitable distribution of income in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.As a result, the gap between the rich and the poor is now narrower.

Immigrants arrived in the new country and began to look for a place for themselves to settle.They banded together and tried to create an immigrant center, but they need permission to do so.Few of the recent expats know the language of their new homeland, so they hired a translator to help them draft the document.This is the lowest request for permission to build a center for displaced persons.

"A month has passed.Thirty days without work, without money: no food, no clothes for the family.A whole month ...it seems to drag on for an eternity while you search for food in the trash heaps.I hate the thought of begging or stealing, but a month without work is too much ..."\n \nAfter leaving their homeland, many emigrants could not find work in your country.
Convince local businessmen to take them

“Her eyes shone when her husband danced the first dance with her.Despite the whispers, sneers and sidelong glances, she smiled at her dark-skinned husband with a white-toothed smile.Society was shocked by the marriage between a black man and a white high-society woman, but the young couple didn't care."

"Anya Yeze ...what?" 
 "Anya Yezdzherska.Difficult to pronounce? "
" Yes, difficult.Maybe you should change your name? Otherwise it may be difficult to find a job.”
 
Difficult names and awkward spellings can hinder expats from looking for work.

The multitude of immigrants in the country have raised the demand for housing.The construction of new houses should be accelerated - they are already talking about cases when immigrants settle for 10-20 people in a house.This creates certain problems, as it can cause epidemics, and moreover, social tension rises.
It has been five years since the first immigrants arrived in this country.After five years, they can apply for citizenship.By that time, they will no longer be outsiders ...

“He has lived here for five years, passed the exam on the knowledge of the culture and customs of our country, speaks the language almost flawlessly and is married to a wonderful local woman ...$COUNTRY$ is actually your homeland.You certainly deserve to be granted citizenship.Congratulations! You just have to sign here and here ..."\nIt looks like foreigners are not stopped by the stricter requirements for obtaining citizenship.

Immigrants fleeing tyranny arrive in the $PROVINCENAME$ region.They need to be assimilated in our country as soon as possible.Having made the decision to naturalize immigrants, the country accepts immigrants with open arms.

“You have been declared unworthy of the citizenship of this country.You have thirty days to leave the territory of our state, otherwise you risk being imprisoned for four years.”\n \nThe judge is strict, but fair.This man's crime against the state is not so serious as to send him to prison, but serious enough to deprive him of his citizenship and deport him from the country.
Separate schools, separate shops, even separate toilets.The segregation of immigrants and citizens has risen to a new level, causing irritation and resentment.

As more immigrants arrive, their living conditions are constantly deteriorating.Gradually, the so-called ghettos appear - special urban areas where minorities accumulate.Often these are poor neighborhoods with narrow streets and tall buildings, jam-packed with immigrants or minorities of all sorts.

“The last look at his old house, the last tear rolls down his cheek.He shrugs, trying to dismiss the fact that he is leaving his home, maybe forever.The ship, packed with his neighbors and relatives, cannot wait.He takes a suitcase and climbs aboard, hoping that hunger is behind him, and a bright future awaits him in a new world.After arriving in another country, he and his compatriots want to create a diaspora.It will allow them to keep hope of return."

Concerned voices demand the deportation of immigrants who support the ideas of anarchism.The law on the expulsion of anarchists applies to those who do not recognize or oppose organized power structures, as well as members of any organizations that encourage any opposition, and all sympathizers.When this law is passed, your vote is decisive.

“Free the human mind from the dominance of religion, free the human body from the dominance of property, and free us from the shackles and oppression of government! All basic necessities should be available to us, we should not depend on personal preferences, tastes and inclinations! Free us and let anarchism lead us to a free life! "\n \nThe first anarchist immigrant was deported after the law on the expulsion of anarchists was passed.

The old house smells unbearably of mold and rotten wood.There is only an old drunk inside - he runs out the back door, only seeing a beam of light in the dirty window.God only knows how long this house has stood here, but its condition fully reflects what happened to our country in recent decades.Poverty is spreading more and more, and such housing is the norm for many poor people in our country.Even worse, these filthy slums are breeding grounds for disease and contagion.
Seek support for reforms from local residents
I don't see any problem with that.

“While there are frequent speeches in this ward about the cost of disease, surgery and the like, I have not heard anything about the cost of our health care system, in particular the public health implications.How many private clinics are closed every year, unable to compete with the state? How many pharmacies? Private initiative is sacrificed to a state bureaucracy that is by nature ineffective.When will our state finally make healthcare free? ”\n \nThe anti-healthcare reform speech in parliament attracted public interest, and surprisingly many opposed the current healthcare system.What should the government do?
Fully give in to their demands and reverse the reform

“He lives in a big house - a very large country house.?\n \nOur cities are growing every day, accepting new residents from the countryside - no wonder someone can do the opposite.Living conditions in cities are getting worse - cramped conditions, pollution, poor housing.Some of the middle class are again yearning for peace and quiet life in the countryside, and thanks to growing incomes, more and more people can afford to leave the countryside.$COUNTRY_ADJ$ villages and villages are very disposed to this.

“The pigs were fed better than us, I give a damn.?\n \nA local scandal in one of the areas attracted public attention.Apparently, the local factory manager plundered government funds, and compensated for the losses at the expense of workers' food, sometimes giving out only a couple of loaves of bread a day.In this case, both liberals and conservatives are already trying to play - the latter oppose the intervention of the authorities, while liberals demand further social reforms.

Since further social reforms have not yet found sufficient support, the citizens of one of the regions took care of the poor into their own hands, organizing a “Society of Friends?The goals of the community are help and food for the elderly, work and religious education for the poor, and they also have a workhouse.
This is a private initiative, keep it up!
What is this nonsense doing on my desk?

“Thus, this year TB has claimed several thousand more lives in our region.?\n \n $COUNTRY_ADJ$, the public was stirred up after a report from a local doctor was privately published.In addition to general words about unsanitary conditions, terrible living conditions leading to the spread of the disease, the report contains harsh criticism of the authorities: tuberculosis could have been prevented with quarantine, but the authorities are inactive.In addition, there is a severe shortage of medical institutions.Conservatives ridicule the report as a form of alarmism and may be unhappy if the government takes it seriously.On the other hand, a sanatorium would be useful to us.
Fund the construction of a local sanatorium
Ignore the report to please conservatives
Find local sponsors for your sanatorium

“And what is the latest trick of the government? According to the Ministry of Health, there is not enough free wards and food for all parasites in the world.Now, gentlemen, they are going to have their teeth treated for free! "\n \nThe ruling party tried to pass a law on the reform of dental clinics so that citizens have the opportunity to receive at least some dental treatment for free.So far, the idea has not found much support, and there is talk among party members that the case should be dropped.
To carry the bill by force

The state newspaper "Morning Courier" published an article which strongly condemns the "decadence" of the local elite in one of the regions.They were accused of a lack of patriotism, as well as receiving money from foreign powers for anti-government activities.This news has stirred up the lower classes of society, which are increasingly hostile against the local powers that be.To stop publishing in the newspaper is to raise suspicions among the lower classes of hiding the truth, but if this is not done, the ruling classes may feel insecure.

The newspaper "Daily Telegraph", which is read throughout the region, published an article detailing the love affairs of a local politician, which extend far beyond the family.Although there is no libel in the article, his reputation and good name are clearly in question.This politician quickly became a laughing stock among the people.He is dissatisfied and demands from the local court to close down the newspaper, which "undermines morality and public confidence." Liberals in the region will oppose the closure of the newspaper, but if this is not done, then support for reforms in relation to the press will only increase.
What can you do, he was caught without pants ...

Freedom of the press sometimes leads to strange incidents.The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Bulletin, a common yellow rag in one of our provinces, published an article claiming that the Foreign Minister was a secret Freemason.While this is par for the course for this kind of reading matter, this article has garnered more attention than usual.For some reason, people believed in these accusations.If they are denied, the educated people at the top will consider this indulgence in plebeianism, but silence will lead to the fact that the lower classes will finally believe in these rumors.
But I met him at the Masonic lodge that week!

"We, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ People's Committee for Liberation, put forward only one demand to the government, which has settled in the city of $CAPITAL$: The end of one-party rule!" \n \nOnly demand is where there is.Who does this rabble think it is? Flyers with anti-government slogans are being distributed in bars and cafes in one of our regions, and we believe there is an underground printing house behind this.The local police are ready to cover them, and everything would be much easier if these leaflets were not popular with the population.By closing the printing house, we will undoubtedly cause public discontent.

The election of a local mayor in one of the provinces led to a scuffle - a local farmer refused to vote for a government candidate, despite clear instructions.The big man broke the nose of three government officials before the police managed to remove him from the government building where the elections were taking place.They say he screamed about the right to free expression, or something like that.Perhaps he should be punished as an example to others, but any decision will have consequences.
Let him sit for three months on bread and water!

From time to time, we ...redraw the boundaries of areas to ...better capture the desires of people in politics.If a party gets influence where it shouldn't, we just redraw the boundaries of the regions so that people can choose ...a smarter political course.We noticed that liberal sentiment is strong in one of the provinces, but we are not sure if they should vote that way.They could be merged with neighboring districts to form a solid conservative majority throughout the oblast, but this will clearly increase their discontent.
Let's not get involved in a fair fight

As he approaches the ballot box, John Jones feels that he is being watched.The official in charge of the voting, the member of the electoral commission who watches the ballot box, the government agent in the bar from behind the newspaper.Every hour there is surveillance everywhere, and information about his political views is passed on to the government.John is afraid that one dark night someone will knock on his door and ask if he is loyal.Ivan Ivanovich would like to vote in secret.
There is nothing to help the paranoid ...

Major falsification of the results was noticed during the elections to the local assembly in one of the regions.We have good reason to believe that the vote was a major victory for the Conservatives, but the Liberals declared their victory.People expect us to intervene and deal with falsification at the government level, and the victory of the conservatives will reduce tensions in the region, but still ...maybe the liberals will cope better with the government?

“I ask our government - is it really fair that a person who has worked honestly and hard all his life will be deprived of help and support at the whim of chance??\n \nA farmer in one of our regions almost died due to an accident during threshing becoming disabled for the rest of your life.The case is being discussed in the parliamentary debate about the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ pension system.The reformists cite this case as an example, accusing the government of not doing enough for the old and the weak.
Seek support for reforms from local residents

With the increase in life expectancy, more and more families are forced to take care of the elderly who are unable to feed themselves.The structure of society is changing, and in the absence of a public pension system, many are left without help.Most conservatives believe that the family is the first and last resort where old people can turn for help, and government intervention can destroy family ties.Liberals, on the other hand, regard pensions as blasphemous, pointing to the multitude of disadvantaged people.

“In considering government policy, I have tried not to attribute to malice what can be attributed to stupidity.I confess that it was not easy at times.”\n \nOur pension system has been criticized by the opposition within the ruling party.Minor objections aside, the main point of criticism is that pensions are too low.It is necessary to react somehow.
I agree, something needs to be reconsidered
On the contrary, the opposite measures should be taken

“I've been plowing all my life, and now what? A bowl of gruel! ”\n \nAfter the parliamentary report on the pension system was published, this topic is on everyone's mind.The report gives a balanced assessment of the system, but the attention of the people was caught by an interview in the report with an old gentleman who was "overboard" due to some formalities.He is outraged that, although he has worked hard all his life, he only gets oatmeal.
I think reforms will not interfere
Don't give importance to the situation

"While huge sums of money are being withdrawn from our economy for the pension system, there are more and more alarming reports of massive deception of the state, to the point that children of thirteen years old receive benefits!" \n \nHot discussion broke out in parliament today after the committee on pensions and quality of life dissolved without submitting a report.Apparently, the internal conflict between the members of the parties belonging to the committee regarding the procedure for the hearing proved to be an insoluble obstacle.The turmoil in parliament can be used to quickly reverse a couple of the most costly welfare reforms.

“All my life, from an early age, I walked and walked forward, being firmly convinced that I would die young in the service of my dear homeland.And now, calmly awaiting the end of my days, I see that everything turned out differently - I have grown old.”\n \nAlthough life expectancy in the $COUNTRY$ state is growing, an unfortunate coincidence of relatively low salaries and low pensions means that few can prepare for the time when they can no longer work.The educated middle class is in favor of raising the minimum wage, while the aristocracy wants more pensions.
The aristocrats are right in my opinion
Gentlemen are right in my opinion
I think it's better not to carry out reforms at all

War is draining the strength of our people every day, and some cabinet ministers believe it is time to point out to the population the future that awaits them after the war.The Minister of Internal Affairs has made a proposal, which, in his opinion, will be supported by the parliament.By pledging large-scale pension reform after the war, we could increase public support for the war.
During the war, we promised the people a pension reform.Now the war is over, and people expect the government to keep its word.
We have an ambitious reform in the plans!

“I have been to all businesses in the city, but to no avail, sir.What should I do? I can't just sit at home and beat my thumbs.My family expects me to provide them, but what can a poor hard worker do if there is simply no work? ”\n \nThere are few jobs, but many creditors - it’s hard for the poor to make ends meet.
No wonder they are called the poor
We will seek support for the reforms from the local population

“We want to work! We demand work! ”\n \nToday, economics claims that the government needs to pursue an active economic policy to create jobs in industry, but now that unemployment has exceeded five percent, some ideologues of the party are proposing to increase unemployment benefits to calm the masses, while we expect economic recovery.
On the contrary, benefits should be reduced
The current allowance is quite enough
Yes, it's time for such measures

“This year, unemployment payments will again exceed the budget by several percent.And the point, gentlemen, is in percent.The percentage that separates us from bankruptcy.”\n \nOur unemployment programs are causing more losses than expected, and some taxpayers are very concerned about the growing pressure on the budget.A coalition has formed in one region to demand the abolition of unemployment benefits, and their efforts have attracted national attention.
Create a coalition to support benefits

“The workers have taken over the factory! The doors are barricaded!No one can get inside! ”\n \nWorkers in one of the areas occupied a factory and started a sit-down strike.Their demands are an increase in the minimum wage and unemployment benefits.We can fulfill one of the requirements, or we can ignore the problem.
What did they want? Benefits? They'll get them ...
What did they want? More salaries? They'll get them ...
What did they want? Have a good thrashing? They'll get it ...

A spontaneous strike began in one of the regions.The workers have barricaded themselves in the local workshop and do not let anyone inside until "their demands are met." The problem is that they themselves do not put forward any intelligible requirements, except for the general words "more than anything." The local union leader suggested negotiating, but perhaps the best option is to simply ignore them.

The guy's nickname is Red John.They say he sailed on a ship full of bricks and cement, but in his soul he brought whiskey and gunpowder.For the past couple of months, this cosmopolitan bawdy has made a mess of people in one of our provinces, demanding higher wages, organizing meetings in factories and advising workers to unite in trade unions.He was in trouble, and the police just found out that in the evening he was organizing a meeting at a local diner ...

Workers from a government-sponsored workers' affairs committee in one of the provinces offered to give workers an extra day off per year because of their hard work.This will not bring much cost, but it will be perceived as indulging the whims of the working class, and may give the lower classes an incentive to do bad things in the future.

“So it needs to be removed.Not just suspend for a while, but for good, okay? We don't want to see him again.From him nothing but troubles, honestly."\n \nThe union of metallurgists in one of the provinces protests against the head of the factory, who is accused of bullying workers - even beating them - for the slightest manifestation of" laziness ".We could have removed him, but the plant owner says this boss is doing a great job.

A group of strikebreakers sent to a factory in one of our districts to replace the strikers were surrounded in their barracks by workers of the 23rd city trade union.Tensions are mounting and factory managers are demanding that the government send an army to crush the strike.Suppressing a strike by force means permanently damaging the country's reputation both in the world and in front of its own population, but inaction will give the socialists strength and confidence in victory.

A hellish scream rang out in the factory, instantly stopping work.The man stubbornly tried to pull his crippled hand out of the mechanism - when he succeeded, he fell unconscious.The workers gathered around him in a crowd, and the foreman had to make an effort to get them back to their jobs.The wounded man was carried away, while the rest continued to work in silence.

Despite all precautions, Mr.Brown had a rough week.
Monday: nearly lost his left eye due to a colleague's negligence with the stairs.
Tuesday: ruined his best shirt while trying to save his hand from a machine gun.
Wednesday: nearly hit a brick, which was dropped by one of the construction workers.
Thursday: slipped on a slick of oil and nearly broke his neck.
Friday: choked on a sandwich, although a blow to a friend's back helped.
Some incidents could have been avoided if the factory had followed the safety precautions ...

The builders of the $COUNTRY$ state have taken on an innovation: construction helmets.First, they used old military helmets, which the veterans passed on to their sons, and after making sure that the helmet could save lives, other workers began to wear them as well.Old pots and pans were sometimes used.This has improved safety on construction sites and workers are now less likely to suffer from falling objects and tools.

“This is too costly for us, and workers do not always follow safety procedures.They do not use personal protective equipment, and we have more incidents than before."
" He is lying.Safety rules are being followed perfectly, incidents still happen, but injuries are now less severe.”
 
Employers and workers got into a dispute over safety.Employers believe that it is useless, costly, and in any case, not performed by workers.Workers, however, feel that there have been fewer accidents since they began to strictly follow safety requirements.
What does it matter to me?

By introducing spies into the ranks of workers in factories, we can prevent strikes and moderate union power, but there is a risk that workers will expose espionage, and then they will go on strike and start massive protests.Rumors about the use of espionage in other provinces indicate that effective, but not entirely legal, methods were sometimes used to stop harmful campaigning.
We would be helped ...reliable sources of information
Violate their personal integrity?Not worth it ...

Police officers in one of our provinces went on strike over security demands.The local union points out the need for clearer standards for arrests, searches and criminal investigations, and calls for improvements in medical care.The government may comply with the demands, but some cabinet members consider the strike illegal - it threatens public order.
Who do they think they are?
I guess their requirements are reasonable

Warnings about yellow phosphorus necrosis of the mandible are circulating in the factories of the match industry."Phosphorus jaw" is a serious illness, its first symptoms are pain in the teeth and gums.Gradually, an abscess begins in the jaw bones, and only surgical removal can save the patient.Our medical experts recommend switching to safer, but more expensive red phosphorus, which will stop the spread of the disease.
But it costs money, doesn't it?
Workers' health is our first responsibility

Fewer days a year people get sick at the plant, fewer accidents.Many workers are healthy and happy in our factories, which have earned a reputation for being the safest in the world.It looks like our health and safety reforms have finally paid off.Our people are happy and labor productivity has reached its maximum values.
We set an example for other countries

“The young boy got out of the chimney and sat on the roof.His face and clothes were black-black from the ash in the chimney, and this was clearly not the first chimney he had visited today.He wearily walked across the roof and went downstairs, received a penny from the mistress of the house and went about his business.”\n \nThe hard work of young chimney sweeps in the city causes indignation among many residents.A committee was formed to deal with the intolerable working conditions.
You should think about the law that would resolve the situation
Hard work builds up a person's character

“The clock has started, the day has begun, the clock has risen, the day is over.You work all day, no time to rest.By midnight, you fall into bed and fall asleep immediately.You work every day, all week - just work, work, work.You work, and there is no light.”\n \nManufacturer clocks are an innovation that has increased productivity in industry.However, some workers' rights advocates say that watches are alienating workers from the means of production, or something like that.We do not know where they got it from, but we will have to think about the question.
Well, if they need a little rest to be happy ...
Need a law to ban this devilish invention

With the rising standard of living in a country of $COUNTRY$, more and more people from the poorest classes believe they are entitled to a greater share of the country's growing wealth.Some members of radical workers' rights movements have proposed legalizing several hours of rest per day for workers, arguing that it would even increase productivity.Others are not so sure about this and argue that it will violate the basic laws of the economy and the free market.
Get rid of these stupid bills!
Get more rest! Work less! (This also applies to the authorities, right?)

“Although our working conditions are considered to be some of the best in the world, I don’t think we should be proud of being lazy.The only sensible move is to reverse some of these reforms.”\n \nThe parliamentary debate last week focused solely on working hours.Conservatives argue that it is time to enact legislation that is more in line with business interests.
Nonsense, we need to support our unions

Three men, who gathered at the corner to talk about the twists and turns of politics, life, fate and the future, were arrested by local police for violating the ban on public gatherings, curfews and a couple of other local laws in addition.Locals, of course, consider the incident to be police arbitrariness and have already spoken out against the ban on public gatherings.The situation may be absurd, but it clearly shows to what extent the government can control the daily life of the people in the state of $COUNTRY$.
Let them go free and apologize

Everywhere you look, they are whispering everywhere, talking about politics.Obviously, the population in the country $COUNTRY$ is gradually moving towards democratic traditions, and as a result, the ban on public gatherings is not particularly supported.Yesterday, for example, a local politician attended a public meeting in one of the provinces.Even if members of the government do not care about the implementation of the law, it seems that something needs to be changed.
It's time for the outdated law to leave

“The front line is in front of us, and the fate of the country is in our hands, gentlemen.To rise and take a worthy place among the peoples of the world, or fall into the abyss of corruption, despotism and backwardness."\n \nThe gentlemen's club has opened in one of our provinces.The task of the club is to help its members, charity and promote the national interests of the whole country - this club will become the basis of the local community for many years.
$COUNTRY$ is no place for secret gatherings!

The demonstration is proceeding calmly - people with placards gathered in a small group on Elova Street.Looking at the demonstrators, it is easy to understand that they are dissatisfied with something, although it is not entirely clear why.They simply exercise their right to public meetings - but soon the mood of the crowd changes for the worse.The screams in the crowd are louder and louder, and the anger is heard more clearly.By the time local officials negotiate in order to calm the crowd, tension reaches a tipping point and an angry crowd begins to wreck everything around.
This is an obvious consequence of the right to public assembly.
Unfortunately, these are the side effects of the most important human freedoms.

Several well-known radicals have regularly gathered at the city hall on Katona Street for months.The group's radical republican beliefs and their attempts to win new followers attracted the attention of local authorities.The police raided at dawn, and all fears were confirmed - the group was planning an attempt on the life of a famous member of the Cabinet of Ministers, and their further plans included a coup d'?tat.While their plan would obviously not have come to fruition, the incident sparked a debate in the upper house of parliament about limiting public assembly rights.
Freedom should be protected in all circumstances

Furious at the lack of work, government policies and the situation in their city, local workers attacked a factory in one of our provinces.The idea was given to them by some local troublemakers.Several buildings of the factory were plundered, stocks of bread and provisions were stolen, the damage was estimated at several thousand.Local officials quickly stopped the attackers and arrested the leaders, but the incident risks long-term repercussions.What instructions should be given to the Cabinet of Ministers? What is the government's position?
The workers had reasons for such actions.

People took to the streets in one of the regions - they were dissatisfied with the lack of political will and held a demonstration, demanding political reforms from the government.Although the demonstration was largely peaceful, angry tirades were heard during the protest, and tensions between liberals and conservatives were growing.Local aristocrats demand that the government condemn the demonstration for its slogans, abandon reforms and maintain the existing order.Supporting the demands of the aristocrats will displease progressive citizens, while supporting reforms will displease both aristocrats and conservatives.

“A roof over your head, food - bread, cheese, some meat.We do not demand too much, only the essentials for living and working.”\n \nIn $COUNTRY$, a flyer is being published describing the suffering of the poor.The flyer has caught the attention of the public, and some MPs point to the need to raise the minimum wage.

“They say it is true:" a tangled ball." This is what our civil code has become because of the bureaucracy associated with wage reform.”\n \nMembers of Parliament known for their ties to the capitalists of the $COUNTRY$ country criticize the minimum wage reforms, pointing out the supposedly negative consequences of the reform: now the legislation of our country became less simple and transparent.They argue that the system is bureaucratic and should be reformed.However, their proposed reforms are essentially the abolition of the entire system.
I'm sure a compromise can be found
I don't like thick books either

“And although I do not claim to represent all the workers in the country of $COUNTRY$, some of them entrusted me to represent their interests, and this is what they said: we need to raise wages.Prices have risen over the past few years, some goods have doubled - it is unfair that only capitalists benefit from all the benefits.”\n \nA well-known representative of the workers' rights movement met with several ministers and apparently impressed them.The cabinet generally believes it is time to revise our minimum wage laws, but some cabinet members are in favor of the exact opposite course.
It is necessary to cancel some of the previously adopted reforms

"Minimal salary? Who needs it? We've always paid the workers what they deserve - and they've always had enough for housing, food and clothing.Maybe not the best food or clothing, but they weren't starving, right? ”\n \nThe minimum wage policy has angered some $COUNTRY_ADJ$ employers and they are now lobbying to get the minimum wage abolished.They have supporters among influential members of parliament and cabinet ministers.
A local cancellation experiment can be done
The minimum wage will remain the same

“The proletarians have nothing to lose except their chains.They will acquire the whole world.Workers of all countries, unite! "\n \nThe trade union movement has engulfed parts of the country like a fire.More and more agitators are coming to factories urging workers to unionize and rebel against capitalist exploitation.$COUNTRY_ADJ$ laws prohibit the formation of trade unions, but some members of the government believe it is time to change the law.
Need to get local support for reforms
Maybe it's time for a little change

“And since our workers need one body that expresses their common interests, membership in the state union should be compulsory for all civil servants.?\n \nCompulsory membership in the state union for all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ employees has found strong support in parliament.In addition, the proposal is supported by some of the trade unions - many believe that such a decision will be a good compromise with those who demand further liberalization of legislation for trade unions.What is the government's position?
We need to get rid of trade unions in principle
We will be guided by the principles of free will

The so-called "Society of Friends" was founded in one of our provinces.The Society of Friends connects people of similar professions and aims to provide economic assistance to its members, including unemployment insurance, cooperative loans and deposits.The Society of Friends claims to be not a trade union, but rather a cooperative or a bank, but more aggressive cabinet members believe the organization is nothing more than a cover for the socialist trade union movement and should be closed.
Close it and prohibit such organizations

“So I think I can walk around the factory with my guys, talk to the people.Explain to them about law, peace and order.I'll pat them on the tops, so to speak, so that it gets better.These brawlers only understand power.”\n \nSeveral employer associations have called for the legalization of lockouts and union breakdowns.The opinions of members of the government were divided, but most of the factions supporting business support this idea.Some even propose to legally restrict the formation of trade unions.
Legalize the practice of fighting trade unions

“Slavery - the most ancient and sinister manifestation of oppression and tyranny - has already been abolished in almost the entire civilized world, yet in our own country, in $COUNTRY$, slavery flourishes and is supported by law.The law should not be on the side of such an unnatural form of oppression.”\n \nA demonstration of the movement to abolish slavery took place in one of the regions.The demands were reduced to the abolition of the institution of slavery and the emancipation of slaves.
Support for the abolition of slavery in other states

“Yes, here in the country $COUNTRY$ all people are equal and free, but there are still many places in the world where the bonds of slavery and serfdom are stronger than ever.?\n \nAbolitionists in the country $COUNTRY$ demand that the government support abolitionism in other countries ...The support of foreign dissidents is unlikely to have a positive effect on relations with states where slavery is practiced.

In one of our provinces, people flooded the streets - all men, women and children came out to protest against the government.The reason is that the upper house of parliament is appointed, not elected: people are demanding democratic reforms.There are few options for action.Either listen to the demands of the angry crowd, or not - then they will become even more furious.
We will listen to everyone's voice

There is discontent among the general population in the upper house of parliament, which is appointed by the government.Many are dissatisfied with the lack of representation in the current system, and there has been a long-standing campaign that affects public opinion on the issue.In one area, violent protests took place.It's time for the government to make a decision! To ignore the problem means to cause discontent among the population and increase the protest moods directed against the upper house.The compromise will strengthen the position of the liberals in the upper house and displease the conservatives.
It might be worth finding a compromise

In one of the regions, the system of equal representation of all regions in the upper house is criticized.In their opinion, they themselves have too few representatives.It doesn't matter if their dissatisfaction is connected with this particular problem or something else - they are very active in expressing it.Agreeing with protesters, who themselves don't know what they want, will be perceived by other countries as weakness, but ignoring the issue would anger the locals.What is the government's position?
Why is this nonsense on my desk?
Maybe a representation proportional to the size of the population?

People in the most populated areas of our country are pleased with the broad representation in parliament.One region was particularly fortunate: its representatives were able to achieve privileges at the state level.By and large, this does not require government attention, but people are quite happy.Perhaps we should somehow take advantage of the suddenly acquired support of the population.What should the government do?

A professor at one of the most prestigious universities in our country has published a political treatise.It supports a variant of the Jefferson system for appointments to the upper house of parliament.Jefferson's method is the highest average method that grants seats in parliament based on the number of votes received by a given party, with the share of votes received and seats received as close as possible.The treatise attracted attention both at home and abroad.Thanks to this publication, we have the opportunity to reform our electoral system - on the other hand, we can be content with the international prestige gained in connection with this scientific work.What is the government's position?
The image of our country will improve

A national political reform club has been formed in the country $COUNTRY$, the goal of which is to reform the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ electoral system.They managed to gain some influence in the election debate.The club would like to change Jefferson's system to proportional representation.In their view, proportional representation better reflects the aspirations of the majority of the population rather than the political community.Considering the influence gained by the club, the problem should not be ignored, however, at this stage, such a reform would probably be superfluous.

The upper house is entirely in the hands of the liberals - a clear indication that our population supports political reform.This is a good time to reform the electoral system, but what exactly needs to be done? In fact, we can carry out any reforms.We have options: the majority system or the Jefferson system.Although we still need to get the reform project through the legislature, we will succeed.

The crowd outside the walls of Parliament is angry, and its anger is directed at us.The population is furious over problems with city charter reforms.They demand a vote - and hotheads in the crowd are already hinting at a solution to the problem by force.But despite the views of the radicals, the statute reform movement has so far been protesting peacefully.Our government has two options: support the charter reform or oppose it.It's not difficult to choose.

Our electoral system is dependent on land ownership.A recent case caught the attention of the public in one area - a young widow was denied the right to vote as the land in her possession was rapidly losing value due to the collapse of prices in the region.The event sparked discussions on the land qualification as such.Reform ideas are gaining ground in progressive circles.On the agenda is the question of the government's position.Is it worth fixing the voting indices, causing discontent among the poor, or keeping the floating indices?

The right to vote depends on the wealth and property of the voter.The basic principle is that only those who make a significant contribution to the common good have the right to decide how this good should be managed.In one region, this system has resulted in a few local and middle-class merchants with sufficient funds to qualify to vote.Changing the rules will look like an attempt to exclude certain classes from the electoral process, rich people are unlikely to react well to this.Depriving the middle class of the right to vote would create a surge of local discontent.

In the legislative assembly of one of the regions, a discussion about the property qualification unfolded.Opponents believe that the existing system by its very nature excludes broad sections of the population from the electoral process.We can ignore the debate and hope that it does not rise to the state level, or we can step in and defend the existing system, which will lead to debate at the state level.

“Thus, the government will undermine the foundations of stability and tranquility in our home region if it supports the calls for further reforms that are heard from the lips of the revolutionary rabble.They are worse than spoiled babies.”\n \nA group of capitalists, aristocrats and other influential persons from one of the regions contacted our government.They call themselves the Union of Conscientious Citizens, and are trying to point out to the government that opponents of further electoral reforms are still there.What should I say to them?
Let's see what we can do
Well, we can't promise them anything

In one province, people seem to be doing great.One of the regions, which has been in a political stalemate since the last elections, finally got out of the situation by coming to a party compromise.Now local legislatures are back to work.The population takes to the streets, celebrating this event as a great success of democracy, and recalls Schiller's immortal lines: “Joy, unearthly flame, Paradise spirit that flew to us, Intoxicated by you, We entered your bright temple.You bring together without effort All scattered by enmity, Where you spread your wings, People are brothers among themselves."
Truly, this is a special moment!

“My desire is that the accumulated wealth: bonds, stocks, land, capital - all become the basis for the further confirmation of the ideas of human freedom.?\n \nThe era of non-interference has come.A free trade policy allows goods to cross borders freely and our treasury gets fat.As Adam Smith predicted, an invisible hand is leading our nation to prosperity, and hunger has been eradicated for the first time in many years.A wealthy merchant died in one of our cities, bequeathed to use his fortune to establish a free trade policy.

Barricades have been erected on the main street, windows of bakeries have been knocked out, looting reigns.Food disruptions in $COUNTRY$ are escalating, and popular anger is spilling over into the streets.Many blame the government's protectionism for the food market situation, and some are demanding the government's resignation.We have two options for action: change the cabinet and hope that this will calm the population, or wait and believe that our protectionism will pay off in the long run.

The country of $COUNTRY$ is free of trade and there are very few restrictions.However, in one of the neighboring countries there are restrictions on the import of certain goods, in particular, firearms.Conflict is brewing in one of the provinces.$COUNTRY_ADJ$ merchant opened a shop selling weapons across the border.We could notify a neighboring state, but we do not have many legal means to stop trade.Free trade includes the arms trade.
The merchant is a free man

One of our traders found himself in a difficult situation after the bankruptcy of a family business.His business was the backbone of the local industry, and now many of the townspeople are without jobs and livelihoods.This is definitely a tragedy, and we could do something about this situation.The policy of economic intervention of our government allows the use of budgetary funds to support enterprises on the verge of bankruptcy.We can step in and support a dying business.

?..and here is the head of the business agency.?\n \nOur state-owned enterprises have suffered from inertia and corruption for a long time.As a result, there was a shortage of clothing, soap, and in some places even food.The daily needs of the population are not being met, and widespread discontent is only a matter of time.Obviously, it's time to tackle this problem.

The Department of Economic Planning reports miscalculations in last year's interim plan, which resulted in massive additions to military production.Revealing the cause of the mistake is not easy: everyone in the government is washing their hands.We could make up for the "losses" by cutting wages and streamlining the administrative system, but such measures are unlikely to be popular.

?..thus, it is the duty of every $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen to support their home country in this difficult time with all possible forces and means.?\n \nOne of the popular newspapers in our country published an article supporting the militant policy of our government.This is good, and we should think about how to get the most out of it.

Our military has carried out massive recruits across the country and more and more recruits are joining the army.Without government support, recruitment would have failed, the military says.We can use the public support generated by recruitment to reduce the attrition of our population as a result of the war, or we can continue to pursue military goals.

?..and it seems simply inconceivable that our people are suffering under the grievous yoke of poverty, terrible living conditions and morally degrading, and the parliament demands to spend thousands, millions on gunpowder and cannons.Our people really have to go to war, gentlemen, but a war on social vices.”\n \nOne of the members of the government made a long speech in parliament in support of the government's cuts in military spending.How do we respond?
There will be peace in the whole world

“Before us is the main question - not only of our time, it is a question for all times.Should we continue to bear the burden of war placed on the world by the great powers, or should we lower our weapons and say openly that we yearn for peace and are ready to die for it.”\n \nPacifism of our government has received support both in society and in parliament.You can use this support by reducing the militarization of the population, or you can continue to affirm the ideas of pacifism.

“We are on the cusp of a brave new world.Behind a millennium of darkness, shameful ignorance and prejudice.Before us is a new future free from these evils.Here we must choose our own path.God is dead, gentlemen! Will we go ahead, recognizing that the discoveries of science have forever rejected the possibility of the existence of a divine creator, or will we cling to our longed-for nightmare, continuing to tremble in fear of demons, angels and the sins of our fathers.We are free people, gentlemen.Let's behave like a free man.”\n \n $COUNTRY_ADJ$ The clergy, of course, are outraged by the anti-clerical policies.
Let's take their opinion into account

“In recent years, it has become more and more obvious that the union between church and state can no longer exist due to the growing contradictions.Contradictions that lead to local clashes.”\n \nIn one of the regions, the secular politics of the ruling party caused a minor incident.Local clergy received government support for charitable purposes.Among other things, religious organizations were allowed to rent public buildings at prices well below market prices.

"We are all different.All of us living on the holy land in the country of $COUNTRY$ sing in different voices.But we are one, because we are all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens.”\n \nThe wind seems to be changing.Old conflicts are a thing of the past, sworn enemies are shaking hands.It seems like a dream, but the policy of pluralism of our ruling party has led to a new era of understanding and tolerance in our state.The world may be deceiving, but it is undoubtedly the world.

“Thus, the moral foundations of the nation have been undermined, and all the vices of society have found shelter in our country.We desperately need a moral revival in the $COUNTRY$ state.We must return to the primordial values, to the basics, to what was the basis of the greatness of our country.”\n \nIn one area, a priest organized a small but popular organization whose goal is to restore moral foundations in the $COUNTRY$ state.Undoubtedly, this organization is trying to support the policy of moralism chosen by the ruling party and can become a valuable ally of the party.

“But today our quality goods are losing out to cheap consumer goods from abroad that have flooded the markets.Therefore, it is especially important to protect the local industry from the harmful effects of foreign competition.”\n \nOne of our regions suffers from strong foreign competition, and a protectionist lobby has emerged.Their goals are to establish subsidies for "key industries" of the national industry, as well as to impose restrictions on the import of goods from abroad.

“And today, when the decrepit dragon of mercantilism rears its head, those who do not want to close the borders between the peoples of the world should clearly speak out in support of freedom.?\n \nPublic opinion has been stirred up by the formation of the free trade movement in one of our regions ...The movement is directed against protectionism in government policy, and also demands the abolition of some basic laws in our economic policy.
We will take into account their arguments

“And thus, in this case, the issues of economic freedom should be separated from the broader issue of public morality.Free trade leads to an influx of abominations, sewage, and this dirty stream, in which our people drown, must be stopped.”\n \nA debate unfolded between moralists and free traders in one of the regions of our state.Moralists believe that our free trade policy allows traders to import any kind of goods, and they demand a ban on the import of goods that undermine the moral foundations of society.

“The war that our country is entering is our war.Not only because the war for the fatherland is just, but also because of the moral superiority of our side.”\n \nOur government's policy of upholding the moral foundations of society has fueled widespread moralist support for the war.Some even call the $COUNTRY$ war a crusade.
Brave warriors, you deserve a rest!

“In light of the recent attacks by some members of our community, I propose a temporary ban on gatherings in public places.The city is known to follow the mood of the crowd - remove the crowd and the city will calm down.”\n \nThe Conservative clique in the Upper House, using the riots in $COUNTRY$ as an excuse, began to promote the idea of ??temporarily banning public gatherings.Although the ban is supposedly temporary, representatives of other parties fear that it could become permanent.
Temporary ban is a good idea

“I just want bread.I have been standing in line for four hours now - I don’t think they have bread.”\n \nLines in the streets grow several houses long.Government food supplies have a hard time reaching one of our provinces due to inefficiency and bureaucracy in the Department of Transportation.Obviously, local residents expect decisive action from the government.
Claim that there is no problem

“I believe that we have lost our place in the sun.The state of $COUNTRY$ was respected among other nations, but today our voice seems to be deliberately not heard.I believe that we need to assert our positions in the international arena.Someone may accuse me of adventurism, but our country was created by the hands of adventurers.”\n \nThe Politburo held a meeting dedicated to the international situation of the country.The mood of the bureau members is very gloomy - some of them are proposing a military campaign to confirm our status and divert attention from internal discontent with the regime in the state.

“We will not succumb to the persuasion of the capitalists, who profit from the war, trying to play off the workers of different countries with the help of imperialist propaganda! The workers of the whole world are brothers, we have one language.The sweat and blood of our brothers is also our sweat and blood! The capitalists are making money, comrades, and we are shedding blood! ”\n \nA trade union strike has begun in one of the provinces.Although the strike is officially called “For Peace and Solidarity,?some in the government suspect it is the first manifestation of socialist unofficial power.
Additional War Support Should Be Enlisted

“Our agitators are oppressed, the party headquarters is closed, our representatives are prevented from working here and there.It's amazing that we are gaining votes at all! Harassment of political parties is a shame, a shame of our nation and a mockery of those whom I would call the electorate, had $COUNTRY$ really democratic elections.”\n \nLeading representatives of the liberal political flank expressed strong protest against the oppression of their parties in our electoral system.The politicians are furious and demand action from the government of the country.
The government is now not up to political reforms
The government believes that some reforms will not get in the way

Over the past couple of years, the censorship department has been overwhelmed with work, and the bosses have already complained several times that subordinates cannot cope with the huge amount of materials received for verification.The problem of blockages in the department has reached a critical point: an article full of false anti-government propaganda - in fact, slandering several members of the government - got into the press.When asked how the newspaper managed to get past the censorship, the department pointed to several previously submitted reports.All problems are explained by the lack of resources of the censors.However, some cabinet ministers believe the department has more than enough funds to handle its tasks, and organizational issues are at the heart of it all.

“And this is what the speculation of our industrial magnates has led to! Gentlemen, here are the results! Hundreds of thousands, if not millions, of funds were lost due to risky investments, speculation in the real estate market and bonds, which turned out to be just candy wrappers.I urge those gathered here to take decisive action to remedy the situation by tightening regulation and increasing government intervention.”\n \nMember of Parliament criticized our government's economic policies, pointing to a number of failed private sector investment projects.
Economic freedom is inextricably linked to human progress

I wonder what they were thinking at all - to publish such a text in the country $COUNTRY$? Well, you can't undo what you've done.One of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ daily newspapers published a blasphemous article attacking everything religious.The text was written by a prominent representative of our intelligentsia.In today's godless times, this is quite expected.Moralists demand an apology to religious organizations for this article, but some reform-leaning members of the elite argue that the author only took advantage of freedom of speech.After all, $COUNTRY$ has a free press, so there is some truth in their words.
Seems like our citizens were given too much freedom
The author enjoys the rights that our law gives him
The Geographical Society has established a fee for anyone who discovers the source of theNile.
We do not want to participate in this stupid undertaking.
Our expedition returned with no results.The source of theNile has not been found, but the expedition members hope that the next expedition will be more successful.
The second expedition to the source of theNile disappeared without a trace.They can probably be considered dead.Should we take a third try?
The source of theNile is discovered
Our brave explorers have mapped the source of theNile and brought glory and prestige to our great country!
This is the day of glory of our science!
The Geographical Society has established an award for the first person to reach theNorth Pole.
I wonder what might be useful in exploring these frozen lands?
Our expedition to theNorth Pole returned unsuccessful.However, its participants very much hope that another expedition will take place.
The second expedition to theNorth Pole disappeared without a trace.They can probably be considered dead.Should we take a third try?
Our brave explorers were the first to plant the flag at theNorth Pole and bring glory and prestige to our great country!
The Geographical Society awards first to the South Pole
Thanks, but we've already seen enough of the penguins!

The wind of the revolution is blowing, the storm is about to break out.The country $COUNTRYNAME$ is in liberal fever.

Late blight, the death of the potato crop, has hit crops in the $PROVINCENAME$ province.Local farmers are starving, and in some places entire families are fleeing.The loss of the potato crop has caused famine in the province, and it threatens to spread even wider.

Healthy shoots emerged in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ this spring.The potato fungus epidemic that hit $PROVINCENAME$ is finally over.

The sentries in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are standing firmly and confidently.At least according to the local poet.A poetic pamphlet lamenting the state of the country has stirred up one of our provinces.Calls for national unity are heard throughout the province of $PROVINCENAME$.Liberals take to the streets to protest against the old order and call for national unification with brothers in other countries.

A new daily newspaper appeared in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ - "Provincial Gazette $PROVINCENAME$", which publishes local news and commentary on sensitive political issues, as well as literary criticism.The newspaper became the mouthpiece of local liberals.
Hope I don't get on the obituaries page
A local chapter of the Chartist Society has sprung up in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, demanding increased voting rights and the abolition of the land qualification.

Liberal ideas are spreading in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.No one knows what the reason for their sudden rise in popularity is, but rumor has it that a secret society was recently founded.Rosicrucians, Freemasons or Bavarian Illuminati - Someone is spreading liberal propaganda in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.
Or maybe they want us to think so?

Thick smog from factory chimneys loomed heavily over the city in a blood-red sky full of coal dust.Deep in the city, in the heart of the industrial machine, the echo of the screams of an angry mob rises above the chimneys and gutters.Luddites, enraged by the intolerable working conditions, yearn for a return to the good old days, to the country pastoral - and take to the streets of the province of $PROVINCENAME$.
Send troops to pacify the Luddites

Immorality is like water - seeps through the smallest cracks in the wall of the law.Liberals in $PROVINCENAME$ have begun gathering for banquets to circumvent the ban on public gatherings.Allegedly aimless gatherings and holidays among friends - in fact (as everyone knows) are political gatherings, which are trying to give a veil of legitimacy.

Like rats carrying the plague, liberal propagandists freely cross our borders.Liberal propaganda is spreading in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ from a neighboring province.Perhaps labor troops should be sent.

“At a time when the forces of the revolution threaten to sweep away the age-old order in Europe, our sacred duty is to protest.The Jacobins, for whom nothing is sacred, are simply charlatans and false prophets.The terror that Robespierre brought to France, they are eager to bring $COUNTRY$ to the state with their radical ideas.”\n \nLiberal propaganda in the $COUNTRY$ country has mobilized the forces of reaction.One of the leading conservatives in intellectual circles published a treatise against Jacobinism.

“Know, then, that those who demand revolution are opposed to God Almighty Himself and his plan, for he has set rulers over kingdoms.?\n \nA local preacher in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ delivered a fervent sermon denouncing liberal ideas.

"Death to the king!" - hoarse voices shout.The streets in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are filled with people.Injustice - imaginary or real - has provoked the revolt of the mob against our government.The revolution is still weak, and its future is vague - perhaps it will go out by itself? Or maybe it is worth resolutely suppressing it in order to set an example for everyone?
Start negotiations with the leaders of the uprising
A revolution is raging in the state of $COUNTRY$, the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has revolted.Calling for freedom, equality and fraternity, citizens take to the streets.
