The downpour drum loudly across the empty square.The torn leaflet is thrown into the gutter - the ink is slowly draining from the sheet.This is a final reminder that until recently the province of $PROVINCENAME$ was a hotbed of liberal propaganda.The leaflet depicts a sansculotte, the personification of the French Revolution, holding the republican tricolor.The words are simple: "Freedom, equality and fraternity in the $COUNTRY$ state." Soon, the remains of the leaflet are washed down the sewers by torrents of rain, returning these ideas to the underground from which they came.

The barricades have been destroyed, the fluttering tricolors are not visible from the windows.The events that went down in history as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ liberal revolution $YEAR$ of the year are already in the past, and apparently we have weathered the storm.
Let us pray for the souls of the fallen

The main symptom of cholera is continuous diarrhea, leading to dehydration of the patient.In severe cases, the disease is fatal within a couple of days of the onset of symptoms.It is one of the fastest growing fatal diseases.Today news came - in one of the provinces there is indeed a cholera outbreak.
How bad can the consequences be?
Just a minute ago he was calmly going about his business, chatting as if nothing had happened, and now he grabbed his stomach, trying to run to the restroom.The reasons are obvious.
Go get drunk the day before?
Liberals took advantage of the cholera epidemic

“Our workers and peasants live in squalid hovels - the only good thing is that they can be easily burned to the ground!No sanitation - this is how an ordinary citizen lives in the $COUNTRY$ state.Is our government still "surprised" by the cholera epidemic in the $PROVINCENAME$ province? "\n \nThe cholera epidemic in the $PROVINCENAME$ province has become the object of politics - the liberals used it to blame the government.

Throughout the country $COUNTRY$, crowds of celebrants, waving $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$ flags, take to the streets to hear news from the $FROMCOUNTRY$ state that $FROMRULER$ proclaims himself the liberator of all $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$ people.
 
 “Our the country was pushed around by foreign powers, organizing conspiracies and machinations.Henceforth and forever, in the vastness of our homeland, we are laying the foundations for a more perfect union.Three cheers for $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$! ”
 
Resistance to the wind of change is pointless.
But what about my noble origin?

Black smoke pours from the quarry in huge clouds, the faint smell of burnt flesh mingles with the smell of fire and coal.In the chaos, the survivors try to save what is left of the coal mine after the $YEAR$ Year Great Explosion.The age-old sleep of coal seams was disturbed by the explosion of methane from underground cavities.Carelessness with a lamp, a spark from a pick - and the mine was filled with hellish flames.

“The general conclusions of the commission are as follows: working conditions at $COUNTRY_ADJ$ coal mines do not meet even the most basic safety requirements.Child labor is widely used in mines, in particular in very dangerous and dirty work - the youngest worker is only nine years old.Poor lighting, poor ventilation and air that was blackened by night from coal dust.What's more ..."\n \nThe $YEAR$ Mines and Quarries Commission of the Year has submitted a final report on working conditions at $COUNTRY_ADJ$ coal mines, and the results are disappointing.

“The crate of coal was too heavy for her fragile body, emaciated by years of hard work in the coal mines of $PROVINCENAME$, and her legs gave way.In the dark, she stumbled and fell into the depths of the mines.”\n \nAnother girl died in coal mines in one of the provinces, and this tragedy caused a surge of public attention throughout the country.

One of our projectile factories has been reporting a production failure in the past three months - this has not been reported so as not to panic investors and industrial tycoons.By covering the factory deficit with government stocks, we could save jobs.

Residents of the province of $PROVINCENAME$ complain about emissions from a fertilizer factory.For the local government, the factory smells of roses - it is the basis of the budget, but ordinary residents are tired of feeling the stench.We could have issued directives for the factory to change the process, but doing so could displease industrial tycoons.
The crop does not grow by itself, alas
Yes, consideration should be given to emission limits

The central tea weighing station in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ is robbed by armed bandits.Some local residents believe that the hard times in the region have forced local farmers to rob the weighing machine - they are tired of watching wholesalers and traders make all the profits.Whatever the reasons, you need to deal with the situation.

During the war, every canned food from the $PROVINCENAME$ Canned Food Factory is just as important as cannonballs and rifles.The food is excellent and the soldiers seem to like it.The General Staff placed another large order at the factory.

The army chief of supplies reported the discovery of a forgotten canned food warehouse at a military facility in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.The canned food seems to be edible, although it has been in use for a couple of years.What do we do with fifteen tons of canned food?

A cattle epidemic has broken out in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, causing massive deaths.The veterinarian of the local garrison travels around the province, trying to somehow keep the infectious disease under control.While the epidemic seems to be ending on its own, there remains the question of reparations for the hundreds of impoverished farmers and their families.

Cocoons die, and the threads on them do not curl properly, unwinding at the slightest breeze.Something has gone wrong in the silk fields, and the best chemists cannot find a cure for the disease that has plagued our farms.Local silk producers are outraged and demand action from the government.
There is nothing we can do

A well-known chemist has found a cure for the disease that has plagued the silk fields in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, and with government support, this medicine can be distributed to all provinces if the disease appears there too.

Cotton from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ is one of the best in the world in terms of quality and strength.The reputation of this cotton has been earned over the years.Local farmers began to take pride in the fact that the word $PROVINCENAME$ had become a seal of quality in the cotton market.

“The great issues of our time are not resolved by the speeches and decisions of the majority, but by iron and blood.?

New rich deposits of iron ore have been discovered in a mine in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.The ores are rich in iron, but it is at dangerous depths beyond the reach of our mining industry.We could try to mine the ore, but this attempt will cost a lot of blood and human lives.
Bite deeply and greedily into the ground!

In the docks, marinas, and quays in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, the hammer and the squeak of a saw never stop as the local factory is struggling to handle orders for clippers from all over the world.Efficient production and management, as well as the craftsmanship of the builders and sailors, have allowed the province of $PROVINCENAME$ to produce more and better ships, setting a record for production volumes! The province of $PROVINCENAME$ has built a reputation for cement manufacturing in recent years.It all started with a family business, and now has grown into a huge industry, which has become the basis of the well-being of the entire province.Cement grade "Standard $PROVINCENAME$" is becoming common.$COUNTRY_ADJ$ cement produced by the technology of the $PROVINCENAME$ province is appreciated and tried to be repeated all over the world!

The $PROVINCENAME$ refinery has been doing well lately, with production exceeding expectations by several thousand gallons.Due to storage problems, the owner of the plant was forced to turn to the government, offering to buy the surplus at a very low price.We could buy the fuel ourselves, or refuse him and wait while the owner tries to sell them cheaper on the market.The locals will need cheap fuel, but it won't hurt us either.

Another tragedy that claimed several lives occurred today at a mine in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.Several workers were injured, some of them are still missing.The poorly reinforced support in the mine broke, causing a collapse.This accident will spark a debate about working conditions in our mines.

A fisherman from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ brought a huge catch today.His ship is packed full of seafood, and soon other fishermen will bring the same catch.There is an unusually large amount of fish in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ this year.

A local radio station in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ lacks transmitter parts and had to stop broadcasting until they solved the problem.The local authorities are offering to borrow the details of the radio station, as the local population may be worried about the lack of news from the front.

More and more social, religious and educational institutions in the country of $COUNTRY$, as well as a significant part of the middle classes, see the ominous influence of alcohol on our society.Pointing to the consequences - broken windows, shattered fortunes - some even demand a complete ban on the liquor trade.The owners of distilleries in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are concerned about what is happening and want guarantees of sales of their products in the future.

A fire at an explosives warehouse in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ caused a huge explosion, which is said to have been heard even in the city of $CAPITAL$.The destruction is extensive, hundreds of people have died.The flames are spreading in the city, the fire is threatening the rich houses in the north and the poor neighborhoods in the south, so the firefighters need to decide what to save.

“Perhaps this is a chair, madam? Made of Brazilian mahogany with fineNubian ivory carvings.Appreciate marbled leather.There is no other chair of this kind in the province of $PROVINCENAME$! ”\n \nThe rising standard of living in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has led to an increase in demand for luxurious, elegant furniture.People strive to decorate their homes.Government agencies should also improve their appearance.

No extra expenses while I'm in power

The $PROVINCENAME$ luxury apparel factory is in trouble: several shipments have been disrupted in recent weeks.The reason for the refusals is simple - the clothes do not sell well, and this is not surprising: the cut is terrible, the buttons are so large that they seem ridiculous.Strange ...last season these clothes looked pretty.
Insist that officials wear these clothes
The designer will pay with his head!

Water seeped into a factory warehouse in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, damaging clothes crates.A pungent, smelly mold appeared on it.The clothes look normal, but the fabric smells of damp basement and standing water.Perhaps the clothes can still be saved, but it is not clear if anyone will ever wear them.
Give clothes to the poor and replace the batch

“The winds of Western civilization blew in the East, and every blade of grass and every leaf follows their wobble.?\n \nWe call recent events an omen.Weird ships have appeared on our shores.Their masts are high, as if they reach the sky.At first, only a few, and now more and more - like a wind ready to turn into a storm - what will happen tomorrow? Their ships are amazing, and all the more amazing are their customs.Obviously, it is necessary to make a decision about foreigners from "Europe".

News from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ - a community of emigrants from European countries and great powers has emerged there.This is undoubtedly the result of our government's policy of open ports and borders.Western influence can be beneficial, as our government is convinced, but some are not so complacent about foreigners.

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$ there are rumors about strange people found on the beach in the morning.The origin of the shipwrecked sailors is being specified, but it is clear that they are not from the $COUNTRY$ state.

A citizen in $PROVINCENAME$ was wearing foreign clothing.Interrogation by the authorities revealed an entire organization that brought goods from abroad.

Despite the obvious fairness of our isolation policy, some foreign goods may come in handy, and members of the government have spoken out in favor of opening a small commercial port in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, where foreign ships can dock and trade without violating our country's general isolation policy.This will benefit both the province and the country, but conservatives argue that the destructive influence of foreigners can penetrate us through this loophole.

A sweet, strong scent lingers on the streets of cities in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, creeping in all directions from foreign stores.European merchants brought with them the habit of smoking opium, and our subjects are so addicted to it that it is time to talk about an epidemic.Each new ship with goods plunges more and more people into the abyss of drug addiction.What to do?
Issue a law prohibiting the opium trade

Huge sailboats sail along the coast from north to south like wolves, choosing weak and weak-willed victims among the population, which can be easily poisoned with deadly poison.Foreign ships dock in any ports, sinking their claws into our bloodless people.Opium has come to the province of $PROVINCENAME$.

Addiction to opium from neighboring provinces spreads inland.Farmers and workers in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have stopped going to work, the fields are empty, and people in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are more and more subject to the lethal addiction.
Order local officials to destroy opium shipments

“From your country to the state $COUNTRY$ sixty or seventy thousand.However, the ships of the barbarians sail here for profit.The wealth of the $COUNTRY$ state is now used to enrich the barbarians.By what right did they poison the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people with a deadly poison? "\n \nOne of the governors decided to tackle the opium problem himself and wrote a letter to the foreign head of state criticizing support for the opium trade.
No! Apologize and end this madness!

Rangaku, literally 'Dutch sciences', in Japanese means knowledge that came from the West, from the Dutch, through the trade port of Dejima.The same happens in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ - local officials translate Western scientific works and books, thereby contributing to the development of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ science and natural history.

He hides his face and can barely contain his anger.A local aristocrat from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ was humiliated by a foreigner.Apparently the foreigner did not bow properly when passing by the aristocrat.Will we tolerate such disrespect for our customs?

Like a child, he enthusiastically points at the device.“You can see their eyes! he exclaims, pointing to the can of beetles.- Look through the eyepiece - there are lenses that magnify the image tenfold.“This is a microscope,?the scientist smiles.- I bought it from a foreigner in the province of $PROVINCENAME$! "

The aliens have gone too far! Their missionaries preach false doctrines that confuse our people and undermine national unity.They violate our customs, and their opium obscures our minds.This is what you hear if you ask people in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, where an uprising against foreigners has just broken out.

We decided to open the doors to the West - if our subjects are to support our decision, then the royalty must set an example.Educated rulers are essential if we yearn to take a worthy place among other powers.By sending offspring to get an education in Europe or by hiring Europeans to study here, we will achieve what we want.What do you say, your majesty?
Is this your project? Close the doors!

The European governess we hired to educate the courtiers is doing well, but some of her ideas are foreign to local traditions.For example, she sharply declared the equality of people and that the country $COUNTRY$ should abandon the centuries-old system of slavery.Not sure, Your Majesty, but these are dangerous speeches ...
Let him speak.We will not do anything ...

One of the great powers became interested in our country and offered to send a military mission to us.This will clearly help our development, but in the event of war it can become a burden.However, rejection of such a generous offer can be taken as an insult.Allow military mission?
Of course! Our troops need modernization ...

Information about the military preparations of our country became available due to the military mission in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, seriously damaging our military plans.We expelled the members of the military mission, but the damage has already been done.

The high level of hostility in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has led to violence against local immigrants from abroad.The embassies of the great powers have sent complaints to our government and are awaiting action.What should I do?

Drunken sailors in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ prisons usually don't become a matter of national importance, but this one is the exception to the rule.A sailor of one of the great powers was arrested in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ for the murder of a citizen of our country in a drunken brawl.The diplomatic attach? insists that the sailor be handed over to his homeland for trial.We have a problem.Agreeing once means that foreigners will continue to be able to avoid our justice.Refusal will anger foreign states.This problem should be thought about.

A report has come from our attach? in the country $FROMCOUNTRY$ that the sailor of our merchant ship has been executed.According to the report, a sailor killed a local in a fight on the beach in $FROMPROVINCE$.Despite the efforts of the diplomatic mission, he was tried and executed according to the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ laws.We grieve, but we should think about how to respond to the insult to our people.

News from the country $FROMCOUNTRY$ - they decided to give foreigners the right to be tried under the laws of their home country.Undoubtedly, they made this decision under pressure from the great powers, but still this is good news.
We are happy with this decision

The presence of Europeans in our part of the world is growing.Military reform is increasingly needed.Europeans have regiments of trained professionals, while our army is outdated.It is ruled by clans, nobility, family ties and personal loyalty matter.

We were defeated.Despite the policy of total isolation, a hostile world invaded our lands.$SPHEREMASTER$ destroys the barrier on our borders.Now our country is a satellite, obediently obeying their power.Foreign traders, missionaries and spies poured across our borders, trampling on our sovereignty in our own land.We are no longer in control of our destiny, and we are commanded to obey.But before dawn the darkness is blacker ...

“You must not only be loyal and respectable subjects, but also honor the traditions of the forefathers.?\n \nThe education system in the $COUNTRYNAME$ state is bogged down in a web of ancient traditions and dogmas.This has contributed to the preservation of the traditional order in the past centuries, but the old system has difficulty adapting to knowledge from Western countries.The reform of the system threatens the discontent of the supporters of tradition, but are we entitled to delay it?

Several great powers have tried in recent years to open permanent diplomatic missions in the $COUNTRYNAME$ state, but we have refused them so far.However, an idea appeared in the capital: perhaps it is worth letting them open embassies, provided that they are all in one place, where we could control them? It seems that the embassy quarter in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ is a good idea.
I hope they appreciate our offer.
What for? Do they have something to offer us?

Walking alone on the streets in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ can be very dangerous, as the foreign ambassador has convinced himself of.The guards found him dead at four in the morning.Apparently, it was a robbery, but foreigners accuse us of not being able to protect the diplomat.I suppose even a formal apology will not calm them down, but something more substantial could help ...
Reluctantly, order to erect a monument to the deceased
This is nonsense, he himself is to blame!

The oil lantern flashed, illuminating the damp areas of the hold with a dirty light.An ordinary ship docked in the provincial port of $PROVINCENAME$ hardly aroused suspicion, but years of deception by foreign merchants have developed a sixth sense of trouble in our people.A rat that ran between the boxes attracted a man's attention.Sweet, tart, very familiar scent.Opium.A hold full of opium.

One of our traders has recently been expelled from the $FROMPROVINCE$ province.Apparently he tried to smuggle opium despite the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ban on imports.A liberal in the lower house of our parliament spoke out on this situation.\n \n “The right to trade freely and openly across the seas on all continents is an inalienable right of humanity.Our rights are violated in the $FROMCOUNTRY$ state, and I can only guess how long our government will tolerate the antics of these savages."
Country $FROMCOUNTRY$ demands to remove trade restrictions!

“Your trade restrictions are a shame for your own country.Honest $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens who only want to trade freely have been expelled from your ports, and we demand an immediate resolution of the situation.The state $COUNTRYNAME$ will have to remove these restrictions or prepare for the consequences."
Bending under the gusts of wind does not mean breaking
We will give a fitting rebuff to the forces of evil

The trade dispute between the $FROMCOUNTRY$ state and the great powers has been going on since the second half of the 18th century.In the end, tensions reached a tipping point - in the $MONTH$ $YEAR$ year, when officials several times rejected requests for free trade (implying the lifting of the ban on the sale of opium), which were addressed by the state $COUNTRY$.The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government, which had long taken a course of conflict, could not but declare war, and thus the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ - $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ opium war began.
The reforms in our country are not to the liking of the landowners in the $PROVINCENAME$ province.

The defeat in the last war led us to a clear realization that change is necessary.Otherwise, our country will not be able to adapt to the new world realities.A series of quick reforms could help in this.

There is no cloud in the sky, the ocean is calm, and the sun sinks into the waters off the coast of the province of $PROVINCENAME$.Somewhere far over the sea, seagulls are screaming, they are not disturbed by the events that determine the paths of states and peoples.The tranquility of our country has not been disturbed for centuries, but suddenly a point appeared on the horizon.In the distance, where the sky meets the sea, a white spot has appeared.Soon it increased - a sail, a mast, a flag ...There is clearly not a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ship on our shores, but a European one.We do not know their intentions at the moment.What to do with the ship?

Foreigners have many stories.One of them is about a man who entered the city on a donkey.Perhaps this is the same person who came to the province of $PROVINCENAME$ today? We do not yet know why the strange foreigner came to the province of $PROVINCENAME$, but he was seen by the local authorities - it seems that he intends to stay.
This is a matter of national importance, yeah
The targets of foreigners in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are revealed! They decided to do missionary work here and organize a parish!
Westerners in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have opened a school where Western arts and sciences are taught.
Traders from the great powers have been developing their activities in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ for some time, and now it has become one of the centers of foreign trade.
The Europeans have built a coal base in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ to fuel ships.

They march back and forth across the parade ground in even ranks.The orders of the officer, the wave of his hand is instantly transmitted to all the troops, like a revived wave.A couple of months ago, these recruits were ordinary peasants, farmers with no weapons in their hands.Now they are quickly becoming soldiers - hundreds of people follow the order of one.Now we understand what is the source of European military power.
People from the West in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ organized a diplomatic mission to expand contacts and cultural exchange between us and Western countries.

"He is beautiful!" - a woman rejoices like a child.European traders in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ bring to the coast the most curious goods from their countries, in particular, this chic sofa - they say it is made of precious woods.

The stars above $COUNTRY$ have always shown us the way, but never before have we seen them this close.Merchants in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have brought a modern telescope to the country of $COUNTRY$ - now we can also uncover the secrets of heaven.Trade in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ helps our scientific research.

For several days she has not got out of bed, in a feverish delirium complains of headaches.Her forehead is as hot as an oven, she trembles all the time and is very tired.All rituals of ablution and infusions of our doctors are powerless.We had already lost hope, but suddenly her son burst into the room with a European from a local trading post! “This will help her! the merchant says, taking a small glass bottle from his jacket pocket.- Warburg's Potion!Nothing cures malaria better than a few drops of Warburg's Potion! " And after a couple of days she is healthy again.
The debate had already lasted for several hours when one of the candidates came up with convincing arguments in favor of his program, which silenced opponents.
Decisive arguments for a market economy
Decisive arguments in favor of the state.interference
Decisive arguments in favor of the state.capitalism
Decisive arguments for a planned economy

"The morality and virtues of our people are threatened with decline!" This statement caused great excitement among the participants in the debate on religious tolerance and religious pluralism.They began to discuss the attitude towards religion in the country.
Religion is not a matter of politics!
Let people believe in their gods.
There is only one true faith!

Two debaters ardently defend their views.The rest of the audience watches in daze as they are tossed about with the words "foreigners", "minorities", "ethnic and cultural groups," and so on.One of them wants immigrants to adapt to the dominant culture, while the other believes that they must preserve their cultural heritage.
We need to restrict their civil rights.

Patriots and pacifists fight in the town hall, calling each other offensive and derogatory words.Long buried and forgotten, it seemed, the dispute between the country $COUNTRY$ and its neighbor is back in the spotlight.The patriots want an invasion of the country, and the pacifists believe there are other ways to resolve this dispute.
We are patriots and we will go to fight for our country!
We do not reject forceful methods, but in this situation it makes no sense.
This issue can be resolved without the use of force.
Smuggling has become a big problem since tariffs were raised on certain goods in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.You have to do something about this, and immediately!
It is necessary to lower duties on these goods and raise them on some others.
Leave the duties as they were.
We need to reduce duties in general.
New goods began to crowd out goods of their own production in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.It is difficult to compete with imported goods.
We have to export our goods.
We need to find a new occupation for our citizens.
Leave the duties as they were.
It is necessary to lower duties on these goods and raise them on some others.

Traders from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have come into conflict with the finance minister who wants to monopolize some of their trade.Their heated argument has reached your ears, and you are trying to cool both sides.
I see no reason to establish a monopoly.
Both sides have strong arguments, but we will not establish a monopoly.
No interference, let everything go on as usual.There will be no monopoly.
Great idea, but I have to think.
This is a great idea.So we will do it.
“The production rate is too high.We can never deal with it." The rest of the peasants stand behind him and wait.Their weathered faces bear the same alertness and determination as the speaker's.
Nonsense.The production rate will remain the same.
You have nothing to worry about.
We will resolve the issue if the production rate becomes an issue.

Debates have flared up in the upper house over whether the state should intervene in the local economy.Opponents argue that the state economy is centrally controlled and the provincial economy should be controlled locally.Meanwhile, the economy is heading for the abyss.
It takes time, but it will work.
Who produces what, where is it produced, how much does it cost, and where is it going?

The province of $PROVINCENAME$ has been criticized for its planned economy.It is believed that those who plan the country's economy are not able to take into account the preferences of consumers and the shortage or surplus of goods with the necessary accuracy, therefore they cannot effectively coordinate production.This worries the residents of the province of $PROVINCENAME$.
Those who plan know what they are doing.
This is probably nonsense, but we'll figure it out.

Some religious denominations believe that the state neglects them.For years they have been providing people with various assistance, taking care of the sick, orphans and those in need.They ask for a little support so that they can continue to help people.
A dispute arose between the two religions over a minor issue.They turned to the state in an attempt to resolve the conflict.
You have to figure it out yourself.
We would like to help, but this is not our business.
Let me give you some advice ...

The religious leader of the $PROVINCENAME$ province is furious.The new residents brought their own religions and their spiritual shepherds with them, and he believes his flock is beginning to show undue interest in these new religions.
There is nothing we can do about it.
We will do our best, but we will not tolerate it.
A religious leader has approached you with a request to allow the construction of a prayer house.He wants to start it as soon as possible.
I do not get the point of it.
This might not be a bad idea.
Let's see what I can do.
I give you permission to do this.
The influx of immigrants has led to increased competition for jobs.Immigrants demand equal rights with local residents.The situation is quite acute.
They have no right to demand anything.
Why should they have equal rights?
Let's see what we can do.
It won't be easy, but we'll do our best.
The mainstream and recognized cultures of the $PROVINCENAME$ province have nothing to complain about, but minority cultures feel hurt and ask for action.
There is nothing we can do ...

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$, everything is fine, minority cultures have nothing to complain about, since everyone is given equal rights.Some people are protesting against such a system, but in general, nothing serious.
So there are those who are dissatisfied?
One of the neighboring countries has started making claims to you.This annoys us, and they should calm down, since they are the weakest side in this conflict.
Someday they will get tired of it.

Your generals began to complain about the poor nutrition of the soldiers and demand the allocation of large sums for this purpose.The generals say that insufficient nutrition lowers the morale of soldiers, and they want to raise it by improving the quality of food.This can cost us a lot of money.
They need to eat better in order to fight better.
Let's see how much we can allocate for soldiers' food.
This is not the first priority.
Maybe we can save on something else? For example, on soldiers ...

One major reports that most of his soldiers' weapons are too worn out, and asks to send inspectors to resolve the issue of writing them off.Our military budget is unlikely to cover the cost of purchasing new weapons for soldiers.
It is necessary to replace them with weapons.

In an ideal world, there is no need for weapons.Unfortunately, we do not live in a perfect world, and sometimes we have to defend ourselves.Will we choose defense by words or by force of arms? This choice depends only on us.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
We need to protect ourselves in the best possible way.
We will probably choose the force of arms.

A drought in one of our colonies sparked a debate between the colonial administration and the locals.The lion's share of water from local reservoirs goes to factories and plantations of the colony, leaving ordinary people without water for irrigation.The drought has been going on for weeks now, and tensions are mounting.It is possible to send some of the water for irrigation, but other countries will see this as a weakness.
Direct water to irrigate local farms
Sooner or later it will rain
Better to stock up on more water in case the drought continues

“It's just ridiculous that merchants who have settled in the colonies for a long time have special, and, of course, completely dishonest privileges to receive income from the colonies.All this has been paid for from our treasury, please note.Do merchants really have the right to profit by the former's right? ”\n \nIn parliament, the debate over the status of merchants and trade with the colonies ended in a fight when a supporter of one of the colonial companies lashed out at a free trade advocate who objected to preferences.Perhaps the time has come to revise the rules of trade with the colonies.
We must open colonies to free competition
Liberals in the Upper House Will Ensure Free Trade
Conservatives in the Upper House Will Ensure Order in the Colonies
Construction of a new factory in the colonies

One colonial development company has come up with a proposal to open a new factory in one of our colonies.The factory will help develop local production, but it is clear that several thousand acres of land will have to be taken from the Aboriginal people.We need to weigh the benefits of production and the possible damage from hostile, impoverished local residents.
The new factory is obviously a great boon
By force to drive people from their land?Not very noble!

?..and I affirm that the current rise in rebellious sentiments in the colony is the result of the constant, thoughtless harm that our officials inflict on local residents.After all, if we declare that our goal is to develop education and raise the standard of living in the colonies, so much the worse for us if the result is exactly the opposite of the stated goal.”\n \nThe hostility of local residents is growing in one of our colonies, and in the capital $CAPITAL$ , there are reports that the reason was the mistakes of the administrators in the colony.We could try to solve the problem by finding scapegoats in the colonial administration.However, the calmness of the bureaucrats may be more important than the satisfied natives of some godforsaken colony.
We need effective, honest and vigilant administration
Bad story ...oh, it's almost lunchtime.Who goes to play cricket after dinner?

“In the Congo Basin, in the depths of Bengal, in the jungles of India and on the coast of Java, science is discovering new species.The light of civilization reaches the darkest corners of the planet, and the secrets of the Creator are gradually revealed.Pick up a stone in any of the colonies and you will definitely find some exotic creature underneath.\n \nNew species of exotic fauna have been discovered in the colonies, and a proposal has been made to establish the Colonial Museum ofNatural History.
The idea is interesting, but it is very expensive.
Better to observe these creatures in their natural habitat

“The wealth of the colonies flows like a river into our treasury, but not only money brings the development of theNew World.The main benefit of being present in the colonies is all the new opportunities to test and apply our latest technologies.”\n \nA couple of philanthropists in the $COUNTRY$ country decided to establish a colonial exhibition, thereby glorifying our colonies, missionaries and our Empire as a whole.The question is how to present this exhibition - as a triumph of our technology, or as a salute to our great Empire?
Glory to industrial magnates and scientists!

“Here, in remote places, forgotten by God and people, barbaric customs, unacceptable for civilized peoples, are still strong.They reign among the natives on a par with illiteracy, unsanitary conditions and complete ignorance.”\n \nThe Colonial Administration has published a report on social policy in the colonies, and it is not very pleasant to read.Most people in the colonies live like the Dark Ages or worse.The Colonial Office calls for action.
I think resources can be better disposed of

“Discontent is brewing in the colony, despite the attempts of the governors to negotiate between the local authorities and the metropolis.The recommendations of the department for colonial affairs are as follows: it is necessary either to take measures to reconcile with the locals, or to deprive them of their power by transferring the colony under the direct control of the governor.”\n \nLocal residents in one of the colonies are dissatisfied with our situations.
We will not give in to threats and blackmail
We will try to reach a compromise

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$, things are going nowhere worse: the colonial police, pursuing suspects in the murder of an official, broke into the sanctuary.Apparently, it meant something to the locals.They are furious with disrespect for their religion.
Who cares about their religion anyway?

A regiment of colonial troops in one of the colonies is threatening an open revolt because of $COUNTRY_ADJ$'s displeasure with the commanders.According to reports from the military, local recruits find it difficult to adapt to the tough discipline of a modern army, but the dissenting opinion of the Colonial Affairs Directorate also mentions cases of beatings and misbehavior on the part of our officers.
A wave of riots in the colonies

“Perhaps there was something in the air this year.Some believe it was unusual solar activity, others just a chain of unfortunate coincidences.One way or another, in the $YEAR$ year, a wave of unrest swept through the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies like wildfire.”\n \nA wave of unrest is shaking the colonies, and action must be taken.Concessions to locals will cost you a loss of prestige, but it is difficult to refuse them.
We will make the necessary concessions for the sake of peace

Tensions in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ in the $STATENAME$ region have been on the rise for a long time, but recently a wind of change has blown.For some reason, it has become calmer on the territory, militant citizens are returning to work.Perhaps they considered the confrontation pointless due to our power, or the anger went away on its own.

The high hostility of the population in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ in the region of $STATENAME$ led to an emergency of national importance: clashes and looting spilled out into the streets.The situation could lead to mass slaughter if we don't take action.The colonial police are ready to intervene and restore order, but everyone is awaiting instructions from the governor.

“And the Department of Colonial Affairs strongly recommends reorganizing the aforementioned colony, otherwise it will finally slide into the quagmire of bureaucratic arbitrariness that has been going on for the past couple of years.In this case, embezzlement of the people's wealth, corruption and inefficiency will become the main attraction of the colony for many years to come.”\n \nOne of our colonies plunged into abyss of arbitrariness.The Colonial Office is proposing a reorganization, but this may not be well understood by the local authorities.
Leave the colony alone.I hope the situation will resolve itself ...
Reorganize the colony and take steps to prevent similar situations in the future

“Although anti- $COUNTRY_ADJ$ sentiment has been brewing in the colony for a long time, it has only recently erupted into open violence.Three colonial government officials have been killed in the past few months, and it is clear that this issue needs to be addressed or the situation will spiral out of control.”\n \nThe calmness of one of our colonies turned out to be deceiving.Riots among the locals and dissatisfaction with colonial rule will lead to an open uprising in a couple of days.The calm before the storm came to an end.

Lions, elephants, giraffes, bulls, panthers and rhinos - Africa's magical appeal has a lot to do with its diverse flora and fauna.Big game hunting has become very popular in the $PROVINCENAME$ province, generating income for the entire $STATENAME$ region and attracting new tourists.There was a proposal to invite foreign officials to hunt in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.The prestige of our country will undoubtedly grow, but the locals will not be very happy with the crowds of tourists on their plantations.
Don't wake up dashing while it's quiet
Hunting is part of the cycle of life and death

Heya safari! There is a lot to see in the wilderness of $PROVINCENAME$.Safaris have become very popular.Put on your helmet, get your saddle ready - today we will be on our way until sunset, or even before sunrise.The province of $PROVINCENAME$ attracts the European rich like a magnet: everyone wants to see the wonders of Africa in person.Modern steamers carry hundreds of them.The local fauna has been replenished with a new species - a European on a safari.
This will be great for our reputation!
Let's invite this ambassador ...how is he?

“And only then did I see how they were treating them ...only then.There was a child there, I remember him well.Eight years, maybe nine.They had production quotas.And that day he did not fulfill his.Don't ask why.I ...his hands ...! "\n \nThe society of the country $COUNTRY$ is shocked - a major European publication has published an article about working conditions in one of the colonies.The brutal exploitation of the locals, corporal punishment and injury from beatings - these methods maintain order in the colony, in the mines and plantations.They are hidden from the Colonial Administration through corruption and bribes.
We accept responsibility for the evil we have done

"Earth! Freedom! Labor! ”\n \nThe Colonial Office has proposed organizing a campaign to encourage emigration to the colonies, to increase the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ presence there.The department has found a suitable colony for these purposes, and it is only required to sign a decree.
I suppose you should start with business at home.

“I was born under the rule of the $COUNTRY$ state.All my life I wore $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clothes, learned $COUNTRY_ADJ$ language.And I am ready to die for my country."\n \nTradition to support the state $COUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ power is strong in one of our colonies, and several locals supported the proposal of the Department of Colonial Affairs: they are ready to form military regiments from local to maintain order in the colonies.
My loyal subjects, serve your native land better!
Great idea, you need to throw all your energy into its implementation

Banana boat, load it all night.The morning will dawn, it's time to go home."
- Song of the Banana Ship 
 
The expansion of colonial enterprises allowed many previously unknown goods to be brought to the metropolis.A banana boat has just docked in one of our ports, and the citizens are amazed at a sweet, strange fruit unknown to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ to the public.The holds of the ships are full of bananas.People are delighted.

“So if the government in the capital $CAPITAL$ could help us with our little business, we would be very grateful.?\n \nIndustry magnates have come up with an idea for the government - they have found a new way of robbery.One of our colonies has several acres of farmland, but it could be used more efficiently with modern technology.Of course, in order to sell these lands into the hands of the capitalists, the land will have to be expropriated from the previous owners.But this won't be a problem, right?
The client is always pr ...that is, we will think about your proposal.

“I can't understand why the government insists on spending thousands, if not millions, of pounds every year on imperialism and projects abroad that only burden our budget.We weren’t invited to the colony, and I don’t think we belong there.”\n \nThe murmur against the colonies grows louder in the $COUNTRY$ state, more and more people are questioning our colonial ambitions.Colonies appear to be a burden, not wealth, and it becomes more difficult to motivate people to settle in colonies.
Colonies are vital to our nation
We must start propaganda about the benefits of the colonies

Your soldiers are ready to deal with the last rebels.The province of $PROVINCENAME$ can be easily recaptured by one or two regiments.\n \nA man has approached you with an offer to provide information that will help you regain your former colony.For this he wants fifty gold.
All the horrors and bloodshed are behind.Your colonists can return to the province of $PROVINCENAME$.The last of the rebels are over, and peace reigns in the colony.

The harsh living conditions of the workers in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ irritate them and reflect badly on the attitude to work.\n \n “We suffer, the climate here is terrible, the work is exhausting, monotonous and poorly paid.Help us, shorten the working day, feed and pay us more ...otherwise ..."

The harsh living conditions of the slaves in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ irritate them and reflect badly on the attitude to work.\n \n “We suffer, the climate here is terrible, the work is exhausting, monotonous and poorly paid.Help us, shorten the working day, feed and pay us more ...otherwise ..."
The interference of missionaries in the religious life of the colony is perceived with hostility.The natives are protesting against this and are not going to convert to another faith.

It looks like the natives of the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have contracted measles.Cough, runny nose, fever, red eyes, and a red itchy rash covering their bodies are obvious symptoms of measles.They blame this on the colonists who brought them the infection, and they are probably right.

“The man was writhing in pain, his body was covered with a red rash, his eyes were red, and a hysterical cough threatened to suffocate him.?\n \n Residents of the province adjacent to the $PROVINCENAME$ province contracted measles, and now it has spread to your colony.People who are sick have coughs, fever, runny nose, and an itchy rash all over the body.
“It was you who brought us this disease! Our loved ones died because of your fault! "\n \nThe measles epidemic wiped out many, and the survivors are furious.Rebellions broke out in the colony.

One of the ways to fight the measles epidemic is to isolate all those infected and provide them with everything they need: handkerchiefs, drinking fluids and some orderlies, preferably from the colonists, because they are immune to measles.A small amount of money will be required to pay for the orderlies and for the purchase of scarves.
$PROVINCECULTURE$ indignant: the police shot the boy!

Discontent has been brewing among the population of the province of $PROVINCENAME$ for a long time, and now we are threatened with a social explosion - the local police tried to disperse the crowd that violated the ban on public gatherings.As a result, both sides used force, and a boy from the crowd fell victim to police fire.
The $COUNTRY$ state has better things to do

As a result of the government's citizenship policy, our soldiers are ordered to buy only those items that sell $COUNTRYCULTURE$.Because of this, the already difficult situation in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ is heating up: $PROVINCECULTURE$ have become a victim of government discrimination.

“Wake up, my sons.Arm yourself with righteous weapons! Shake off the chains that bind you! "\n \n $PROVINCECULTURE$ got their poet.He is worried about the low consciousness of his people, so he published the anthem of his native country, which quickly became popular with the movement of national resistance to our government in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.We could get rid of the poet, but the murder might be solved.How to be?

Schools in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are discriminating against: $COUNTRYCULTURE$ gets much more support, and $PROVINCECULTURE$ feels oppressed.Although such a policy contributes to our technical progress, $PROVINCECULTURE$ can decide on a variety of measures, including armed resistance, and put an end to our rule in these parts.

“And let the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people know that we will not calmly watch how they take our flock.?\n \nA local preacher in $PROVINCENAME$ is campaigning for national resistance to our government, but this is just another symptom of the disease.deeply struck society.In general, most of the priests in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have been protesting lately.
Pacify the priests with the law
Get rid of the main troublemakers

$PROVINCECULTURE$ - a minority of the province of $PROVINCENAME$, publish a newspaper.With the help of a couple of old press laws, we could shut it down, but our involvement will be obvious to everyone - maybe it's better to leave it as it is?
It's just $PROVINCECULTURE$! There is nothing to be afraid of ...
Cover the publication from sin away
First Farmers' Bank of the province $PROVINCENAME$

It is no secret that the $PROVINCECULTURE$ participating in the resistance movement receive support from the First Farmers' Bank of the province $PROVINCENAME$.The $COUNTRYCULTURE$ met with very strong opposition in the provinces.The resistance movement is very active, and the bank went so far as to put up land for sale, which only $PROVINCECULTURE$ could buy.There is talk in the local government about the nationalization of the bank, but fear of public discontent forced them to bring the issue to the state level.What shall we do?
Close it, but keep the investment of the farmers in the bank

$PROVINCECULTURE$ has founded an underground union of workers and artisans in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, and the local authorities are bringing this to our attention.It is necessary to stop the activities of the trade union so that production in the province does not stop, but such actions will cause discontent ...What to do?
We must take a bigger cudgel ...

Figuratively speaking, the ominous writing has long been on the wall, but the officials of the $PROVINCENAME$ province have finally received evidence: the locals are planning an armed uprising against the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government.The secret police managed to uncover plans for the uprising with the help of informants and double agents.What to do? We can fight the rebels in one, decisive battle, or try to break them up into small groups that scatter around the area.
We will fight them in a decisive battle
Break them up into small groups

A boy in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ learned the hard way that the officers of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ army should not be insulted.Having regained consciousness, the youth wipes the blood under his nose.The troops in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have caused the deterioration of relations with the local population.We could toughen up the charter, but there will be a sea of ??discontent in the capital.
The impudent got what he deserved

“To arms! Beggars, oppressed, hungry brothers from the province of $PROVINCENAME$.In the name of the Lord, we will drive out the accursed invaders from our native land! " Local aristocrats in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ are calling for the overthrow of our government.We could deal with them now, but maybe we should wait for a better moment.
We don't give a damn about their chatter

The renowned historian has published a history book about the province of $PROVINCENAME$.The book can become dangerous if read by $PROVINCECULTURE$, but we can influence its distribution.If we limit sales, then only the rich classes will get the book.If not, then most likely the majority of readers will be from the middle classes.How to proceed?

$PROVINCECULTURE$ is excited to the limit, and their leaders have gathered for a national convention in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.They demand independence, indicating that all $PROVINCECULTURE$ desires self-government and independence.In addition, they claim that their people's rights have been suppressed by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ yoke.

Roadworks in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ threaten to lead to conflict - the problem arose from the language of the road signs.Local authorities believe we should use our language, but some argue that we will offend local people if we abandon their language.Local names will make it difficult for the province to integrate into our state, but our language will certainly displease the locals.However we decide, locals will assume that all roads in the $COUNTRY$ state lead to $CAPITAL$.

A committee of businessmen and traders from the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has filed a complaint with the government in $CAPITAL$ about blatant discrimination in government procurement.Our government has a preferential policy, preferring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ to suppliers over $PROVINCECULTURE$.The committee represents the interests of artisans and capitalists in the provinces, and we might try to upset their alliance.
No time to meet them, alas

If the province of $PROVINCENAME$ were the hero of an epic play, then dark storm clouds would gather on the horizon.$PROVINCECULTURE$ and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ are minorities in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ on the verge of open confrontation.An emergency dispatch to the government in $CAPITAL$ requires government intervention.We can suppress radical organizations in the provinces, or we can wait, hoping that the situation will resolve itself.

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ weapons cache in the $PROVINCENAME$ province was found hacked and looted this morning.Among other things, an artillery piece was stolen.The $PROVINCECULTURE$ -partisans took responsibility for the action.Local officials now fear that if $PROVINCECULTURE$ revolts in $PROVINCENAME$, they will be heavily armed.In addition, this incident can give courage to an already radical movement for independence.
Take action to replace stolen weapons

The sabotage damaged industrial facilities in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.Factory representatives believe $PROVINCECULTURE$ is behind this.We have no evidence at the moment, but a serious investigation could clarify a lot, although it will require significant costs.
Arrest the first suspects you come across as usual

The philosophy of "organic work" originated in occupied Poland in response to the suppression of Polish national culture by the Prussian and Russian authorities.Philosophy, based on the principles of positivism of Augustus Comte, Herbert Spencer and John Stuart Mill, argued that productive labor, not revolution or rebellion, is the basis for the development of national identity and, as a result, through peaceful struggle, will lead to national liberation.Both in Poland and in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, people follow these principles.
Let the movement develop on its own

$PROVINCECULTURE$ has risen! The armed actions of the local nobility against the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities quickly grew into something more.The peasants of the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have taken up calls for allegiance to the state of $COUNTRYNAME$ and rebelled against the rebellious nobility! The peasant bands quickly gained the upper hand.Now we can intervene and suppress the uprising, or we can let the peasants get rid of the aristocrats.The latter will save us from some of the rebels from the nobility, but it may not like the rest of the powers on the continent $CONTINENTNAME$.
Sooner or later it is necessary to intervene

This was expected.Rumors circulated in parts, and sometimes, as soon as the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ officer entered the room, even the most lively conversation fell silent, as if stumbling upon a blank wall.The $PROVINCECULTURE$ officers in the $PROVINCENAME$ province are becoming more and more fond of the ideas of nationalism and separatism, and we have proof of this.You can ignore this for the time being, or get rid of the most ardent nationalists among the officers.

The watch shows five to twelve.He looks across the square, unafraid of the raging crowd, climbs the podium and begins his speech.He talks for hours - about his nation, its oppression, the reasons for oppression and the future.He chooses words that leave reckless confidence in his rightness.$COUNTRY_ADJ$ gendarmes rush into the square, and soon the man is no longer on the platform.Somewhere far away in the city, the clock struck twelve.The young nationalist was arrested.What to do with him?

They move slowly.Sometimes they wander around, not caring about compliance with the statutory discipline.If you turn to them, they grudgingly salute - quickly enough not to violate the charter, but so slowly that it becomes clear that their loyalty is in question.They are, $PROVINCECULTURE$, not $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers.

$PROVINCECULTURE$ has received the full support of a literary club in another country, which maintains secret ties with the inhabitants of the province of $PROVINCENAME$.We could take steps to isolate the province of $PROVINCENAME$ from outside influences, for example by allowing the secret police to scan mail.However, this will spoil relations with the aforementioned foreign power.We can ignore the problem and allow disgruntled citizens to establish contact with foreign countries.But this is not a good idea.
The secret police will fix the situation

$PROVINCECULTURE$ created a small patriotic organization that is gaining popularity in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.They claim that they are only engaged in coordinating their fellow tribesmen - the citizens of the country $COUNTRY$, in order to help the locals.However, we suspect that the organization secretly supports and promotes the struggle for independence.We could cover it, although that would increase the hostility of the population.

Until now, the $PROVINCECULTURE$ priests in the $PROVINCENAME$ province could conduct services in their own language.Our generosity seems to have been overwhelming: this privilege is used to spread anti- $COUNTRY_ADJ$ propaganda to the flock in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.We could issue a decree requiring the service to be performed in the state language, but that will infuriate the clergy.Should you do this?

$PROVINCECULTURE$ must be integrated into the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ state.To do this, the bright minds in our government came up with the idea of ??restricting the right of this minority and other national minorities to build housing and land ownership.While such measures will be very unpopular among minorities, they will speed up assimilation.Introduce building restrictions?
No, let them own land and build housing

Old man Jimala has figured out how to get around the ban on housing construction, which all $PROVINCECULTURE$ obey - he lives in a wagon.As soon as the authorities try to pin him down for violating the ban, he calmly replies that his house has not stood for a day in the same place, and thus is not a building.Every morning at seven o'clock, he moves the cart a couple of meters.We have become a laughing stock!

A foreign journalist visited old man Drzhimalu in his carriage, collecting material for an article about a man who lives in a carriage because of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ laws that oppress national minorities.The article attracted attention in the journalist's homeland, and the world is learning more about our anti-minority laws.

$PROVINCECULTURE$ assimilates more slowly than expected.One of the reasons is that their children are still learning in their native language.By ordering to follow the national standard of education, we can raise a new generation that will feel like citizens of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ state.

He pulls his hand away, as if surprised by the strength of his own blow.Everything is behind him - he is no longer angry, but rather frightened.She clenches her teeth and hisses, stammering in pain, with a strong accent: "$COUNTRY_ADJ$ pigs like you will burn in hell." These are probably the only words she knows in our language.The next day, the parents did not let their children into the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ school, claiming that there was a draconian order there.This incident became known as the $YEAR$ school strike in the $PROVINCENAME$ province.

In 1862.the physical culture movement arose in Prague, which quickly spread to other Slavic states.Officially, the movement was non-political, but in practice the Sokol movement was an important element of Czech nationalism and Pan-Slavic ideology.The movement pursued the goals of harmonious mental and physical development of the participants, and its meetings became platforms for the dissemination of radical nationalist ideas, for which the movement tried several times to suppress the authorities.
They don't belong in the province of $PROVINCENAME$!

She sneaks through the streets of a city in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, hurrying, breathing heavily.At the market square, makes a detour to throw off a possible tail.In every shadow there seems to be a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ policeman, or worse, a soldier.She runs through the city, and the illuminated clock face on the church tower seems to be following her with a huge yellow eye.She's late.Voices are heard outside the door.She knocks and the door opens.She sighs with relief - classes are still underway.\n \nThe underground university is based in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, where, despite the ban, they receive higher education in the language of the national minority.
Make every effort to close this university

“A house divided into itself will not stand.I believe that this state will not be able to exist for a long time, being half slave and half free.I do not want to say that the Union will fall apart - that the house will fall.I want to say that it will cease to be divided.He's all, entirely, will choose either one or the other." - Abraham Lincoln \n \n It's over.All attempts to find a compromise, decades of public discussion of the issue of slavery were in vain.Southern congressmen resigned this morning and slave states announced their withdrawal from the Perpetual Union.A strong wind blows from the south over our divided home.
Forward, under the banner of Dixie! Urrah!

"Although John Brown's body is rotting in the damp earth, the soul goes forward!" - "John Brown's Body", One of the Union Marches \n \nFormer abolitionist hero John Brown was hanged today in Charlestown, Virginia after a failed raid on an armory.By all accounts, Brown wanted to use the weapons from the workshop to arm the slaves who would raise rebellion throughout the South.The raid and the death of John Brown sparked violent unrest in the slave states, and in some of them there is talk of secession from the Union.

"Dred Scott, born a slave, a slave and remains ..." - Dred Scott vs.Sandford \n \nDred Scott, born a slave in Virginia, with the help of abolition lawyers sued his "owner", claiming that his residence in a free state is grounds for exemption.The US Supreme Court ruled the opposite - the rights of slave owners are protected regardless of where the slave lives in the Union.The lawsuit has sparked tremendous unrest among abolitionist northerners, who believe that the next step will be the expansion of the institution of slavery throughout the United States.

In a white dress, she walks through the streets of the province of $PROVINCENAME$.Her simple beauty and noble appearance amass rapturous glances.Her voice is smooth and gentle, like the scent of magnolia, soft like cotton, and benevolent, like a cozy veranda where you can relax.The embodiment of virtue, honor and dignity - such are the women of the South.Let's raise our glasses to Dixie!
For the working people of the South!

“There was once a land of skilled riders and cotton fields.It was called the old South.There, in small corners, gallantry itself froze in bow.The last knights and beautiful ladies lived there.The last masters and their slaves.Now you can only read about it in books.Now this is nothing more than a dream that is difficult to forget.This is a whole world, carried away by the wind ..."- Gone with the wind \n \n developedNorth.Another culture in itself is not a sufficient basis for civil war, but it has become one of the main stumbling blocks between the Yankees and the Dixie.
I would like to be in Dixie

“And I want to be in Dixie! Hooray! Hurray! 
I will fight until the end, until the very end ..."
 
- Dixie Land 
 
They say that the word" Dixie "for the South of the United States comes from the Mason-Dixon line separating the states of Maryland, Delaware , Virginia and Pennsylvania.The split between theNorth and the South, which took place under the Mason-Dixon division, determined not only the boundaries of slavery, but also national identity.

"Yankee Doodle is riding us, 
Ride on a pony.
Hot round with a feather 
He called macaroni." Yanke, which means 'little Jan'.In the 19th century, the word was often used to denote cultural differences between northerners and southerners in the United States.
Follow the eye in the night

"When the day grows again, and the quail calls, 
Follow the eye in the night.
There awaits the old man who brings freedom, 
When you follow the eye in the night." 
 
-Follow the eye in the night 
 
 According to legend, the song "Follow the Eye in theNight" was written for escaped slaves who fled from the South to freedom, to theNorth.The song said to follow the "eye in the night", that is, the pole star.

A local circle of a secret society dedicated to promoting the interests of the South of the United States through the spread of slavery - "Knights of the Golden Circle" - has appeared in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.We could try to stop their activities, but the locals may perceive this as a violation of the traditions of the republic.
Terminate the activities of the company

The American Anti-Slavery Society, founded in 1833, was the foremost anti-slavery organization in the United States.There were many famous members in the society - Frederick Douglas, Abby Kelly Foster.The organization held meetings, speeches, and published a weekly newspaper from 1840 to 1870.with the aim of eliminating slavery in the United States.Now the company has a branch in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.We could try to stop their activities, but the locals may perceive this as a violation of the traditions of the republic.
Terminate the activities of the company

"We consider the truths to be self-evident: that all people are created equal and endowed by the Creator with certain inalienable rights, which include the right to life, freedom and the pursuit of happiness." - Declaration of Independence, 1776 \n \nDim light in a room with damp walls.Stinks of sweat and unwashed bodies.The cramped room, hung with chains and ropes, suggests what kind of trade is going on in this market.One by one, the tied up blacks are pushed onto the dais, where bargaining begins.Here people are herded like cattle to be sold into slavery.

A long leaflet describing the contradictions between slavery and the constitution is being circulated in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.If this continues, discontent will grow among the lower classes among whom these leaflets are being circulated.However, an attempt to ban it will be perceived as trampling on freedom of speech.The local authorities will be angry.Let's try to limit the distribution?

"Where I am!?" - the man wakes up screaming.When he is told that he was found unconscious a couple of yards north of the $STATENAME$ line, he starts laughing, occasionally coughing."$STATENAME$.I am in the $STATENAME$ state.Dear God, I'm on the $STATENAME$ state! " The man turned out to be a fugitive slave from a plantation south of the Mason-Dixon line.He is injured, but he managed to survive.God alone knows what he experienced during his escape.Federal law, however, requires the return of the slave to its owner.
He will remain in the state $STATENAME$

The so-called "Underground Railroad" is a secret abolitionist organization that aims to help runaway slaves on their way to the free states of theNorth.We have reason to believe that they have begun to operate in the province of $PROVINCENAME$.We could put pressure on local politicians to start fighting their activities - but by doing so we risk causing a surge of abolitionism in theNorth.

The Copperheads are a faction of Democrats in the northern states of the United States that were opposed to military action during the Civil War and leaned towards peace with the South.The trade unions gave them a nickname, calling them poisonous vipers, but soon they themselves began to call themselves copperheads.While there is no war yet, some circles in the $PROVINCENAME$ Democratic Party are strongly opposed to abolitionism.We could launch a political campaign there to neutralize their influence, but this will displease the southerners.
We have better things to do
Have a constant debate with the copperheads

The newspaper "Liberator", founded in 1831.W.Harrison, became one of the most famous newspapers campaigning for the abolition of slavery in the United States before the outbreak of the Civil War.Although the circulation of the publication was small - only a couple of thousand copies - it became famous for its unwavering commitment to the ideas of abolitionism.The Liberator came out and the slavery debate erupted with renewed vigor.
The power of the slave owners

"The power of the slave owners" was called the power of the landowners-slave owners, the "aristocrats" of the south of the United States.Many northern politicians viewed slavery not only as a trampling on the rights of blacks, but also as a policy that fundamentally contradicted the ideals of the republic, set out in the documents on which the United States of America was based, and therefore, as the highest threat to the country's civil ideals.Senators of the South blocked the passage of the bill in the House of Representatives today.Small as it is, it clearly demonstrates the extent to which the southern states have influenced American politics.
Oh no! My act of collecting stamps!

During the fiercest slavery debate in parliament, some of the abolitionists organized emigration to the states of Kansas andNebraska to prevent them from becoming slave states.Choice sovereignty theory states that in the states, the question of slavery will be determined by democratic voting.These abolitionists have been called freestaters and are now appearing on the $STATENAME$ state.
Let them settle where they want
Issue a decree to stop them

Fire engulfs wooden houses and huts, illuminating the starry sky with an orange haze.Smoke drifts over the city.He drives down the main street, casting trembling shadows."Come out where you are!" he shouts.Somewhere far away in the city, shots and screams of the dying are heard.Border bandits, intending to make the state of $STATENAME$ a slave state, crossed the border of the province of $PROVINCENAME$ and attacked a small settlement.
Issue a decree to stop them

In the province of $PROVINCENAME$ there are clashes between frontier bandits and freestaters over slavery, and the number of victims is growing.In the future, these events will be called the Bloodshed in $STATENAME$ - they will draw the attention of the entire nation to the issue of slavery.

The $STATENAME$ state bandits attacked a small settlement in the $PROVINCENAME$ province with the aim of driving the abolitionists out of the $STATENAME$ state.Hundreds of people died in the battle - these events will go down in history as the War in the $PROVINCENAME$ province.
It's a black day for the $STATENAME$ state

The balance of power between freestaters and frontier bandits influences politics throughout the Union.To achieve their goals, the abolitionists organized in the state of $STATE$ the company "Emigrant Aid", which is supposed to help freestaters settle in the new territory.We can expect an increase in the number of freestater settlements in the future.

The bandits gathered around William Clark Cointrill attacked a freestater settlement in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ and burned it to the ground.The $PROVINCENAME$ massacre is just a minor episode in a long-running conflict between slavery-supporting bandits and abolitionist freestaters in $STATENAME$.
A hundred people from the Potawatomi Shooters, an abolitionist militant squad, attacked the "frontier bandits" in the province of $PROVINCENAME$, destroying their settlement.

Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel Uncle Tom's Cabin, published in 1852, has become one of the most famous books to condemn slavery.His influence on the awareness of the problem of slavery in society was so great that, according to witnesses, Abraham Lincoln, when meeting with Stowe at the beginning of the Civil War, greeted her with the words: "So you are the little lady who started this big war."
So you are that little lady ...

Today the Supreme Court ruled that the 1839 rebels.on the Spanish schooner Amistad, the slaves, who later ended up inNew York, only defended their freedom - given the ban on the Atlantic slave trade.The case was a major victory for the abolitionist movement, and public awareness of the issue of slavery is growing.
The $FROMCOUNTRY$ state has applied to join the United States as a state!

Yesterday morning we received aNotice from the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Congress applying to join the United States as a state.State constitution and boundary map are attached.Most believe that we will not refuse the $FROMCOUNTRY$ state to join our glorious state.
The people are right as always!
Our coastal waters are once again open to seafaring, and Scott's Great Serpent is no longer threatened.Hooray!

The influx of settlers into the Black Hills led to an escalation of conflict with the local Sioux tribes.Today we have received notice that the Indians have formed a major military alliance in Dakota, led by a chieftain named Sitting Bull.
Well, let this be their last fight

Sitting Bull and his brave warriors surrendered, the Sioux are defeated.Although skirmishes with their tribes will continue, the Sioux spear is broken forever.Never again will they gain such strength, and their future is on the reservations.It is a little sad to look at how from this once great nation there is only an entry in the history textbooks of our young republic.

Apaches inNew Mexico, led by a man named Victorio, rebelled and killed several settlers throughout the state.The white man's invasion of the native lands of the Indians provoked a conflict, and the Victorio gang refuses to surrender to the mercy of the United States.
Sooner or later they will have to surrender

The famous partisan, warrior of the Apache people Geronimo today surrendered to Captain Henry Lawton, along with a small group of men, women and children.Now that Geronimo has surrendered, the last spark of Apache resistance in the West has died out.The once proud people are subdued.And many years later, on his deathbed, Geronimo will tell his nephew that he has always regretted his decision to surrender to the authorities.

?..we will not accept our situation, we will not calm down and will not be silent! Give women the right to vote! ”\n \nThe development of liberal thought and feminism in the past years has allowed women in $COUNTRY$ to unite in an organization of suffragettes demanding the right to vote on an equal footing with men.All over the $COUNTRY$ country, women are no longer content to be housewives and homemakers and demand the right to work, to own property, and to vote.
If only the society would support these ideas ...

A small women's organization convened an international congress on women's rights.The meeting in $CAPITAL$ lasted two days, both women and men participated in it, but on the first day only women could participate.On the second day, the tactics of the political struggle were discussed.Although there was no consensus among the delegates, Congress nevertheless passed ten resolutions containing demands for equal rights for women in family law, education, labor law, and religious and moral issues.
The Secret Police Should Stop These Dangerous Revolutionaries
Show support for the women's parliament and its resolutions

Several women delegates attended the World Conference for the Abolition of Slavery, who were also members of the Parliament for Women's Suffrage.Before the start of the conference, the men decided to vote to exclude women from participating in it, and women delegates and listeners were allocated separate places where they were not visible to men.Some of the male delegates protested against the removal of the women, and when their protests were rejected, they decided to sit with the women in the designated seats.

When the war broke out and all able-bodied men were drafted into the army, many women were able to get jobs outside the home.But they saw that they were paid only half of a man's wages, and began to demand equal rights with men.

Rumors of a conference at which women discussed the issue of women's suffrage turned out to be true.The conference lasted two days and was attended by both men and women.The question of whether to demand suffrage for women was discussed, and opinions differed.In the end, the delegates managed to pass ten resolutions.In sum, they demanded equality for women in family, education, work, religion and morality.

“With the weather in the city of $CAPITAL$ we were terribly unlucky: mud, mud and more mud.There was a sea of ??mud, among ourselves we later called this event "The March of Mud".This is how one suffragette described a demonstration in which more than three thousand women from various organizations took part: weavers, members of the temperance league, actresses and many others.
Newspaper Special: March of the Dirt

A newspaper delivered to you from a neighboring province reports: “The Mud March was fun enough despite the bad weather.An extended procession of women, covered with mud from head to toe, was enlivened by the red and white spots of ribbons, bows, bouquets and kerchiefs.White banners with slogans written in bright red letters fluttered over the rows."

Two societies arose from the third.They call themselves theNational Association of Suffrage Societies and theNational Association for the Right to Vote for Women, orNUWSS andNSWRV.Both associations are fighting for women's right to vote, butNUWSS is ready for more drastic measures.NSWRV also advocates simplifying the divorce process and ending discrimination in employment and pay.
