“A woman does not own personal property, and her personality ceases to exist in the eyes of the law, since husband and wife, according to the law, become one person.We want to change this, we want a woman to be able to dispose of her property as she wishes.We want the courts to recognize husband and wife as two different legal entities.”\n \nThe woman sat down and was rewarded with a standing ovation from the audience.

"Thanks for the support!" “We couldn’t have worked without you.?
 
 “Great! Give them a finger and they will bite off the whole hand." “It will end in tears.?
 
Everyone, enthusiastic and angry alike, expresses their views on the property law of married women.In general, public opinion assesses this law positively.

“Sir, if you are saddened by the fact that student number 156 is wearing a bonnet, I will gladly take off my overly conspicuous headdress and sit in the back rows.But I will not leave the lecture on my own.”\n \nThe woman stared into the professor's eyes until he relented, then sat down.She was the first woman to go to university, and many students disapproved of her.When she submitted her introductory statement, the faculty put the question to the student vote, and the students decided it was a joke.Now she has to endure ridicule and rudeness.Other women are also seeking the right to attend university from the state.

“Sir, if you are saddened by the fact that student number 156 is wearing a bonnet, I will gladly take off my overly conspicuous headdress and sit in the back rows.But I will not leave the lecture on my own.”\n \nThe woman stared into the professor's eyes until he relented, then sat down.She was the first woman to go to university, and many students disapproved of her.When she submitted her introductory statement, the faculty put the question to the student vote, and the students decided it was a joke.Now she has to endure ridicule and rudeness.Other women are also seeking the right to attend university from the state.
Pressure on the upper house to bring it up to discuss the issue of women's suffrage is growing.NSWRY files petitions almost every day and is doing everything it can to get things going.
We will carefully consider this issue.

“Four broken windows, an arson attempt, an attack on two police officers ...The police officers were not injured, but their dignity must have suffered.What could have made you do this? " the policeman asks.
 The woman doesn't answer him.He sighs and walks out of the cell, but is stopped by another officer.
 “She hasn't eaten since she was brought in.What should we do? "
"Nothing so far.Bring her food and water, but don't force her to eat.When he gets hungry, he will eat everything."
“She still doesn't eat, and it's been two days.Why is she doing this? "\n" She's a suffragist.She's probably on hunger strike trying to draw attention to her demands."\n" So what should we do? "

“Come here soon! That suffragette ...she died! ”\nThis fragile creature could not stand the hunger strike and force-feeding.Public discontent with the practice of force feeding grew, and the government hastily passed the Cat and Mouse Act through parliament.This law allows the release of prisoners in poor health, and when they recover, the police have the right to put them back in jail.

The cat and mouse act angered the suffragettes, and they figured out how to prevent arrests.Their leaders formed a guard group of thirty women who knew Jiu-Jitsu, which they called "Bodyguards".Their training took place in secret so as not to attract the attention of the police.Soon after their creation, the "bodyguards" engaged in hand-to-hand combat with the police, who tried to arrest one of their leaders.This fight received widespread newspaper coverage, and pressure on the upper house to bring it up to discuss the women's issue reached its breaking point.

Their long and difficult struggle has borne fruit.The suffragettes presented their proposals to the head of the upper house, and he presented to parliament a draft political reform created on their basis.Your vote is the last and decisive one.Will women be equal with men in the face of the law, will they receive equal rights?

In your province, workers from several factories and workshops have formed a labor union that will take over the negotiation of wages, working conditions, resolving labor disputes, determining the terms of employment, dismissal and promotion of workers, pensions and benefits, labor safety and the relationship between workers and employers in general.

“We want bread, but we also want roses!?\n \nWomen surrounded the factory, shouting slogans and holding up posters with these words above them.The work in the factory is exhausting, repetitive and dangerous.After changing the length of the working day, the owners decided to cut wages and lay off half of the staff, so that the workload on the rest doubled, and the wages almost halved.Soon the workers went out to protest.
Give them bread, but not roses

This factory is known as the Slaughterhouse.Fatalities occur on it every day, mainly due to moving cranes.Latent dissatisfaction with poor safety at the factory and price cuts sparked a strike that killed more than twenty people.When the workers learned about the cut in wages, they demanded an explanation, but the authorities refused to talk to them.The angry workers decided to go on strike.In response, factory management hired strikebreakers and private security guards to protect them.When the first batch of strikebreakers arrived at the factory, workers greeted them with stones and curses.The police arrived and the strikers engaged in a bloody battle against them and the private guards.As a result, twenty people died.

“Eight hours of work, eight hours of rest, eight hours of sleep!?
 
 “We want bread, but we also want roses!?
 
The slogans that were heard on the streets in the neighboring province are now heard in your room.

"The chemicals we work with in the factory are taking my health away." “It’s dangerous even to be in a factory, let alone work there!?\n \nThe protesters are demanding higher wages and better working conditions, but the owner of the factory does not want to do this.For a modest sum of 50 gold, you can rebuild part of the factory so as to partially improve working conditions.
People took to the streets to show their support for various labor unions.This is a peaceful day, people rejoice and remember past battles.

"Attention attention! General strike in the city of $CAPITAL$.The workers are demanding higher wages.Attention attention! General strike in ..."\n \nSocialist newspaper" Forward! " comes out in $CAPITAL$.It publishes news about strikes, news of politics and the world socialist movement.
They also say that the left doesn't control the press ...heh.

Despite strong criticism, the proposal was accepted and a steering committee was appointed.Its mission: to createNational Workshops to help the unemployed.\nThe firstNational Workshops opened just a month after the first meeting.About a thousand of the unemployed were able to get a job directly in one of the workshops.The rest were not so lucky, and they returned home hungry, tired and dissatisfied, bypassing all the workshops.Everyone who could not get a job in the workshops was promised to distribute bread.After a while, the workers were promised money instead of bread.This was a huge mistake.

The workers, joined by sympathizers, took to the streets in spontaneous protest.National workshops were closed and workers protested against the abolition of government payments.When the government used force, the protesters retreated, settled in houses and erected barricades.The uprising is growing every day.

Workers in several factories and workshops have formed a union that will take over the negotiation of wages, working conditions, resolving labor disputes, determining the terms of employment, dismissal and promotion of workers, pensions and benefits, labor safety and worker relations.and employers in general in your province.
There is a proposal to make the province of $PROVINCENAME$ self-sufficient in grain and start exporting it.For this it is necessary to establish several new agricultural settlements.

The infamous Ben Mussol leads a small group of guerrillas called Blackshirts because of their uniforms.They are dragging your army into petty skirmishes that have already resulted in casualties and discontent among the soldiers.
The Blackshirts, led by their leader Ben Mussol, march into the capital of $CAPITAL$, causing riots along the way.

A group of soldiers calling themselves the Freedom Corps succumbed to blackshirt agitation in the neighboring province and rebelled against you.This is more of a misunderstanding than a real threat, but still something needs to be done.

Excerpts from the newspaper “I am everywhere?
 
 ?..our country must maintain a strong army and use it without hesitation to defend and defend national interests.The army needs ..."," ...to unite our country, annex territories that rightfully belong to us ..."," ...children are our future ..."
 
This newspaper preaches jingoism, fascism and irredentism.This is a real propaganda leaflet.

After they roused the province and caused riots there, the Blackshirts attacked a group of peaceful socialists and liberals.The Blackshirts took them hostage, dragged them to a secluded spot in Central Park, and executed them.

This misunderstanding, which calls itself the Freedom Corps, decided to prove to everyone the seriousness of its intentions.They attacked a group of peaceful socialists and liberals, took them hostage, dragged them to a secluded spot in central park, and executed them.Now this is not just a misunderstanding.

“No one should be hungry or cold.?\n \nYour attention was drawn to the free canteen on the corner of the main street.The hungry and unemployed are given hearty and abundant food.It is accompanied by pamphlets with fascist propaganda.

Noise, clinking of mugs, drunken voices that at times add to songs ...This is the atmosphere of a large beer hall.The door suddenly flies open and a group of blackshirts rushes into the hall.
 
 “There are six hundred people here.No one will get out of here! "
 
One of the intruders jumps up on the table and starts shouting something about revolution, the unification of the nation and the formation of a new government.He and his accomplices manage to attract some visitors to their side.They are excited and ready to take part in the next revolution.

?..and how has our party today helped the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ workers when the people demand reforms and social justice, in the midst of hunger strikes and the exacerbation of the class struggle?Nothing but vague promises! Colleagues, for this reason, and for many others, I can no longer call myself a liberal.I am a liberal in the true sense of the word - I am a socialist.”\n \nA group of radical members of the upper house of parliament decided to organize a socialist platform, demanding social reform, equality and brotherhood of workers.We could put pressure on their political party to bring the troublemakers in line.
Let them do as they please

“Social Democracy is just a name.Although the party is trying to maintain the illusion of democracy, it is obvious to any sane person that they are ready to betray parliamentarism for the sake of senseless mass protests and ridiculous dogmas, and they themselves are mired in corruption.If the barrier collapses in their path, let the people know that there were those who opposed these scoundrels.”\n \nA number of dissatisfied members of the upper house opposed the socialists for their rejection of political reforms.We can influence the composition of the new opposition faction.

?..and nevertheless our conservatives argue that the lower classes cannot - due to lack of education, moral values, social consciousness - vote for their representatives.I’ll say this is just a chicken-and-egg argument.If providence wished for these classes to be represented in our chamber, perhaps they would have done much harder to eradicate deficiencies in education and conscience.”\n \nAgitation in the upper house today has led several members of the liberal faction to split from the mainstream due to the reform of the electoral system.More and more people in society are striving for universal suffrage.

?..so, my old friend, we need your support in the upper house to pass the law.?\n \nLiberals in the upper house are trying to enlist the support of doubting representatives from other parties to pass legislation to lift the ban on public gatherings.They managed to achieve some success - what should we do in this situation?

?..I have seen red flags on the streets of $CAPITAL$, and I am sure that the only way to combat the threat of socialism is through a policy of appeasement.?\n \nA group of liberal reformists in the upper house decided to go over to the side of the socialists on reform issues trade union legislation.They argue that our current policy does not allow the public to voice their opinions, and labor law reform is needed to protect workers' interests.For these purposes, they create a parliamentary bloc.You can pull the strings in parliament to stop them.
There is no need for this

?..and I will ask again the question that this chamber cannot answer - what to do with the reform of the press? I and many of my colleagues have been demanding reform for a long time, but the assembly is unable to even answer our questions, let alone pass laws.”\n \n Reform MPs in parliament have formed a coalition to pass press law reform.Taking advantage of the fact that society supports the ideas of freedom of expression, liberals strengthen their position in the upper house.

“And that's why we can only firmly answer 'no' to further attempts at reform! We came to power for limited reforms, and now there is talk of reforms that will destroy the most ancient, most sacred foundations of our society.?fundamental reform of the political system.
Parties should rein in their freethinkers!

"...who is against?" \n \nAn interesting proposal for constitutional reform was put forward during an extraordinary session of the upper house.It is proposed that the composition of the upper house be coordinated with the ruling party.Apparently, in this way the currently ruling reactionary party is trying to seize power.
The legality of such a proposal is questionable

Debates about the bondage of wage labor are raging in the upper house, and the Socialist Party has the upper hand, campaigning for wage reform.Widespread support for further social reforms in society has led to the fact that the electorate is forcing politicians outside the Socialist Party to vote for the reforms - some of them joined the Socialist faction.Using political influence, we could have avoided a massive transition of deputies to the side of the socialists, but wide sections of the population will perceive such actions as dictatorial habits.
Let them go where they want
Liberal faction meeting calls for reforms

The Liberal Faction held a meeting to strengthen support for reform.Citing instances of government invasion of citizens' privacy, and arguing that the political system benefits a handful of those in power at the expense of the majority of the population, liberals threaten to block any bills in the upper house until their demands are heeded.Several representatives of other parties are inclined to support the liberals on the issue of political reform.Delay on our part will only increase public discontent with the slow pace of reform.
We need a multiparty consensus solution
Parliamentary Commission on Health and Hygiene

?..and I consider it a huge flaw in our vaunted system that working people are unable to provide either themselves or their descendants with even the simplest cleanliness.Dirty, soot-covered sheds in the shade of chimneys sticking out like mushrooms from the ground, but inside it is dark and damp ...This is an excellent soil for the spread of cholera, tuberculosis and moral vices.Even a limited health care reform, colleagues, will seriously improve the situation.”\n \nThere is excitement in the upper chamber that it is unable to carry out social reforms despite growing pressure from society.
Hush up the problem until the next election
Provisional majority in the upper house

“I think we can agree.?\n \nA provisional majority has formed in the upper house of parliament on unemployment benefits.In his speech, the conservative leading the majority spoke in favor of taking action, if only as an experiment.Citing public dissatisfaction with the conditions in which the unemployed find themselves, he argues that the deputies headed by him will support reasonable unemployment benefits.Liberals in parliament are unsure about whether to support the proposal, but refusal would anger reformists.
Strengthening Conservatives in the Upper House

“I suppose the only sensible solution to the current problem is to support my fellow Conservatives.?\n \nPowerful public support and growing militancy in society are helping to strengthen the position of conservatives in the upper house.Several members of the Liberal Party are considering moving to the Conservative faction, and only strict party discipline can keep the liberals in their places.

The red dawn is breaking in the upper house - more and more members of parliament support the ruling socialist party and want to cooperate with it.If we do not want the Socialists to gain a majority in parliament, it is time to act.
Intervene to stop going over to the side of the socialists

The Falangists are growing stronger both on the street and in the upper house of parliament.Several conservatives - voluntarily or out of fear - are considering going to the fascist camp.By preventing this transition, we will create hostility from the fascists.

The liberal minority uses the unrest in the country $COUNTRYNAME$ for political purposes, trying to win over the "left" conservatives in the upper house.The issue on the agenda is electoral reform, and some conservatives are ready to support the liberal party on this issue.
Let them do as they please

“And I believe that in order for our homeland not to be deprived of freedom, we must always be vigilant.?\n \nOne of the liberals in the upper house made a rousing speech, criticizing the government for its inability to cope with social tensions in the country.How will the government react?
We are not guilty of anything

A socialist demagogue, rising to the position of speaker, erupted into a long tirade in which he accused the government of failing to cope with social tensions in the country.He argues that under socialism, the people and the party will be one.
Perhaps we should learn from them

“And it’s nice to know that the established order prevails in our country for centuries?A conservative from the upper house gave a speech in parliament in which he was generous in praising our nation and its great achievements.
A reactionary from the upper house today turned to parliament, speaking about the need to return those lands that were ours since ancient times and rightfully belong to our people.

"...so that our traders and merchants have the right to trade freely on sea and land, and no government would dare to stop them." everything, finds support in society.We could use this opportunity to strengthen free market policies.His followers will be unhappy if we ignore the speech.

Today, in all cities of the country $COUNTRYNAME$, the law enforcement forces marched in orderly rows through the streets of cities in full uniform, demonstrating to each and every readiness to stand guard over law and order in this troubled time.Police departments have also asked the government for guidance on how to proceed in the future.How can we get the most out of this event?
We use it for propaganda purposes

Our country is weakened, but not our army.In the eyes of the soldiers at the parade, you can only see selfless devotion to the country of $COUNTRYNAME$ and the ideals of our people.These people, who are not ashamed to be called people with a capital letter, were brought up from childhood firmly believing in our people, and they are ready to die defending it.Glory to our home country $COUNTRYNAME$!

The soldiers hit the road, leaving their units to fight and shed blood in the great war.They are greeted by women and children standing by the road and at the train stations, they give the soldiers kisses, smiles and decorate their weapons with flowers.
Do not drag out the war

In workshops and factories, free $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people make new discoveries every day.The progress of science is associated with the free exchange of ideas, and there is no country in the world freer than $COUNTRY$.Thanks to this freedom, our country has become the center of technological progress.

Although our actions were called imperialist aggression, some even in other countries say that we only support the spread of freedom by expanding our state.The Foreign Friendship Society recently sent us a telegram congratulating us on our recent victories.What path will our nation take in the future?

In the $COUNTRY$ state, the aggressiveness of the population is growing, demonstrators take to the streets of $CAPITAL$, protesting against the government and calling for political and economic reforms.By sending police squads, we could prevent further violence.But our country has traditions - freedom of speech for each and every one.By demonstrating commitment to our principles, we will earn the respect of other powers.

A minute ago, they were marching, chanting slogans full of despair and anger.Now everything calmed down - the anger melted, the thirst for struggle subsided, and peace reigned.Whatever they say about the vices of our country, despite all its illnesses and old wounds, all people in our country work hard and equally share the joys and hardships.And the people finally understood this.

They shed sweat and blood and work with the greatest zeal every day for the good of our country, for the sake of its reputation.Our men and women are the best of their kind.They all recognize themselves as part of a huge country with a common destiny, a common future, and they know that hard work will be generously rewarded.Our ideals of equality have motivated our people to work harder this year.What should we do?
Keep calm and be proud of yourself

“The end of the war! Bread for the workers of $CAPITAL$! Farewell to arms! ”\n \nDemonstrations swept across the country $COUNTRYNAME$ demanding to stop the war and make peace with the enemy.Our country is based on the ideals of equality for all people.The demonstrators consider themselves a part of society and do not deny solidarity even to our enemies.

Our independence is constantly attacked and exists, rather, only on paper: several great powers are fighting for influence over our political institutions.There was a recent controversy over their right to conduct criminal investigations in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory.Great powers will have to assert their rights or they will lose influence.

A dispute has arisen between our country and other great powers over the country $FROMCOUNTRY$ over the right to conduct criminal investigations.We believe that we have the right to conduct them in the $FROMCOUNTRY$ state without the intervention of local authorities or foreign states.Of course, our rivals dispute this right.There is little choice - you need to either confirm our influence, which will be perceived as trampling on $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ independence, or retreat, which will lead to the loss of influence in the $FROMCOUNTRY$ country.

Our country is one of the greatest great powers.From Mr.$CAPITAL$ to the farthest outskirts, our flags fly proudly in the wind, striking fear into the hearts of our foes.In order to demonstrate our greatness and fair rule, we will hold an imperial parade in the capital.The question is: is it worth inviting foreign delegations, or are other nations not worthy to take a place in the sun next to us?
We are self-sufficient, be famous for $COUNTRY$!
Botanical expedition to the province of $PROVINCENAME$?

The flora in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ is beautiful and unique - and largely unknown to science.Here, in uncharted lands, riches await any botanist explorer who will challenge the harsh climate.The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Botanical Society would like to equip an expedition to the province of $PROVINCENAME$, but, as usual, there are not enough funds.Sending an expedition will expand our scientific knowledge.And keep in mind: we may have competitors ...
We have better things to do
Botanical expedition to the province of $FROMPROVINCE$?

It is rumored among botanists that the $FROMCOUNTRY$ state has sent a botanical expedition to the $FROMPROVINCE$ province.The flora in the province of $FROMPROVINCE$ is rumored to be extremely varied and interesting.Although $FROMPROVINCE$ is $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ a colony, we could try to send our people there as well.This may be frustrating, but the scientific discoveries are worth it.
The province belongs to the country $FROMCOUNTRY$

A botanical expedition sent by us crashed in Morocco - there was a hole in the ship, food supplies were running out.The head of the detachment sent a message to his homeland with a passing ship, requesting additional funds to continue the journey to uncharted lands.Provide him with funds?
Yes, in the name of science

"...and while some of the country's citizens cannot afford even that miserable minimum of food and clothing that they need to live, the government spends millions on expeditions to godforsaken corners of the planet in search of beautiful flowers!" \n \n?the upper chamber is raging with debate about the expedition we sent out some time ago.Liberals oppose it, pointing out the high costs that $COUNTRYNAME$ cannot afford.
The government does not give up on its goals

?..thus, our expedition discovered 20 previously unknown species of vegetation.Over the past two months we have lost several people due to malaria and intestinal infections, but despite the loss of comrades, the morale of the squad is high.Respectfully yours ..."\n \nThe Botanical Expedition reports on its progress.Obviously, despite their successes, they could use additional support.
Let them look for something edible
Scientists have been eaten by cannibals?

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ botanical expedition sent by us has not been contacted for a long time.Yesterday we received an alarming message: 
 
 “The camp has been abandoned.Traces of the struggle are visible throughout the camp.The chain of human footprints goes into the impassable wilderness.I believe the year is over for $COUNTRY_ADJ$ for the $YEAR$ Botanical Expedition.”
 
Our expedition seems to be missing.

The petals of the huge flower shine like a royal crown.The botanical expedition returned home with a new kind of flower.A flower the size of a human fist is now discussed throughout Europe.Gardeners are trying to grow it in their gardens.As a sign of respect for the tremendous assistance provided by our government to the expedition, the flower was named "$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Empress".The whole world envies our scientific discovery.

Today in the country $FROMCOUNTRY$ announced that they have discovered a hitherto unknown white flower, calling it "$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Empress".Now our expedition can hardly find anything that compares to the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ discovery.The expedition returned to its homeland - there are few results, but they are there.

The streets of Mr.$CAPITAL$ were decorated with spring flowers today in honor of the return of the $YEAR$ botanical expedition of the year.The expedition was an incredible success, they discovered and classified over a hundred new species of colonial flora.Our country has something to be proud of, our efforts have led to a breakthrough in science!

The Ottoman Empire is losing its status as a great power, and now it is called the "sick man of Europe."Nationalism and riots in the provinces of the empire, where the bulk of the population is not Turks, industrial backwardness from the states of Western Europe make many believe that the fall of the empire is only a matter of time.And the oppression of Christians in the Ottoman state led to the fact that the country $FROMCOUNTRY$ declared itself the protector and patron of all Christians in the east.Will we accept this blatant violation of our empire's sovereignty?
State $FROMCOUNTRY$ should give up this title
We have better things to do

$FROMCOUNTRY$ opposes our acceptance of the title of patron and protector of all Christians in the Ottoman Empire.We can keep the title despite protests from $FROMCOUNTRY$, but other countries will see it as a legitimate cause of war on the part of $FROMCOUNTRY$.If they declare war, and we lose it, then our new title will mean nothing.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ responds with a refusal to demand that he relinquish his title of patron and protector of Christians in the Ottoman Empire.We now have a legitimate reason to go to war with them, and we can strip them of their title by winning this war.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ relinquishes the title of patron and protector of Christians in the Ottoman Empire.Hope this helps to avoid war.
An Alliance for War in the East?

Tensions around the "Eastern Question" are growing, the problem of protecting Christians in the Ottoman Empire is also becoming more acute - we can create an alliance with other powers to solve these problems.But do we need him?
$FROMCOUNTRY$ proposes to create a large alliance of powers to protect the Ottoman Empire from encroachments on its territory.By entering into this alliance, we can provoke a war.What shall we do?
No, we can handle it ourselves

$FROMCOUNTRY$ requires excavation rights in the Valley of the Kings.Although our country currently has neither the money nor the technology for large-scale excavations, and it seems like a good idea to turn to a foreign contractor, it may be better not to disturb the ancient history of our people until we can do the excavation ourselves.However, a refusal to a foreign power will undoubtedly spoil relations with it.

The Egyptian government has granted us the exclusive right to excavate and research ancient ruins in the Valley of the Kings.The discoveries that will be made there will undoubtedly raise the prestige of our science in the eyes of the whole world.
The Egyptian government has denied us the right to excavate in the Valley of the Kings.We have lost our prestige in the international arena, and relations with Egypt have deteriorated.

Egyptian officials in Alexandria are preventing our expedition from unloading important excavation equipment at the Port of Alexandria.Egyptian customs is a legacy of the Byzantine Empire, and you cannot go through it without personal connections or money.We could go to the Egyptian government, but it might be better to pave our way with the usual bribes.

Our team of archaeologists in the Valley of the Kings in Egypt have discovered a tomb from the eighteenth dynasty of the pharaohs.The tomb is rectangular, divided into an upper and a lower hall with columns.A royal sarcophagus was found in the lower hall.Thanks to this fantastic discovery of our Egyptologists, the entire scientific world of Europe is discussing!

It is not clear why, but rumors are spreading faster, and now everyone knows them.According to rumors, a curse will befall anyone who disturb the tombs of the pharaohs in the Valley of the Kings, and some argue that our archaeologists threaten to bring a curse on the entire country $COUNTRY$.Undoubtedly, these are just fantasies, but nevertheless, there is a panic in society.
Also news to me! What's next, the comet?

?..having opened the granite door to the tomb, I breathed in the air that had stagnated for three thousand years.As far as I know, I was the first to disturb Pharaoh's sleep since he was buried millennia ago.The ancient air was filled with the smell of wheat from the fields of theNile delta, spirits in alabaster vases and decayed papyrus.”\n \n $COUNTRY_ADJ$ archaeologists in the Valley of the Kings discovered the century - they were the first to discover the tomb of the 19-year-old pharaoh Tutankhamun.

Our archaeologists in the Valley of the Kings have discovered another tomb, and in it - the mummified remains of the high priest from the times of the nineteenth Dynasty.The inside of the tomb is richly decorated.This discovery is a great success for our Egyptian expedition.

“Then His Majesty refused to receive the ambassador and ordered to convey that he no longer had anything to tell him?\n \nA diplomatic conflict broke out between France and Germany over the inappropriate treatment of the French ambassador by the Prussian king, who was on vacation in Ems, Prussia ...According to rumors, the dispatch was falsified by German officials in order to provoke a war.

“For you, ancient lands,?she shouts, without opening her silent lips, “to live in empty luxury, 
 
And give me from the depths of the bottomless, Your outcasts, your downtrodden people, send me outcast, homeless ...?
 
The people of France have made a splendid gift to the American people.A huge bronze statue of a woman with a torch, 151 feet high, titled "Freedom to Illuminate the World." It was created by the sculptor Frederic Auguste Bartholdi.There is already a definite place for the statue on an island in the port ofNew York.From now on it will be called the "Statue of Liberty".
I give them a golden candle by the door ...

Our scouts discovered the burning remains of a Fortrekker convoy near the Bushman River a couple of days ago.Among the destroyed carts, we found the remains of Afrikaners - men, women and children.The spearheads at the site of the tragedy testify: this massacre, without any doubt, was the work of the Zulu Impi regiments, who came from the southeast.
They did not die in vain!

Emigrants are streaming through our colony on the headland to the new city of Johannesburg in the Witwatersrand, where the gold rush began.The influx of foreigners into these parts has caused clashes at the border, and, perhaps, this is a good reason to end the independence of the small border states.

One of the main causes of death in the 19th century was tuberculosis, an infectious disease that affects the human lungs.Today it is known to be caused by various strains of mycobacteria.Previously, they tried to explain tuberculosis by various reasons, from vampirism to "imbalance of vital fluids." An infectious disease, known since ancient times, was first described in 1020.Avicenna.Typical symptoms are chronic cough, fever, and hemoptysis.In the 19th century, the disease gained a romantic reputation due to the fact that some famous poets and writers were sick with it.
Hunger in one of the regions!

Although epidemics and widespread famine disappeared almost completely from Western countries with the development of the modern capitalist system and the developed division of labor, as well as after breakthroughs in agriculture, the most ancient enemy and murderer of man still reaped a bloody harvest in Europe and America in the 20th century.Of course, mostly among the poor.Hunger has broken out in one of our regions, and we need to act quickly.
Alas, I have already donated a coin

Usually, a person becomes infected with it through food or water, which is especially likely in conditions of poor hygiene, unsanitary conditions, in cramped housing.Typhoid fever was one of the deadliest diseases of the 19th century.Only in Chicago in 1891.typhoid fever claimed the lives of 174 people for every 100,000 inhabitants.The disease begins with a mild fever, and after a couple of weeks leads to internal bleeding and disturbances of consciousness, possibly fatal.Although advances in sanitation have over time eradicated the disease in developed countries, in $YEAR$ one of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ raions was severely affected by the disease.
Hygiene is not respected, people are dying

The Spanish Flu is a flu pandemic that killed 50 to 100 million people worldwide in 1918-1920.Due to the developed trade between countries and colonies, the strengthening of international relations during the 19th century, the Spanish flu spread throughout the world in a couple of years.The situation was aggravated by the First World War and the terrible living conditions in the trenches.The Spanish flu became the world's first and worst pandemic.By the way, have you had a fever lately?
Fight the disease with all your might

Smallpox, a highly contagious viral disease, claimed the lives of about 400,000 Europeans every year at the end of the 18th century.Successful vaccination efforts in the 19th and 20th centuries eventually led to the complete eradication of the disease by 1979, but that hardly will comfort your citizens who were affected by the $YEAR$ outbreak.
We will do our best.Every life is priceless!
Scientists believe that the explosion in the area of ??the Tunguska River in 1908, which destroyed the forest for many kilometers around, was caused by the fall of a meteorite or asteroid.
The eruption of the Krakatoa volcano!

The eruption of the Krakatoa volcano and the tsunami wave following the explosion claimed the lives of 36,500 people in the Dutch East Indies.The sound of the explosion was heard three thousand miles from the eruption, on the island of Rodriguez in the Indian Ocean.The entire world was affected by the eruption - the sky darkened over the entire planet, sunsets turned bright red, and the average temperature in the world dropped by more than one degree Celsius.

Today in San Francisco, California, a massive earthquake caused massive destruction and claimed thousands of lives.The tremors were felt in the interior of the continent as far asNevada, and the fire, which began as a result of the earthquake, completely destroyed the city.Troops deliver food to the victims.This earthquake will be remembered for generations.

The "trust" system - an organization of the punishment service, pioneered in Mississippi, and then in Texas, Alabama, Louisiana and other states - under this system, prisoners showing good behavior (often this meant obedience to guards) could act in the role of overseers for the rest of the prisoners.A rigid hierarchy was built like an army one.Some particularly reliable prisoners were even allowed to carry firearms.It was based on the exploitation of prisoners' labor for profit.The system was first used at Parchman Farm Prison in Mississippi, and as the twentieth century drew to a close as a modern and lucrative method of organizing prisons.As a result, protests against the widespread beating of prisoners led to the abolition of this system in 1970,
We beat - it means we love

The idea of ??isolating criminals and lawbreakers is as old as the world.In the old days, justice was often administered by expulsion from the kingdom as a last resort, and such punishment was often considered harsher than the death penalty.The rise of colonial empires in the 18th and 19th centuries led to a resurgence of these ideas in the modern form of a prison colony.Examples of it are notorious: the British colony of Botany Bay and the French "Devil's Island" in Guiana.The $COUNTRY$ state also owns some territories that could be used for such purposes.Should we create a prison colony?
No one escapes the Isle of the Damned!
I think there is a more humane solution
Since we no longer have territories suitable for exile, the prison colony was abolished.

“Two dirty rooms, three bedrooms ?eight square feet for men, nine by eight for women, and four and a half square feet for the rest.Beds of straw that have turned to dust, full of vermin, cramped conditions, no access to water.The petty thieves are in shackles - eight of them were women on my last visit.”
- John Howard 
 
The League for Prison Reform was formed in the $COUNTRY$ state - they are protesting against the terrible conditions in prisons and other correctional facilities in our country.The League requires solitary confinement and also proposes other measures to improve the living conditions of prisoners.
Are the prisons dirty? These are prisons!
It may be time for some reforms
First you need to secure a majority of votes in the upper house

$COUNTRY$ is shocked - a brutal murder in one of the regions was reported in the news today.A young girl, a prostitute, a client was beaten to death - according to rumors, the police are covering up the murderer, who is a member of an influential family of bankers.However, the police say that the investigation is still ongoing and the identity of the killer has not been established.The case is on everyone's lips, debates are taking place in parliament - representatives of the liberals demand answers from the government.
Demand the police to bring the culprit
Let's refrain from making unfounded accusations

They walk in single file along the roads, clinking with shackles.These are not slaves, but prisoners sentenced by the courts to forced labor under the scorching sun.They can be seen quite often in the country $COUNTRY$.Forced labor has been the most common form of punishment in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ courts for centuries.They say hard work will reeducate these cretins - and they work by the sweat of their brow.
We should think about more humane ways of punishment.
Fine! Let's move on to the next issue on the agenda!

In one of the regions, an operation began to capture an escaped criminal - the convicted killer escaped from a local prison.The escape is bad news, but among other things, the incident brought public attention to the prison system.Debates began about crime and punishment.Liberals argue that the escape is only evidence of the terrible underfunding of our prisons, while the conservatives point to the limited budget of the country - and say that it is not worth spending a lot of money on supporting the worst members of society.

“And here is this prisoner.He started with the notorious lockpicks, then robbed banks.He will spend the rest of his life in prison, and we keep him in shackles all the time.I suppose in a couple of years he will go crazy with this if he hasn't already started.”\n \nLife imprisonment without the possibility of amnesty is a common form of punishment in the $COUNTRY$ state, but some in liberal circles, discussing the issues of crime and punishment, speak out in this spirit: a person in shackles can hardly be re-educated, because he is constantly tormented in unbearable conditions.A movement to liberalize prison legislation is developing.
We will do everything the old fashioned way

Since the beginning of the 19th century, imprisonment for debt was still the norm in Europe.There were many notorious "debt pits" in England, including the Fleet prison in London.In these correctional facilities, debtors often had to pay for both the cell and the bed, and sometimes the work of the jailer.Such extortions only worsened the position of the debtor, because it is not easy to make money in prison.This system was gradually abandoned in most European countries during the 19th century.In 1846.Fleet prison was demolished.The unjustly convicted $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocrat is now trying to draw public attention to these prisons, demanding their abolition.
The issue needs to be considered
I'm not convinced of anything.Such a lesson is good for people ...

Today, abolitionists have put forward new arguments during a debate in the Mr.$CAPITAL$ Reformers Club.They drew attention to the impossibility of canceling the sentence and the risk of the death of an innocent person.Liberals united in the Civic Committee for the Abolition of the Death Penalty.The reason for the debate was the recent execution of an old man convicted of murdering his wife, despite the fact that the man had clearly lost his mind from old age.Founded by the liberals, the committee requires members of parliament to speak out against "the worst injustice." They also demand that the Cabinet of Ministers clarify our position on this issue at the meeting.
I will be glad to meet them
I have no time to listen to the nonsense of liberal mattresses!
The first tractor in the province of $PROVINCENAME$

"Mother Mother! The old man brought a new car! It can plow, pull, push, you can ride it! He calls it a "tractor"! ”\n \nThe advent of the tractor in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has caused a revolution in agriculture - the productivity of farms has grown to a scale unthinkable twenty years ago.Truly, industry is a boon for the $COUNTRY$ country.

"Mother Mother! Have you seen the new lanterns on the main street? They hang them on lampposts - they say they glow from "electricity"! "\n \nThe electricity in street lamps has come to the province of $PROVINCENAME$.This new kind of energy is shining brightly in our cities.The productivity of enterprises is increasing, and the living conditions of local residents are improving.
Blasting operations in the province of $PROVINCENAME$!

"Mother Mother! Did you hear the sounds of explosions from the mine? They say this is a new explosive! "\n \nThe appearance of nitroglycerin and the development of mining equipment in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ have allowed the local mining industry to increase production several times.
New store in the province of $PROVINCENAME$

"Mama! Mama! They have opened a new store in the city! ”\n \nIn the 19th century, the system of distributing goods and delivering them to consumers from various walks of life began to develop rapidly.Thanks to the opening of new, specialized retail chains, consumers have gained access to manufactured goods from factories.A new store in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ will help local farms so they don't have to waste time commuting to and from the market.

"Mama! Mama! Dad says they have new tools in the mine! ”\n \nWith the invention of metal-cutting machines, new, efficient tools appeared in the mines.With their help, it is easier to extract the wealth dormant underground.The efficiency and production of minerals in the province of $PROVINCENAME$ has increased.
And yet let's not dig too greedy and deep
Archaeologist Heinrich Schliemann unearthed the legendary Troy in Turkey! This discovery contributed to a sharp rise in the popularity of archeology and captured the minds of millions.
In January 1837, the first population census was carried out in Switzerland.According to her, the population of the country was 2,190,258 people.

In August 1838, France demanded that Switzerland extradite the nephew of EmperorNapoleon I, LouisNapoleon, claiming the throne.Switzerland refused to do this, and only LouisNapoleon himself could prevent the invasion of French troops: he agreed to move to London.
Morse code was introduced in Switzerland in 1852.27 telegraph stations were opened throughout the country.
New means of communication in Switzerland

At the referendum, the majority of the country's citizens voted for the nationalization of the railways.
